loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha is 53 years old. She is married with five children aged between 15 and 35. One of them goes to school. She has been selling beer for five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy domestic animals such as cows.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Elmer Alexander

texts.es: Elmer de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar desde hace 5 años. Él es un joven que gracias a su esfuerzo y tenacidad ha logrado salir adelante apoyado en su trabajo de atención al cliente en un vivero, donde además se encarga de cuidar que las plantas estén en buenas condiciones climáticas. Elmer desea encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de la galera de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lamina y madera para encementar el piso y  colocar el techo a la galera de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elmer, 44, has lived in his own residence for five years along with his family.  He is a young man who thanks to his effort and tenacity has been able to get ahead supported by his work of waiting on customers in an nursery, where in addition they have charged him with making sure that the plants have good climatic conditions. 
Elmer wants to cement the floor and change the roof of the shed of his residence for which he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, sand, gravel, corrugated tin, and wood in order to cement the floor and place the roof on the shed of his house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, corrugated tin, and wood in order to cement the floor and place the roof on the shed of his residence.

loans.name: Union Carapongo Group

texts.es: “UNION CARAPONGO” es un nuevo grupo conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minoristas y con ansias de mejorar su calidad de vida. Gonzalo tiene 23 años de edad es soltero. Dedicado a la venta de fruta hace 04 años actividad que aprendió cuando apoyaba a sus padres. Años atrás se dedicaba a estudiar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas manzanas naranja tangelo fresas y de esa manera ampliara su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Gonzalo es el primero del lado derecho.
texts.en: "Union Carapongo" is a new group comprised of members who run small businesses and who are anxious to improve their quality of life. Gonzalo is 23 years old and is single. He has been working selling fruit for 4 years, and he learned to do this when he helped his parents with their work. Years ago, he studied. He will use the loan to buy more fruits such as apples, oranges, tangelo, and strawberries and, in this way, he will grow his business. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan they offered. Gonzalo is the first on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more fruit.

loans.name: Ilda Mercedes

texts.es: Ilda de 57 años de edad vive con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, la clienta vende sus productos a los residentes de la zona en la que ella vive, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, ilda solicita un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para continuar con sus ventas ya que es  su única fuente de ingresos y asi poder tener junto con su hijo una mejor calidad de vid.
texts.en: 57 year old Ilda lives with her son. She works selling clothing. She sells her products to the residents in the area where she lives. She uses the income that she makes from her sales to cover the household necessities. Ilda is requesting a loan to buy clothes wholesale so she can keep selling as this is her only source of income. In this way, she and her son can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a retail store owner while her spouse is a farmer. The family lives in Sampaguita, Solana, Cagayan. The couple strives hard to support the family’s expenses, especially for the educational needs of their children. Maria has six children and her youngest child is a first year student taking a Bachelor of Science in Physical Therapy. Maria is very supportive of all her children’s dreams. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay the tuition fees and allowances at school. Maria promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and allowances for her daughter

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in Concepcion, Iloilo. Marites earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business. She is also earning other income from her fishing and hog-raising businesses. For more than 20 years, these ventures have supported Marites and her family.

As of now, Marites is in need of additional capital for her businesses. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, to buy piglets to raise and to pay for the repair of her boat. Through this, Marites will be able to improve her businesses and make them a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, to buy piglets to raise and to pay for the repair of her boat

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 40 years old, married and has three children. Her family lives in Solana. 

Her second child is in college and taking up Information Technology. Leticia wanted to help her child achieve his dream.  She is now asking for 10,000 PHP loan to sustain the educational needs of her child. She will pay her child’s tuition fees. 

She will be happy to see all her children as professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to pay for her child's tuition.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 62 years old and a widow with five kids. 

In 2004, Victoria applied for her membership with PMPC.  After hearing of all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Victoria is asking for financial assistance in the amount of 5,000 PHP to restock products for her buy and sell business. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  

She has found financial assistance through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to restock products for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Mirrian

texts.en:
Mirrian lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Mirrian is single with two children. She runs her own business. She also does farming. She has been farming for ten years now and she is currently growing maize and eucalyptus trees. Mirrian is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating her crops. 

This is Mirrian's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Mirrian's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for poultry and farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biodigesters for resale

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is 32 years old. She is married, with three children between nine and three years old. Two of them go to school. 

Leonie is a decorator and has been running a business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tents, chairs and flowers for decoration. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more tents, chairs, and flowers for decoration.

loans.name: Climate Concern Ltd

texts.en:
Jean is the director of Climate Concern Ltd. Climate Concern helps community health workers to access clean light that doesn't harm children and pregnant women that seek health services from them during evening hours. Solar systems help them to charge their phone so that they can report health cases via Rapid SMS. Community health is performance-based incentive work and reporting frequently and on time allows community health workers to earn more incentives.

Community health workers need solar systems but have no cash. They would like to buy them in installments. Climate Concern has been giving them Barefoot products on loan but Climate Concern cannot help them all without a partnership with Barefoot. Climate Concern wants to reach at least 30,000 out of the 45,000 community health workers countrywide who need solar systems. This started in 2013 but the speed is not enough to reach all of them. 

Hands need to come together to save lives of pregnant women and children under five.

loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power solar lighting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale products, such as pesticides, fertilizers, seeds, and tools among others, to offer her clients a bigger diversity of products.

loans.name: Sushmita

texts.en: Sushmita is a friendly, enthusiastic and fun-loving girl. She came from a small family including her mother and a brother. Her father lives with her step-mother and she is pictured with her uncle and mother. She is 18 years old and has loved to travel, interact with people and learn new cultures since her childhood days. She always dreamt of travelling around the world by becoming an air hostess and now that dream has become a reality at her young age. With her mother’s consent, she took the interview for the cabin crew in Imphal and was selected by the Aviation Academy.  This profession is special to her because of the hospitality they deliver to their passengers. She has many moral supporters but financially, her mother was the only one who could support her, said she. Even though her mother is a government employee, she could barely maintain the household expenses with her weak finances. Sushmita is very much thankful to her mother for educating her in spite of the many difficulties they faced and giving her the platform to study and reach what she is today. Considering the situation, she strives forward until she achieves her goal. My mother has been the sole giver and there never was a time I could give anything to her, she said. She thinks this job will give her the opportunity to help her dear mother in financial matters. Nevertheless, she still needs to pay the security deposit to enroll in the training and has been disheartened by the thought of it. She sought help from family and friends and fortunately, her aunt suggested WSDS, which renders services like providing education loans to those who are needy. Now that she has availed the loan, she will be able to pay for the security deposit and join the training on time. She wishes to support her family when she starts earning and reduce their financial problems. She will repay the loan with her monthly salary. She is grateful to WSDS and Kiva for giving her the confidence to fly high and fulfil her aspirations.

loans.use: To pay a refundable deposit for training in the Aviation Academy.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 54 years old. She is known in the Tudela area for her vulcanizing shop. 

She is actively participating in the various programs and services that PMPC offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house and has applied for a loan to purchase hollow blocks, cement, nails and sticks. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, as all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase hollow blocks, cement, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago de 27 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 7 meses de edad. Él es un hombre que pone todo de su parte para sostener económicamente a su familia apoyándose en su trabajo de motorista de una empresa. Santiago habita en una vivienda humilde hecha de lamina, la cual se encuentra deteriorada por lo que él desea cambiar las laminas del techo y alrededores de su vivienda ya que siente que son bastante inseguras y dañinas para su pequeño hijo y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo y los alrededores de su vivienda de lamina.
texts.en:
Santiago, 27, lives in his own residence with his life partner and his seven-month-old son.  He is a man who puts everything into sustaining his family economically, helping himself with his work as a driver for a company.
Santiago lives in a humble residence made of corrugated tin which is deteriorated for which he wishes to change the tin of the roof and surroundings of his residence since he feels that they are very insecure and harmful to his little son.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized corrugated tin, wood and nails in order to repair the roof and surroundings of his corrugated tin house.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized corrugated tin, wood, and nails in order to repair the roof and the surroundings of his corrugated tin house.

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Carmen

texts.es: Esmeralda de 30 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que todos los días se esfuerza en preparar bien su venta de antojitos típicos para tener más clientes y mejorar sus ganancias cada día y lograr a si apoyar a su compañero con los gastos del hogar. Esmeralda desea reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda pero no cuenta con los fondos necesarios por el momento, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo del corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: 30 year old Esmeralda lives in her own home along with her partner and their 2 kids who are 4 and 8 years old. She is an admirable woman who works hard  and well every day preparing typical snacks of the area so that she will have more customers and improve her profits every day so that she can support her partner in paying the household expenses. Esmeralda wants to repair the roof of the corridor in her home but she does not have the necessary funds at the moment. So, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: laminated metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of the corridor of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of the corridor in her home.

loans.name: Onua Do Metal Works Group

texts.en:
John is the group leader and representative of Onua Do Metal Works group in Cape Coast of the Central Region of Ghana. John is 49 years old, and he is married with six children. His children are aged twenty-two, eighteen, sixteen, thirteen, nine and six years respectively in the order of their birth. All six children are attending school. 

John is a welder and fabricates metal works. He makes canopies and clean cook stoves for local people. John has been a client of the Field Partner since 2007 and has  completed the repayment of his ninth loan cycle. 

John wants to expand his shop, buy more equipment and employ more workers to assist him in the next five years so as to position himself to meet the demands of the business. Earlier he built his capacity in the Elsa Clean Stove building under the BeBi Project, ACP Science and Technology program, co-funded by the European Union. The Elsa Clean Cook stove has now become a household name within most rural communities of Ghana due to the benefits of the stove. Demand for the stove from more communities far exceed John's capacity to supply. 

John thus lacks the financial capacity to buy metal plates to produce more Elsa Clean Cook stoves to take advantage of the looming demand from household clients. If this hurdle is crossed, John will be able to have the requisite capacity to increase the production of the clean cook stove to meet the demand. A micro loan of GHS 4,500 will help John to purchase metal plates in bulk to produce enough Elsa Clean Cook stoves to meet his customers' needs. 

John plans to use the profit from the business for future expansion and also to meet his family needs. Elsa Clean Cook stoves use virgin pellets (palm kennel shells) which are free and a waste material in most of the communities of the household users. Supporting John in this way means assisting to reduce the cutting of trees for firewood and making of charcoal for cooking hence reducing deforestation in the stove user communities. John is grateful to all his micro lenders for their great support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase metal plates in bulk for manufacturing clean cook stoves

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is nineteen years old and is married. She lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe.

Sandra has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life-skills education in local schools to improve the well being of students by enhancing their learning environment. Moreover, Sandra rents a table at a local flea market where she sells buckets and other products. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to provide for her family.

With the Kiva loan, she wishes to increase her supplies such as cooking oil, matemba (small dried fish) and buckets. Her hope is to grow the business and open her store. This will bring stability to her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, buckets and matemba.

loans.name: Thingkangphai F Group

texts.en:
Here is a group of women from a place where people are mostly engaged in agriculture work and weaving as their main occupation. 

The featured borrower, Lamlhing, with her hand raised, is a weaver of the traditional wraparound commonly used by womenfolk at home and on occasions. Her husband is an army regiment pensioner and is now engaged in paddy field work while her only daughter teaches students at home as a private tutor to earn her pocket money. Lamlhing weaves traditional wraparounds to sustain her family. She underwent a major operation, so she stopped weaving for some time due to the post operation effects. After recovering fully, she started weaving again to generate income mostly to pay her debts for the operation and household requirements. “The family financial condition was never worse before the operation,” she said. She cannot produce like before since her strength is weaker than it was before the operation. So she weaves slowly and takes a break often. Now that she has more gaps in-between her weaving, she wanted to weave in the evenings to make her work faster. She wanted to continue her weaving at night for longer hours to speed up her work. However, her work had been affected by the irregular power supply and she could not work as desired. After sunset, her work was affected by the insufficient illumination, which led her to access a Kiva loan to buy a solar home lighting system, which is an excellent option to promote her production and at the same time, save extra expenditures on candle sticks, kerosene, etc. By availing the mini solar lighting system loan, she is now able to weave in the evenings like she wanted. The mini solar home lighting system is very productive, she said. She believes that by availing this loan, she will gain more income and get adequate money to manage the household requirements and clear her debts. The other group members engage in similar activities and needed the solar loan to improve their business endeavors.

loans.use: To buy a mini-solar home lighting system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married but has no kids. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past three years, she has operated a tea shop. She makes tea and flat bread and sells from her home to local customers. She faces a major business challenge of stiff competition.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sugar, beans and tea leaves for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans and tea leaves for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is supervising the renovation of their home. Rosa hopes to live comfortably with a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 20,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Rosa has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus, from Siquijor, Philippines, earns a living through his clothing sales. He is 27 years of age and single. He seeks to have enough inventory to continuously help his parents to provide for their family, especially for his siblings' education. For his capital needs, PMPC has stood by him since the start of his business. He is happy that he is able to survive the odds in business with determination and his family as his inspiration. To earn more, he applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventory to sell. Jesus hopes to live comfortably with his family, and with his savings he will get a college education.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory to sell

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат  женщина 45 лет,замужем,имеет троих детей.Мухаббат не хочет быть финансово зависимой от своего мужа и детей,поэтому занимается собственным бизнесом.В течение 17 лет Мухаббат занимается купле-продажей женской ткани для пошива одежды.Мухаббат приобретает товар оптом в Бишкеке,после чего продает одежду на базаре.У неё много клиентов,которым нравится её товар.Она арендует помещение на рынке.Мухаббат планирует закупить новую партию женской ткани.Но на данный момент она не имеет нужной суммы. Мухаббат надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на ее просьбу о помощи.
texts.en: Muhabbat is 45, married, and has three children.  For the past 17 years, she has been running her own business dealing in fabric for women's clothing as she doesn't want to have to depend on her husband and children for money.  She stocks up on fabric in Bishkek and sells it at a bazaar from a shop she rents.  She has a lot of clients who like her wares.  Currently, Muhabbat would like to replenish her stock of fabric, but lacks the money to do so.  She hopes that MDO Arvand will help her in her time of need.

loans.use: buy fabric for women's clothing

loans.name: Bill

texts.en:
A few years ago, a friend asked Bill for help creating a website. Seeing how promptly and professionally he was able to take care of his request, the friend started referring customers to Bill, setting the stage for Bill’s exciting new venture.

But Bill’s talent for marketing and design didn’t spontaneously spring from the wild blue yonder. For more than ten years, Bill worked in auto sales, soaking up knowledge about Internet marketing and design, as well as social media marketing on Facebook and Twitter.

Once he started getting referrals, his workload started to snowball. Bill credits his time as a mechanic in the army with teaching him the discipline and motivation needed to satisfy his customers as he has had to devote a greater share of his time to the business.

His greatest challenge faced has been procuring adequate capital to grow his business. Bill will use his Kiva loan for a much-needed software upgrade, as well as to finance the creation of a mobile app that will better help him interface with clients. 

With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Bill is poised to be the next great tech entrepreneur in San Diego.

loans.use: to pay for a much-needed software upgrade, as well as to finance the creation of a mobile app that will better help him interface with clients.

loans.name: Skarleth Jazmin

texts.es:
La Joven Skarleth de 21  años de edad, vive con su de su mamá,  se dedica desde hace 2  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general vende arroz, azúcar, maíz, café, frescos de todo tipo, manteca, frijoles, harina, papel higiénico,  etc.  Vive en la aldea  los Chorritos,  al sur de Honduras.
Skarleth es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, azúcar, huevos, café, frijoles, harina, arroz, pan, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Young Skarleth, 21, lives with her mother.  For 2 years, she has had a business selling groceries.  She sells everyday products such as rice, sugar, corn, coffee, all types of drinks, butter, beans, flour, toilet paper, etc.  She lives in the town of Chorritos in the southern part of Honduras.  

Skarleth is an enterprising woman who has a desire to get ahead.  She fights every day to improve her quality of life.  She is requesting a loan to buy products such as corn, sugar, eggs, coffee, beans, flour, rice, bread, etc.  With the support of this loan, she plans to increase her income and also her quality of life.  She is a new client who really wants to work with Prisma.  

Skarleth's dream is to have her own business and increase her customer base.  She also wants to improve her future along with that of her family.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  September 2014.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing gear like nets, hooks, lead weights and other items

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa, 49, has six children. She personally sells the catch from her family's fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  

She has been a member in good standing since she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative almost three years ago. She now wants to obtain financial assistance of 25,000 Philippine pesos from Paglaum MPC to purchase new nets and pay for the repair to a fishing boat.  

As much as possible, her family has to have all the necessary fishing accessories to minimize the chances of a low or zero catch. Nimfa already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbours so she can sell more to the nearby fish market, where fish will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from her daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and pay for the repair to a fishing boat

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
After coming to the U.S. in 1996, Socorro made her way to Dallas, Texas. Upon arrival, she immediately began looking for work. Referred by a friend, she started working in the housekeeping department at a Toni & Guy hair salon.
 
“I started at Toni & Guy sweeping the floors, and from that moment, my life has never been the same,” Socorro said. “This was a very defining moment in my life.”

In 2005, the manager of the Toni & Guy opened her own salon. When she left the salon, the manager took Socorro to come work for her. The other owners of the newly opened salon sent Socorro to cosmetology school, giving her a fresh start in the field. 

“I learned everything I could from everyone about the business,” Socorro said. “I was so grateful that someone believed in me and my potential.”

Socorro worked for the new salon until she decided it was time to open her own business. In 2012, she opened Coco’s Hairstyles. She has been successfully operating for two years. The majority of her clients are repeat clients and referrals from other clients. 

Socorro came to Accion Texas Inc. to help fund her inventory costs. She needs to purchase more specialty products for her clients. She believes this will help her business to continue to grow.
 
“I am so grateful to everyone who helped me get to where I am today,” Socorro said.

loans.use: to pay for the inventory costs of new supplies for her business.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 años y 2 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, lácteos y miel desde hace 18 años de manera ambulante. Con el deseo de continuar llevando los productos a sus clientes y tratar de cubrir un mercado más amplio ha tomado la decisión de solicitar nuevamente un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: cremas, lociones, champo, etc. con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 32 years old and lives in her own house along with her life companion and their two children, ages 7 and 2. For 18 years Maria has been selling beauty products, dairy products, and honey as a street vendor. With the wish to continue bringing her products to her customers and trying to cover a wider market, she has decided to again apply to FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as creams, lotions, shampoo, etc., with the desire to improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años al crianza de ganado de repasto, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, la joven es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganando de repasto y así poder seguir con la crianza ya que es  su única fuente de trabajo y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman’s face was pixelated because she is 20 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She has been working for five years taking beef cattle to pasture to fatten them, and then selling her products in the various markets. 

She is a single mother and lives with her two children in her own house. 

She has requested a loan to buy more beef cattle so she can continue raising them, as this is her only source of work, and offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more beef cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Victoria, 52 years old, residing in the Municipality of Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. Victoria has 7 children and is married to a carpenter.  The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs in their family. So, Victoria started a food vending business. Victoria has been in the business more than a year now. 
Victoria wants to increase her inventories so that she can accept orders from customers.  She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and she would like to be able to send her children to college. In order for Victoria to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 6,000 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Estelito

texts.en: Estelito is 43 years old, single and lives at Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living, he raises pigs in the backyard. Raising pigs is a good business; aside from having earnings, he also enjoys doing it. Estelito is in his 3rd year with PMPC. Now, he is requesting a loan of PHP12,000 to buy bags of feed. He really hopes and prays that his business will grow and benefit him for his future needs. Someday, he wants to build a concrete pig cage to more easily keep sanitary conditions and to own a small meat shop in the public market.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Yerevan with his parents and brother. He is 39 years old, and he has no higher education. Many years ago, he managed to buy a small space where he built a shop and established his small business; in that small shop he sold a nice assortment of flowers, which he bought every morning from the city’s wholesale market of flowers. 

In his business, Armen’s father helped him very much. They sold nice bequests and took orders for different parties and banquets decorations, until suddenly this business became unprofitable. As Armen says, his waste was much more than his income, and for some time he closed his shop. 

Along the street where his shop is located, Armen noticed that there was not a single fruit and vegetable market, and he decided to start a new business. Now he sells fruits and vegetables in his shop: potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, eggplant, peppers, grapes, apples, plums, watermelon, etc.

Armen says that his business is new, and this loan will help him to buy a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables for sale, since the space of the market is big, and his shop looks a little bit empty. He is sure that with the enlargement of his business, his family’s income will also be enlarged.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Retailing helped Nilda survive for the family. She retails charcoal and brings in a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do was to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. 

Nida plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventory of charcoal for retail. 

Nilda smiles at the fact of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of charcoal for retail.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is for food for the family.

Christine operates a vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transporting her goods to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she has requested, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime de 39 años de edad habita en vivienda propia, y apoya económicamente a sus dos hijos. Él es un hombre responsable que todos los días se esfuerza en su trabajo para llevar el sustento a sus hijos y mantener los gastos de su vivienda. Jaime desea reparar el baño de su vivienda pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario, es por ello que se acerco a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito ya que sabe que gracias a su trabajo podrá cancelarlo en cuotas, dicho crédito Jaime lo invertirá en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, grava y hierro para reparar el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en: Jaime is 39 years old. He lives in his own house and supports his two children economically. He is a responsible man who exerts himself in his work every day to bring sustenance to his children and maintain the expenses of his household. Jaime wants to repair the bathroom in his house, but he doesn't have the necessary money. It is for this reason that he came to FUSAI to apply for a loan, since he knows that thanks to his work he will be able to pay it off in installments. Jaime will invest this loan in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron in order to repair the bathroom in his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to repair the bathroom in his residence.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 48, is married and lives in Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. Through Pagluam Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 13,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional heads of pig and bags of feed. 

She really hopes and prays that her business, in addition to her husband's income, will grow and benefit her family. Some day, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions and become a supplier of pork at the public market and in nearby municipalities.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
In 2010, Arlene learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. Arlene tried her luck at creating a business that focused on her farming activities. 

She feels she owes her fortune to the cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Arlene has borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. 

Arlene looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le a pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un negocio de lavado de carros, desde hace 10 años, vive en casa propia con su hija, tiene mucha clientela por el buen servicio que presta, el joven esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de jabón, cera, limpia vidrios, aromatizantes, franelas, etc. para poder brindar un mejor servicio, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener junto con su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The young man's face has been blurred because he is 26 years old and lives in an area of high risk. For 10 years he has had a business of washing cars. He lives in his own house with his daughter. He has many customers because of the good service he provides. He is requesting a loan to buy soap, wax, glass cleaners, air fresheners, soft cloths, etc, to be able to provide better service because this is his only source of income. This way he and his daughter will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soap, wax, glass cleaners, air fresheners, soft cloths, etc.

loans.name: Azimio Kichemchem Group

texts.en:
Sarah is aged in her late forties. She is not married and has three children, one schooling, and the rest are grown. She has been supporting her family by managing a food business known as a mamalishe. She started her business from down level, selling only snacks. After Kiva's support, she managed to rent a room, operating full-time and serving breakfast and lunch foods. 

With this progress, Sarah's income rose, and it became easier to afford the cost of her family’s welfare. She is so happy and thankful for Kiva's support. Sara's mind and ideas are still opening, and she wants to start selling women's products: handbags and dresses. Her desire is to grow her businesses and life. Sarah has been in her business for six years, and works from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. daily. She is able to realize a very good return.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her third credit request to be apportioned among Azimio Kichemchem, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

She used her previous credits, since repaid, to make business progress from snacks to a mamalishe business. She received extra income, which she used to buy a plot and to start building, and covered school fees and welfare costs.

Sarah will invest her loan to start selling women’s products such as handbags, dresses, etc. She is so thankful for everyone who has supported and keeps on supporting them.

loans.use: to start selling women's products such as handbags, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 38 years old, married with three children, and lives in Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Philippines. 

In order to earn a living, she raises pigs in their backyard while her husband is a tricycle driver. Raising pigs is a good business. Aside from having earnings, she also enjoys doing it. 

Divina is in her second year with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Now, she is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional heads of pigs to sell. 

She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions and to own a meat shop in the market to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of pigs to sell

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Mr Kokou est âgé de 51ans. Marié, il a 04 enfants en age majeur. Pour se prendre en charge et subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il revend des friperies dans une boutique louée à cet effet. Vu la qualité de ses habits, il a de nombreux clients c'est pour cela Kokou fait une quatrième demande à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de les satisfaire. Le gain tiré de la vente lui permettra d'assister ses enfants qui sont en apprentissage et de rendre stable son activité.
texts.en: Mr. Kokou is 51 years old and married, and he has four children, who are adults. To support himself and to meet family needs, he resells secondhand clothing at a shop leased for this purpose. Given the quality of his clothing, he has numerous customers. So Kokou has made a fourth request [for a loan] at WAGES to purchase some merchandise to satisfy them. The profit made from the sales will enable him to attend to his children, who are in apprenticeships, and to stabilize his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun, 26, is married and has only one little child. She lives in a small village in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm that is located near her house. Her family's average income is around $3 (USD) per day.

Sokun wants to improve her entire family's general living conditions by having a latrine, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing so, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Sokum is thankful for this loan, granted through Hattha Kakseka Limited at a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine signed up for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store.

She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small borrower like her. Josephine is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is 31 years old, married, and a resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Starting with 5,000 PHP in capital, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in May 2012 and has taken out three loans. 

Now, she is applying for 45,000 PHP to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities.  In the future, she wants to own a mini mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita loves gardening, and she finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities, with which she also earns a living. At the age of 62 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of Paglaum MPC. She credits the cooperative with supporting her with capital for her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Teresita wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Halichabegim

texts.ru: Халичабегим  женщина 45 лет,замужем,имеет троих детей. Халичабегим родилась и выросла в сельской местности и с детства работает на поле:выращивает овощи,ухаживает за скотом.В течение десяти лет на своем участке земли Халичабегим ухаживает за скотом.Она имеет 5 голов коров.Каждое утро Халичабегим доит своих коров и продает молоко на рынке.Халичабегим не справляется одна,поэтому ухаживать за скотом ей помогают её муж и дети.Выращивание скота является основным доходом семьи Халичабегим.Она трудится в поте лица,чтобы ее дети жили , не зная нужд.Она берет кредит ,чтобы увеличить поголовье скота  и расширить свое стадо.На данный момент у нее нет необходимой суммы,поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Халичабегим заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Halichabegim is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. She was born and raised in a rural area and has been working in the fields since she was a child, growing vegetables and looking after livestock. She has been raising livestock on her own land for the past 10 years. She milks her five cows every morning and then sells the milk at the market. She doesn't do all of this work alone - her husband and children help her take care of the cattle too.

Animal husbandry is the primary source of income for Halichabegim's family, and she works very hard so her children aren't in need of anything. She is requesting a loan to increase her head count of livestock and expand her herd. At the moment she doesn't have enough money for this, which is why she has turned to microfinance organization Arvand for financial support. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support and their faith in her.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a businesswoman from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Grace is a full-fledged member of Paglaum and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Grace continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana de 29 años de edad confecciona ropa exterior en su pequeño taller ubicado en el lugar donde habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijos de 7 años de edad. Ella inició su negocio  hace 7 años, cuando después de analizar que en los talleres de confección donde era empleada  y no obtenía un buen salario, aprovechando de su esposo también conoce el oficio y se complementan bien en esta tarea.  Hoy sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su sector a quienes les confecciona sobre medidas y también a todo costo es decir poniendo materias primas insumos con diseños ajustados a cada gusto y deseo.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, y respondiendo a los encargos que hace su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  telas, hilos, correderas, botones y una máquina plana que dará una productividad de mayor calidad y eficacia. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia vivienda y un local en ella , para organizar estructuralmente su taller de manera independiente y con amplitud.
texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old. She makes clothing in her little workshop located in the place where she lives with her husband and little 7-year-old child. She began her business seven years ago, after analyzing the sewing workshops where she was an employee and didn't obtain a good salary and taking advantage of her husband, who also knows the work and complements her well in this area. 

Now her principal customers are her neighbors in her sector, for whom she sews made-to-measure items on an all-inclusive basis, that is to say, supplying the basic materials, with the designs adjusted to each customer's taste and wishes. She makes her sales for cash and on credit, responding to the orders that her customers place.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and a flatbed sewing machine that will give better quality and more efficient production. Her goal for the future is to have her own home with a shop in it, so that she can structurally organize her workshop in an independent way and with ample space.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, and a flat-bed sewing machine

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Judas Tadeo está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde varias  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, lo que quiere decir que deben esforzarse un poco más para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las artesanías y la venta de frutas que hace, esta logrando mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de Karanday para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías, de manera a luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
The group called San Judas Tadeo is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other to advance. They are doing the survey on eliminating poverty, where some of them are below the poverty line, which means that they must exert themselves a little more in order to be able to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Señora Celia, who in her last survey showed a level of poverty within level two. Through effort and continual work and by means of the handicrafts she makes and her sales of fruits, she is managing to improve her living conditions.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of karanday [a natural fiber] to continue making her handicrafts and in this way to strive to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy karanday (natural fibers) to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les sept membres du groupe Dembagnouma ont en moyenne 37 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Ouenzindougou commune du Mandé dans le cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Ouenzindougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, friperies, pagnes wax, œufs, ustensiles, savons et bananes plantains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Ramatou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de friperies de plusieurs qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 balles friperies en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Ouenzindougou  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Ramatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous households, the seven members of the group Dembagnouma average 37 years of age and six children each. The women all live in Ouenzindougou, in Commune du Mandé, Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Ouenzindougou mk. The group members have small-scale businesses involving secondhand clothing, Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), eggs, utensils, soaps, and plantains.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Ramatou (the woman standing at the far in the photo) is a major of secondhand clothing of several qualities. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 bales of secondhand clothing wholesale in Médine. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Ouenzindougou.

With this loan, Ms. Ramatou is planning on an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 39 years old and is married with four kids. 

Flora has a passion for making food delicacies like puto maya for any occasion, but especially during fiesta. Puto maya is a rice cake composed of basic ingredients like rice, sugar, baking and coco milk. It is locally known as puto maya or rice cake. 

A friend of Flora approached her to turn her puto maya expertise into a business. Then, Flora gave a chance to starting a business. 

In 2010, Flora applied for a membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for financial assistance of 35,000 PHP to buy additional raw ingredients for her puto maya business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and be of help to the expansion of her business. 

Flora has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart. She wishes to give her family a good life and see all of her children holding their college diplomas in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her snack vending business

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Luís Mauricio

texts.es:
Luís de 45 años de edad, es bachiller, esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos. Tiene dos hijos que viven en casa y estan estudiando. 

 El cliente trabaja la agricultura, lo ha hecho por mas de 25 años y lo aprendio de su padre y de los hermanos mayores y decidio hacerlo por cuenta propia desde que se acompaño, tambien trabaja con ganado bovino, antes solo era empleado jornal. La distancia esta como a 1 1/2 km de su casa y viaja a pie o en carreta. Se involucra su compañera de vida y el hijo mayor cuando no hay clases. 

Su horario es de 6:00 am a 12:00 md y con el ganado en el resto del dia. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, etc.  El préstamo le mejorara porque tiene la oportunidad de comprar de una vez y asi tener mejores cosechas.

La necesidad satisfecha es que comprara de una vez sus insumos y se los aplicara en el momento oportuno. Sus sueños son poder trabajar de la mejor manera para poderles dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos y lo que espera para ellos es que estudien y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Luis, 45, has a high school degree and lives with a partner.  His partner takes care of the domestic chores.  He has 2 children who live in his house; they are attending school.

Luis is a farmer.  He's been farming for more than 25 years, and he learned this trade from his father and his older brothers.  He decided to farm on his own ever since he formed his own family.  He also works with cattle.  Before this, he worked as a day laborer.  His fields are one and a half kilometers from his house, and he travels there on foot or riding in a cart. His partner helps him, and also his oldest son when school is not in session.

Luis works on a schedule from 6am until noon, and then he works with the livestock the rest of the day.  He is requesting this loan to buy corn seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies.  This loan will improve his business because he will be able to buy his supplies all at once, and this way he will have better harvests.

This loan will satisfy his need to buy his supplies all at once so that he can apply them at the right time.  He dreams of being able to work in the best way, so that he can give his children a better future.  What he hopes for his children is that they study and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is married with seven school-going children. They live at their own house, which has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Tabu operates an agricultural selling business, through which she sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of diseases and pests affecting her crops.

With the KES20,000 loan she is requesting, Tabu wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans for boosting her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm

loans.name: Mwanamzungu

texts.en:
Mwanamzungu is a married mother of three children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business and sells from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with price fluctuations in her business. Mwanamzungu dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида трудолюбивая и целиестремленная девушка. Она проживает в Спитаменском районе. Ей 33 года. Фарида замужем имеет двоих детей. Фарида с детство старалась быть самостоятельной девочкой. В школе училась хорошо, но связи с замужеством она не смогла получить образование. Фарида очень рано вышла замуж. Не смотря, на это она для семейного благополучия начала торговать на рынке продуктами питания. В течение трех лет она набрала не малого опыта в сфере торговли, и уже имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Фарида очень ценит своих клиентов и во всем старается угодить им. Таким образом, день за днем увеличивается клиенты Фариды. В связи с этим Фарида хотела бы разнообразить ассортимент товаров и немного расширить торговую точку. Но Фариде не хватает денежных средств для осуществление своих планов , поэтому она подала заявку на кредит в МДО Арванд. Она выражает свою благодарность за финансовую поддержку и за оперативную работу со стороны сотрудников организации Арванад.
texts.en:
Farida is a hardworking and purposeful young woman of 33 who lives in the Spitamen region. She is married and has two children. Farida has tried to be independent since she was a child. She did well in school but wasn't able to receive an education because of her marriage, which happened when she was quite young. Despite this she started to sell food products at the market for the good of her family. In the past three years she has acquired quite a lot of experience in retail and has regular customers whom she values very much and whose needs she tries to satisfy. In such a way she increases her customer base day by day.

For this reason, Farida would like to broaden her assortment of merchandise and expand her retail business. But she doesn't have enough money to achieve her plans, which is why she has applied for a loan with microfinance organization Arvand. She is thankful for the financial support and the administrative work that has been done by Arvand staff.

loans.use: to buy food products for her grocery shop

loans.name: Calixta

texts.es:
La Sra. Calixta tiene 43 años, vive en el chaco, es propietaria de una despensa que pudo montar con mucho sacrificio en su propia casa, está surtida con gran variedad de productos, desde alimentos, bebidas, artículos de mercería y prendas de vestir. 
Es la única en su barrio y la conocen bien pues también realiza minutas para la venta en las mañanas. Está casada y tiene dos hijos menores que van al colegio, y por quienes ella está luchando para poder darle un buen estilo de vida.
Solicita el préstamo  para comprar bebidas varias que es lo que tiene más salida en su negocio para abastecerse ya que quiere aprovechar los precios bajos de esta temporada.
texts.en:
Calixta  is 43 years old and lives in El Chaco. She is the owner of a small grocery store that with a great deal of sacrifice she succeeded in setting up in her own home. It is supplied with a great variety of products including food, drinks, sewing items and articles of clothing.

It is the only one in her neighborhood and is well known, as in the mornings she also prepares snacks to sell.  She is married and has two minor children who go to high school. She is striving to be able to give them a good standard of living.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy various drinks, which is what she sells the most of.  This is so that she can restock, as she wants to take advantage of the low prices at this time of year.

loans.use: To buy various drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria tiene 34 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Hipólito, conforma una familia de cuatro integrantes con dos hijos, ella se dedica a la costura en su casa recibiendo trabajos de diversas empresas dedicadas a la confección.
 Cuenta ella que anteriormente trabajaba para la empresa de su comunidad pero como a la empresa no le iba tan bien decidió independizarse y gracias a la ayuda que le brinda su marido quien se dedica al flete, su mini empresa le va muy bien.
 El préstamo que solicita es para la inversión en su actividad de confección, como ser telas e hilos, ya que está entrando en la época en que mas venta se registra, su mayor anhelo es de ver a sus hijos en la vida todos unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Gloria is 34 years old. She is married to Señor Hipólito. They form a family of four members, with two children. She does seamstress work in her home, receiving work from various clothing-manufacturing businesses.

She relates that in the past she was working for the business in her community, but as the business was not going so well for her, she decided to become independent. Thanks to the help offered to her by her husband, who works in freight, her mini-business is going very well for her.

The loan that she is applying for is to invest in her sewing business, buying items such as fabric and thread, since the season is coming in which more sales are made. Her greatest wish is to see all her children become professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Somina

texts.ru:
Сомина 1965 года рождения, она торгует на уличном рынке розничными товарами. у нее на прилавке можно увидеть носки, нижнее белье, платки и множество мелочей. Ей очень трудно сидеть зимой так как очень холодно и стоять на открытом воздухе трудно, и неудобно. Поэтому у нее проблемы со здоровьем, а времени и денег на лечение нет. Но полученная прибыль также не достаточна , хватает только пропитание и коммунальные услуги. Оставшуюся сумму за лекарства присылает сын с России. 
Сомина хочет увеличить свою прибыль и оборот, поэтому ей необходимо определенная сумма на привоз товара, для торговли. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд, что получить финансовую помощь от КИВА. В будущем она хочет увеличить свой ассортимент товара, тем самым увеличить прибыль, и поправить своё здоровье.
texts.en: Somina was born in 1965.  She is a vendor at a street market, and she sells various goods on a retail basis, such as socks, underwear, scarves and many other small items.  In the winter, things get very difficult for her.  The weather gets very cold and it is hard and painful to stand in the open air.  For this reason, Somina is now dealing with health issues, but she doesn't have the money nor the time to get medical treatment.  Her income is not sufficient: it only allows her to buy food and pay the utilities.  Her son sends her the extra money that she needs for medication, from Russia.  Somina would like to increase her profit and turnover, and to do so, she needs some money to get more merchandise to resell.   For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand and Kiva, to receive financial support.  In the future, Somina would like to increase her inventory of goods and thereby her income, so that she'll have the means to improve her health.

loans.use: to buy various seasonal goods.

loans.name: Vyarenda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Vyarenda está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aun se encuentra en crecimiento, pero que se encuentra trabajando por mejorar.
La Sra. Josefina es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y por medio de su trabajo está luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra Jabón, comestibles, bebidas y otros. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The Vyarenda group is in its first cycle in the Women’s Committee program in the city of Curuguaty, which is not located in a growth area, but that is working to improve.

Josefina is one of the members.  She has a store where she works every day from early morning and is working to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

She is asking for this loan to buy soap, consumable products, beverages, and other things so she can continue to grow her business and provide her family with what they need, so that they can have lives without deprivation.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Guintan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Guitan est  constitué de six femmes, les membres du groupe sont tous  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers  de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’habits, d’oignons et jus. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso et  sont  à leur  2ème  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Marie (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété dans la vente des habits (bazins) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30m de bazins. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Lafiabougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The group Guitan is composed of six women. The group members are all married and living in monogamous households. The women average 37 years of age and three children each, all living in Lafiabougou, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members run different revenue-generating businesses, especially selling clothing, onions, and juice drinks. 

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the women had decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Marie (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling clothing (damask) of the best qualities. She intends to use her loan to purchase 30 meters of damask. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She operates her cash business selling to women customers in Lafiabougou.

With this loan, Ms. Marie hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to support herself. The rest will be used in her business. Her goal is to enhance loyalty in this Soro Yiriwaso partnership, so as to take advantage of many loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace 12 años al crianza de ganado de repasto,adicional a eso también cultiva maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, vive en casa propia con su esposa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganando de repasto y así poder seguir con la crianza ya que es  su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en: Carlos is 32 years old. For 12 years he has been raising grazing cattle. In addition to this, he also raises corn. He sells his products in various markets. He lives in his own house with his wife. He is applying for a loan to buy more grazing cattle and thus be able to continue raising them, since it is his only source of work, and to be able to have a better quality of life together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more grazing cattle

loans.name: Timinandia Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Timinandia sont majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 43 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe mènent  des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’habits et friperies. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  2ème prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Awa  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de qualités supérieures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent à Djicoroni.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  à Djicoroni à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Awa  compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 30 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The group Timinandia is composed of four women, of whom most are married and living in polygamous households. The women average 43 years of age and seven children each, all living in Djicoroni, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members run different revenue-generating businesses, especially selling fabrics and secondhand clothing. 

Concerned about expanding their businesses, the women had decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. 

Ms. Awa (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) of superior qualities. She intends to use her loan to purchase 25 lengths of Wax ‘pagne’ cloth. She gets her supplies in Djicoroni. She operates her business with cash and sells to women customers in Djicoroni.

With this loan, Ms. Awa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to support herself. The rest will be used in her business. Her goal is to enhance loyalty in this Soro Yiriwaso partnership, so as to take advantage of many loans.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy, 48 years old, is married and a resident of Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. His spouse is a housewife.

He has now decided to enter into business himself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market.  Last January 14, 2013 both Jimmy and his wife agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to increase his sales. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

He has now applied again for a loan to purchase farm inputs. He is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of his wife, he is looking forward to being successful.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Faïda sont  mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati ; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de toutes les qualités, de produits cosmétiques, du bois de chauffe et de la restauration. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bah (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax ; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako en gros ; La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bah espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Faïda are married for the most part in polygamous households. The women average 45 years of age and five children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé / Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through ties of community and through their revenue-generating businesses in Kanadjiguila. The group members have small-scale businesses involving Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) of all qualities, cosmetic products, firewood, and food service. 

With the goal of resupplying their cash, the group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Bah (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to use her loan to purchase 30 lengths of Wax ‘pagne’ cloth wholesale in Bamako. By hawking, she makes her sales retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Bah hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and ensuring her children are cared for at home.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a single woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Philomena has operated a tailoring business for the past 4 years. She makes suits for women and men. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en: Brigida, a 59-year-old widow, lives in Siquijor, Philippines, with her children. In order to sustain the needs of the family, she has found ways to attain income through a buy-and-sell business. It began with selling a few pairs of shoes, sandals, slippers and children's clothes to their neighbors. She then joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her capitalize her buy-and-sell business in March 2010. She became a MIGS, or Member in Good Standing, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for 8,000 PHP to restock inventories for her buy-and-sell business. She hopes that her business will continue and would like to own a space near the public market where she could display her dry goods and cater to more customers.

loans.use: to restock inventories of dry goods for selling

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan that Catherine is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is from Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married and has four kids.

In order to sustain the needs of their family, she operates a sari-sari store (general store) and the business is doing well. In 2008, Remegia became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing.
