She sees a good opportunity to venture into a fishing business. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 30,000 PHP to purchase nets and other fishing accessories to sufficiently provide for her daily needs. She plans to repair their house by setting aside savings from her daily sales for a decent and happy living.

loans.use: to purchase nets and other fishing accessories

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de variedad de esencias naturales desde hace muchos años. Dicho negocio le permite mantener el equilibrio de la economía del hogar  y gracias a su carisma y la calidad en sus productos muchas personas la prefieren y cada vez son mas las personas que demandan sus productos. Ángela, solicita nuevamente este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de esencias naturales para su negocio y poder así mejorar sus ventas y ganancias. Agradece el apoyo recibido en el pasado en la inversión de mercadería para el mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela is 59 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and their children. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has made a living by selling a variety of natural essences for many years. This business allows her to keep her household finances balanced. Thanks to her charisma and the quality of her products, many people prefer her business and demand for her products is always increasing. Ángela is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of a variety of natural essences for her business so that she an increase her sales and earnings. 

Ángela is grateful for the support she received in the past to invest in merchandise for this same business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of natural essences for her business.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia est composé équitablement de 2 femmes monogames et 2 polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures, habits, ustensiles plastiques et sucres, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures (hommes et femmes) de tous genres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 paires de    chaussures en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle mixte. Madame Bintou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Siguidia is composed of two monogamous women and two polygamous women. They average 43 years of age and five children each, all living in Kanadjiguila, in Commune du Mandé / Cercle de Kati. And they know one another through ties of community. The group members have small-scale businesses involving shoes, clothing, plastic utensils, and sugars. 

The group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Bintou (the woman standing second from the right in the photo) is famous for selling shoes (for men and women) of all types. She intends to use her loan to purchase 25 pairs of shoes wholesale in Bamako. Her sales are made retail to a mixed customer base in Kanadjiguila.

With this loan, Ms. Bintou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé majoritairement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, mèches de meilleures qualités, condiments, restauration, gâteaux, céréales et poissons. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Gninamba  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des mèches. mèches Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 paquets de mèches en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails  à Badialan III à une clientèle composée de femmes. Madame Gninamba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Siguidia is composed mostly of monogamous women. They average 35 years of age and three children each, all living in Badialan III, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community. The group members have small-scale businesses involving hair extensions of the best qualities, condiments, food service, cakes, grains, and fish. 

With the goal of  resupplying their cash, the group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Gninamba (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling hair extensions. She intends to use her loan to purchase 60 packets of hair extensions wholesale in Bamako. Her sales are made retail to women customers in Badialan III.

With this loan, Ms. Gninamba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 175,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: El grupo “VRIGEN DE GUADALUPE” está conformado por socios  trabajadores y responsables en sus cuotas de grupo. Ketty tiene 37 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a prestar servicios de costurera hace 04 años. El crédito lo invertirá en implementar en su vivienda su propio taller de costura en donde brindara servicios de confección de polos y composturas en general. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas  KIVA por el crédito brindado.  Ketty se encuentra sentada en el lado izquierdo viste chompa negra y buzo rojo.
texts.en:
The group Virgen de Guadalupe is comprised of hardworking and responsible members who faithfully make their scheduled repayments. 

Ketty is 37 years old and has two children who depend on her. She has made a living through her sewing services for the last four years. Ketty will invest this loan to open a small sewing and tailoring service from her home. She will sew polo shirts and do other general repairs.

This group is grateful for Kiva investors for offering help through this loan. In the photo above, Ketty is seated on the left side. She is wearing a black sweater and red pants.

loans.use: to open her own sewing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires and do some maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Samart

texts.en:
Samart, 43 years old, is a married man who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has one dependent child and two married children.

He is a fisherman in the lake which is located near his house. So far he has been involved in this career for around twenty years. The average income that he is able to make is 2.00 USD per day. 

Samart would like to apply for a Kiva loan to buy some fishing materials. With the support from this loan, he hopes that the new fishing materials will help him to get more fish. He would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy some fishing materials

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pig for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert thought he was in the right place when he joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. He decided to give it a try after he learned he can avail financial assistance for his chosen business. 

He has maintained his membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. He has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for his chosen business. Gilbert wishes to continuously manage his business more effectively with the support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 64 years old, married, and lives at Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood.  The piglet's owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending in their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy additional feeds. 

She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feeds

loans.name: Och

texts.en: Och is a lovely 60-year-old mother of three dependent children and three married children. She lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she operates a rice farming business on farmland that is located near her house. So far, she has been in this career for more than thirty years. The money that she can earn in one day is USD 3.00. Och is applying a Kiva loan through HKL to buy rice seeds and some farming materials. She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support for poor people.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and some farming materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a shy 52-year-old mother of 6, started dairy farming in 1999. 15 years later, her primary income source is milk. This just goes to show how deep-rooted her passion for dairy farming is.
 
Mary hails from Kisii, Kenya. Dairy, banana and tea farming are big businesses here. However, Mary has only concentrated her efforts in what she knows  best. She spends most of her time grazing because she is too concerned about animal health and feed intake to let anyone else do it. 

Mary is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES from Kiva lenders to purchase a water tank. Water is essential for life and it's the nutrient needed by dairy animals in the largest quantity for their body functions, temperature control and in the production of milk. By having a water tank, her animals will have 24 hour access to this invaluable resource. Most rural farmers time when their cattle should take water and that is when they lead them to a spring. Limitations in the availability of clean, fresh, and high-quality water for dairy animals can limit milk production quicker than a deficiency in any other nutrient. Water intake also regulates feed intake.

With your loan, Mary will avoid this mistake. She also stands to realize an increase in milk production and improved animal health which will in turn increase her income and reduce her expenses respectively.  Make a $25 loan towards Mary and she'll turn it into more milk.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 50, is a smallholder farmer based in the in the Kisii area of Kenya. She has been blessed with six children that she holds close to the heart. She has been able to provide for her family for 15 years through dairy farming. Even as of today, her primary income source is milk.

Mary is seeking a loan to purchase another cow. She has a very passionate interest in dairy farming. She spends most of her hours looking after cows. She named her favourite and most productive cow 'Princess.' 

The additional cow will expand her asset base and increase her milk sales volume.  The income from the expansion will enable her to take care of farm-related expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Mary replied. "More milk."

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Mitavarhan

texts.ru: Митавархан 27 лет, разведена, мать 2 детей. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи она 10 лет назад начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Митавархан достигла хороших успехов в работе и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 10,000 сом (KGS) преимущественно от реализации молока. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Митавархан имеется 1 дойная корова, также 0,50 ГА огорода и 0,12 ГА сада с плодоносящими деревьями. Митавархан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку одной дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализуемого молока, которое пользуется большим спросом среди местных жителей. Доходы от кредита Митавархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого бизнеса.
texts.en: Mitavarhan is 27 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children.  Looking for a source of income for her family, she started to get involved in agriculture and animal husbandry ten years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work and constant labor, she has greatly improved her business and she now makes up to 10,000 som (KGS) per month, primarily from the sale of milk.  She currently owns one dairy cow as well as 0.5 hectare of arable land and a 0.12 hectare garden with fruit trees.  She has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow.  This purchase will allow her to produce and sell larger volumes of milk, as there is a high demand for milk among the local residents.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her small business.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow in order to produce and sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a grocery and vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Saumu wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Kankelefo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kankelefo est uniquement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (tomates, persils et goyaves), miches de pain et condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aoua (femme assise devant et à gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des légumes (tomates, persils et goyaves). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de tomates, 1 corbeille de persil et 3sacs de goyaves en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Aoua espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Kankelefo is composed just of monogamous women. They average 43 years of age and five children each, all living in Niomirambougou, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through ties of community. The group members have small-scale businesses involving vegetables (tomatoes, parsley, and guavas), bread, and condiments. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Aoua (the woman sitting in front and at the left in the photo) is famous for selling vegetables (tomatoes, parsley, and guavas). She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 baskets of tomatoes, a basket of parsley, and 3 sacks of guavas wholesale in Médine. Her sales are made retail to women customers in Niomirambougou.

With this loan, Ms. Aoua hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to buy a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Josepha

texts.en: Josepha is 35 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 6 years and 7 months, 2 of whom go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for the past 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, bananas and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him, 44, is living in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two unmarried children. To support the family, she is working very hard on her own cassava field by growing cassava and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day. 

To keep her cassava growing well with more fruit, she normally uses natural fertilizers in her farmland. However, now she can’t afford that fertilizer as she used to do regularly. She is now requesting a loan to buy some fertilizer to use on her farmland. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizer

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana has mastered her hog-raising business in Liloy. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. 

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog-raising business, so will she care for  her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan of PHP 3,000 will help her build a concrete pigpen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pigpen

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her. 

She is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, Geraldine availed a loan to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, noodles, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities like canned goods, noodles, oil, and soy sauce

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is married and has six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Charo has operated a food-selling business, making dumplings and flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman living with her husband and four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Martha operates a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. A major challenge for her is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale supplier of firewood and charcoal in the village.

She would use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques, les quatre (04) membres du groupe Kolaban ont en moyenne 31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Badialan III l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Badialan III. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits industriels, jus, bazins et colorants. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des habits industriels (enfant) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 complets en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Badialan III à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Kolaban are women, of whom two are married in monogamous households and two in polygamous households. The women average 31 years of age and three children each, all living in Badialan III, a district of Bamako. And they know. And they know one another through ties of community and through their revenue-generating businesses in Badialan III. The group members have small-scale businesses involving commercially produced clothing, juice drinks, damask fabrics, and dyes or tints. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariam (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of commercially produced clothing (for children) of the best qualities. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 outfits wholesale in Bamako. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Badialan III.

With this loan, Ms. Mariam plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and for meeting the sundry needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase commercially produced clothing (for children) of the best qualities

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of three children from Ajuy, Iloilo. She helps her husband in their fishing business. This is the source of their income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, crab traps, hooks, and lead weights. With a loan, Jocelyn and her husband will be able to improve their daily catch which they can sell to the market for a good price. Jocelyn hopes to make their business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, crab traps, hooks, and lead weights

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Renita lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than two years now.  She earns additional income from her retail sales of frozen foods like sausages and other processed meat.

Renita is in need of additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and additional frozen goods/foods to sell. Through this loan, Renita will be able to improve her business as well as her income. Renita dreams of improving her livelihood and saves money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and additional frozen goods/foods to sell

loans.name: Layasa

texts.en:
Layasa learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Layasa tried her luck in doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Layasa borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. She looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Asha operates an open-air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier baguida,  Akossiwa  est  âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée  et  mère  de 2 enfants.Akossiwa vend des draps et fripperies et  s’approvisionne  6 fois par  mois  au  marché hédzranawé et revend par vente ambulante. Akossiwa sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en: Residing in Lomé in the Baguida district, Ms. Akossiwa, aged 46, is a married mother of two. She sells bed sheets and secondhand clothing, and she gets her supplies six times a month at the Hédzranawé market. She resells her goods by going door to door. She is requesting a loan to expand her commerce and to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bed sheets and a bale of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Divinah

texts.en:
Divinah is a 29-year-old mixed-farmer whose main source of income is milk. She decided to concentrate her efforts in dairy farming since she comes from Kisii where milk is in increasingly high demand due to an upsurge in the population.
 
Divinah is seeking a loan to purchase a cow. She has been passionately interested in diary farming since she was a young girl. She actualized her dream at 19 when she started her dairy farm. The business has seen various successes and challenges alike, but has remained full of promise. Divinah aspires to grow her business to the next level and she needs your loan to do so. 

The income from the expansion will enable her to repay the loan, settle the ever-increasing farming expenses and take better care of her 3 children. Your $25 loan will surely improve Divinah's livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for inventory and to hire more employees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new farming supplies to help her corn, beans, and rice crops.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbors and college students. She faces a challenge of seasonality. Especially during holiday seasons when schools have closed she experiences a low turnout. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase manicure, pedicure, and facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loan requirements.

loans.use: to purchase manicure, pedicure, and facial kits, relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair food

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло начинающий предприниматель из района Шахритус. Она в возрасте 30 лет собирается начать свой торговый бизнес. Шахло живет в районе вместе с мужем и двумя дочерьми. Ее муж инвалид, а дочери еще маленькие. Шахло в семье главный добытчик. Она собирается начать прибыльный бизнес в сфере продаж одежды, чтобы улучшить финансовое состояние семьи. Шахло на свои сбережения уже приобрела торговую точку на рынке. Она берет кредит для закупки товара из оптового рынка города Душанбе. Шахло планирует привезти ассортимент детской и взрослой одежды. Она очень надеется на Вашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Shahlo is an aspiring entrepreneur from the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  She is 30 years old and is planning to start her own retail activity.  She lives with her husband and her two daughters.  Her husband is disabled, and her daughters are still very young.  Shahlo is the family's main breadwinner.  In order to improve her family's financial situation, she is about to start her own profitable business and will be selling clothes.  With her savings, she has already bought a retail outlet at the market.  She is now taking a loan to buy bulk merchandise at the wholesale market in Dushanbe.  She is planning to bring in an assortment of children's, as well as men's and women's clothes.  She is looking very forward to receiving your financial support.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of children's, as well as men's and women's clothes, in order to start her new business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. She has helped her husband grow bananas for over four years in order to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for her farm and the farm is still doing well. She works hard with her husband in order to ensure a better source of income. Her farm needs manure fertilization in order to restore farm nutrients. She took a new loan to buy manure fertilizer. In the future, she plans to expand and cultivate the vacant area of her farm for improvement of her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy manure fertilizer

loans.name: Mnuka Group

texts.en:
Godliver, who is in her early fifties, is married with a grown-up daughter. She stays with four grandkids who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for nine years now. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Godliver's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her mamalishe stock and also kept on buying the out-of-stock items in her business. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay for her grandchildren's school fees, bought a plot of land, built a three-room house and covered household expenses. She is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. 

She will use this loan to buy a big cooking stove, utensils, and food-cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business. She dreams of adding another room in her house.

Godliver will share this loan with her loan group "Mnuka", which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a big cooking stove, utensils, and food-cooking ingredients for her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is widowed and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open-air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of soaps, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of soaps, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Clarynce

texts.en:
Clarynce is a businesswoman from Baybay. She is 29 years old, married, and has the expertise in selling. 

She runs a little boutique and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Clarynce is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she applied for a loan to buy additional products like jewelry, bags, and shoes for her boutique. Clarynce continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee farm.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Sabougnouma est constitué de cinq femmes  tous mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et  leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente de,  friperies, jus, condiments et pagnes wax.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 3ème   prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des friperies à Niomirambougou. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperies. Elles s’approvisionnent  à  Médine. La revente s’effectue à  Niomirambougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Oumou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat  de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
This group, Sabougnouma, is composed of five women, who are married for the most part in polygamous households. The women average 38 years of age and five children each, all living in Niomirambougou, a district of Bamako. And they know one another through tontines in the district and through their revenue-generating businesses. The group members have businesses, such as the selling of secondhand clothing, juice drinks, condiments, and Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members had decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. 

Ms. Oumou (the woman sitting second from the left in the photo) is a famous for selling secondhand clothing in Niomirambougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 bales of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies in Médine. Her sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Niomirambougou.

With this loan, Ms. Oumou plans on making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for meeting her children’s sundry needs. The rest will be invested in her business. She is counting a lot on this Soro Yiriwaso partnership to achieve her goals, which include expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Mbetsa

texts.en:
Mbetsa is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mbetsa operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to the town dwellers and her neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en una zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años al cultivo de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
The young man's face is pixelated because he's 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

He has worked for three years growing corn.  When his crop is ready, he sells it in the vicinity of the area where he lives.  He lives in his own house with his life partner and his two children.

He's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, and pest control to improve the plot of land shown in the photograph so he can continue with his crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, and pest control to improve his plot of land

loans.name: La Joie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  LA JOIE est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  savons à l’image de AWA qui est la 2ème femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, des colorants, de la pâte, du sel et des parfums avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group LA JOIE is composed of six married women, who average 35 years of age and four children each. The women live in nuclear families in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. And they know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity for better businesses, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. 

This group of women does commerce in soaps, as does AWA, who is the woman standing second from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase dyes, paste, salt, and perfumes from wholesalers from Bougouni. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making soap

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEYA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de BALAKISSA qui est la 1ère femme debout dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de cube maggi et d’épices avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group BADEYA is composed of four married women, who average 48 years of age and six children each. The women live in nuclear families in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. And they know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity for better businesses, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan. The previous two loans were correctly paid back. 

This group of women does commerce in condiments, as does BALAKISSA, who is the woman standing first from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 boxes of Maggi cubes [bouillon] and some spices from wholesalers from Bougouni. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as spices and other flavorings

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  pagnes à l’image de AWA qui est la 2ème femme  assise dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 pièces de pagnes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of five married women, who average 25 years of age and three children each. The women live in nuclear families in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. And they know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity for better businesses, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. 

This group of women does commerce in ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa), as does AWA, who is the woman sitting second from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth from wholesalers from Bougouni. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old.  He is married and blessed with seven children. His wife works as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) which helps him with the household expenses. 

He provides transportation services in their community, and he earns well from this, the main source of income. He has been running this for more than three years.   He also had a farm and he delegates his tenants to oversee the fields where he has his crops. When he finishes his work, he comes  to help them in the farm.

Joseph is requesting this loan from GDMPC to purchase tires and spare parts.  In the future, he wants  to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Maria Minia

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Ella es una mejer trabajadora y visionaria quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. María se gana la vida por medio de la elaboración y venta de antojitos típicos como: pupusas, tamales, refrescos, entre otros. Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingresos de María y es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar nuevamente un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos como: maíz, azúcar, frijoles, queso, verduras, especias, aceite, etc. para preparar sus ricos platillos que tanto prefieren sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 55, lives in her own house with her husband.  She's a hardworking and visionary woman who does everything in her power to support her household.

María earns a living making and selling traditional snacks such as pupusas [stuffed tortillas], tamales, soft drinks, and others.  This business is María's main source of income, so she decided to request another loan from FUSAI to invent in her business.  She's going to buy corn, sugar, beans, cheese, vegetables, spices, oil, etc. to make the delicious dishes that her customers like so much.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, beans, cheese, vegetables, spices, oil, etc.

loans.name: Nasih

texts.en:
Nasih is 59 years old and a single parent. She lives with her daughter. She has two daughters. She has usually been selling food or rice in the morning over eight years for increased family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 IDR. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for the family. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet

loans.name: Adoude

texts.fr: ADOUDE a 46 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants résident à baguida. elle vend des pagnes. elle s'approvisionne 4 fois par mois au  marché de Mayakopé et revend dans les environs de son quartiers. ADOUDE sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: ADOUDE, aged 46, is a widow and the mother of five  children residing in Baguida. She sells ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She gets her supplies four times a month at the Mayakopé market, and she resells her goods around her district. ADOUDE is requesting this loan to expand her commerce in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 5 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth

loans.name: Horongna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe HORONGNA est constitué de 6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  friperies à l’image de OUMOU qui est la 1ère femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 balle de friperie avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group HORONGNA is composed of six married women, who average 37 years of age and four children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. And they know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity for better businesses, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth loan. The three previous ones were correctly paid back.

This group of women does commerce in secondhand clothing, as does OUMOU, who is the woman sitting first from the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing from wholesalers from Bamako. She makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the market and at her home. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
Trương is 37 years old and married with two children. He supports two dependents with his business in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

He works in agriculture farming food. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Trương faces in his life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet. This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Trương hopes to make enough money to provide for his kids, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 22 years old and lives in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is single and a fresh graduate from higher education. She wants to have a job to help her family and her siblings to finish their education but she can't get her credentials because her parents have no money to pay for them. She was thankful that the opportunity to do so came her way when she heard about the Students Education Assistance Loan Program of Paglaum MPC. She joined and requested a loan to pay for claiming her school credentials. Leonida sees herself to be in a position to help others in the future.

loans.use: to pay for claiming her school credentials.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman and has been blessed with six children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over two years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Guarani Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guarani está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, están muy entusiasmadas en poder seguir trabajando y luchando para poder ayudar a su familia por medio del esfuerzo. Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo.
Liz es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas de manera ambulante, y es por medio de este trabajo que viene mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, y va incrementando poco a poco sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con una mayor variedad de prendas de manera a poder seguir con su microempresa como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Guarani group is in its first cycle with the Women’s Committee program.  They are very enthusiastic about being able to continue working and striving to be able to help their families through their efforts.  All of them are active participants in the group’s activities.

Liz is part of this group and sells clothing on foot and she has been improving her and her family’s quality of life through this work.  She is also increasing her income little by little.

She is asking for this loan to be able to stock up on a variety of clothing so she can continue her small company as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration et le commerce de condiments.
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente KOROTOUMOU, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du poisson fumé, du sel et des boites de pâtes de tomate sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJEKAFO is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in condiments. 

The women of the group DJEKAFO are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, KOROTOUMOU, who is the second person from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase some onions, smoked fish, salt, and cans of tomato paste locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions, smoked fish, salt, and tomato paste

loans.name: Nhàn

texts.en:
Nhàn is 40 years old and she is married with three children. She lives with three dependents in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Nhàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nhàn faces in her life is not having a Biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a Biogas system.

In 2012, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhàn has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, she hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a Biogas system

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 26 years old. She has been farming for 9 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Elvina operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 2 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Elvina  dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe HORONYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de chaussure, de savons modernes et de jus.
Les femmes du groupe HORONYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente WASSA, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savons modernes. Elle compte acheter des cartons de savons sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group HORONYA is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in shoes, modern soaps, and juice drinks. 

The women of the group HORONYA are on their second solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, WASSA, who is the person standing second from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of modern soaps. She intends to purchase boxes of soaps locally from wholesalers. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and sometimes as she goes door to door. She plans on making a monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase modern soaps

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de poisson, du bois de chauffe et de sachet plastique.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FAFA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de sachet plastique. Elle compte acheter des cartons de sachet chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Konobougou, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in fish, firewood, and plastic baggies. 

The women of the group BENKADI are on their 9th solidarity loan. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their customers, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, FAFA, who is the person standing first from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of plastic baggies. She intends to purchase boxes of baggies from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic baggies

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
María, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la agilidad en los trámites y facilidad de pago que la institución le facilita, lo invertirá en la compra de variedad de mariscos frescos para mantener su negocio en el mercado.
Para María el crédito anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para mejorar su venta de mariscos, con la que se ha mantenido generando ingresos que ha utilizado para disminuir su nivel de endeudamiento y mejorar el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
María decided to take out a new loan because the agile process and ease of making payments to the institution makes this accessible to her. She will invest the loan in the purchase of an assortment of fresh shellfish in order to maintain her business in the market.
Her previous loan was of great help to her, improving her sales. It has allowed her to maintain and generate income which she has used to pay off some of her debts and improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fresh shellfish.

loans.name: Konotieyele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KONOTIEYELE est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, de fruits et légumes et de potasse.
Les femmes du groupe KONOTIEYELE sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MARIAM, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout vend de la potasse (utilisée adoucir ou pour ramollir certains ingrédients dans la préparation des plats alimentaires). Elle compte acheter des sacs de potasse alimentaire chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group KONOTIEYELE is composed of married women, who average 45 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Konobougou, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, fruit & vegetables, and potash. 

The women of the group KONOTIEYELE are on their 23rd solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, MARIAM, who is the person standing in the middle in the photo, sells potash (used to sweeten or tenderize certain ingredients in cooking). She intends to purchase bags of culinary potash from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase potash for use in cooking

loans.name: Ilma Isabel

texts.es: Ilma de 45 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos de 11 a 28 años. Ella  despues de haberse separado de su esposo , acepto la recomendación de su amiga de generar ingresos mediante un negocio donde ofreciere servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, siendo esta una actividad requerída por las vecinas. Ilm inició comprando dos lavadora con un crédito que le hizo su tio y posteriormente aprovechó las utilidades de este negocio, para reunir dinero y reinvertir en nuevas máquinas, hasta llegar a un número de 6 y adicionó triciclos para trasnportarlas desde su negocio ubicaco en su vivienda hasta el lugar donde la requerian, alrededor de su casa y de los sectores aledaños. Su meta de crecimiento no se detiene y espera comprar muchas mas lavadoras, y motocicletas para trasnportalas a lugares mas lejanos a su barrio, donde la potencialidad es mucho mayor. Esta es justamenbte la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará su primera motocicleta para transportar las máquinas de manera mas efectiva. Su trabajo lo desarrolla de lunes a domingos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde , su mayor desafio es lograr recursos suficientes, para lograr rapidamente cumplir sus metas de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Ilma is 45 years old and the mother of 5 children, who range from 11 to 28 years old. After separating from her husband, Ilma took a friend's advice about how to make money and, being that all her neighbors need to do laundry, began a business offering laundry machine rentals. Ilma began by purchasing two laundry machines with a loan form her uncle; she then took advantage of the business to save money and reinvest in additional machines. Now she has 6 machines and additional tricycles to transport the machines from her business (which is located in her house) to her clients, who live around her home and in neighboring areas. She works Monday-Sunday from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.
Ilma won't be held back from her goal of growing this business. She hopes to purchase many more washing machines and motorcycles to transport them to areas even further away form her neighborhood, where there is greater revenue potential. This is the reason for which Ilma requests a Kiva loan, which will be the first loan she takes out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to purchase her first motorcycle to transport the laundry machines in the most effective way. Ilma's greatest challenge is to obtain sufficient resources to enable her to quickly realize her goals of being prosperous.

loans.use: to purchase her first motorcycle, which she will use to transport machines.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, desea seguir trabajando en el cultivo de granos básicos y necesita capital para invertirlo en la compra de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y semilla, espera tener una mejor productividad, abastecer a su familia y vender a buen precio el resto.
Para José los efectos positivos que ha tenido al invertir el crédito anterior son una cosecha libre de plagas, una situación económica más estable con la que cancela sus deudas, mejoro el vestuario, alimentación y salud de su familia.
texts.en:
José would like to continue his work of growing basic grains, and he needs capital to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seeds. He hopes to have enough crop to feed his family and some left over to sell at a good price.
For José, the positive impacts of his last loan were a harvest free from plagues and pests; and a more stable financial situation which enabled him to pay off his debts and to better feed, clothe and care for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seeds.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George William is a 45-year-old married man with nine children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time lays bricks and offers phone-charging services. He faces challenges of competition and limited capital. However, he hopes to have a well-stocked shop. 

George William needs a loan to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to stock in his retail shop

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than eight years now. This is the source of their income.

Mary Grace wants to borrow a loan. She is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and floaters, and gasoline. With this loan, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, which they can then sell to the market. 

In the future, Mary Grace has hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and floaters, and gasoline

loans.name: Dovya Group

texts.en:
Jamila is aged in her 30s. She is married and has two daughters and two sons who are at school. She runs two services: a beauty salon and a cafe selling fresh milk, sodas and juices, which she has been doing for a period of four years. She starts working from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to realize a fair monthly profit.

Jamila has been a customer of Tujijenge Tanzania for more than one credit cycle. She used the previous credits, since repaid, to open her cafe business and bought salon hair products. Jamila received an income from business which she used to plow back to her business and cover part of the home food expenses. In the coming years, she would like to grow her businesses and life.

With her new credit request, she will improve her projects by buying salon hair products and cafe drinks.

Jamila will share this loan with her group, "Dovya," which consists of four members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products and cafe drinks.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. Lita is thankful to PMPC, as she was rescued for her capital needs.

Now, she availed herself of a loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Lita perseveres and always believes she will reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es una mujer muy trabajadora que esta luchando para poder seguir con su microempresa, que es la de las confecciones, es por medio de esto que pudo criar a sus hijos, y ayudar a su marido. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para la compra de una maquina de coser que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de Telas, hilos, accesorios,otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Matilde is a very hardworking woman who is striving to continue with her small clothing business.  This allowed her to raise her children and help her husband.  She says that she used her previous loan to buy a sewing machine that was very helpful.

She is asking for a loan today to buy fabric, thread, accessories, and other things so she can continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana a 54-year-old mother of two children settled for a living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has a stall in the market where she is vending fish to make a living. For 10 years in this business, she says that it helps her family a lot, and she was able to send her children to school. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying fish and shrimp to sell. Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC micro finance. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional varieties of fish, shells and shrimp to sell.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of fish, shells and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 6 de Enero está en su ciclo número 7mo. del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, para que por medio de su trabajo vayan mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortas variadas que ella misma hace y que después vende. Se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y lucha diaria.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su torta, como ser huevo, harina, dulces y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group, called “6 de Enero,” is in its seventh cycle in the Committee for Women program where the members help one another get ahead and improve through their work.

Sonia is one of the members and makes and sells sandwiches that she makes herself.  She defines herself as being a very hardworking lady who is working to grow and get ahead through her daily efforts.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies, such as eggs, flour, candy and other things for her business so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ruth Nohemy

texts.es:
A sus 60 años de edad la señora Ruth tiene un sueño tan puro el cual es poder emplear en su negocio de confección a madres cabezas de hogar para ayudarles a salir adelante y luchar por su familia. 

Ruth es una confeccionista de línea propia y trabaja a terceros, tiene 4 máquinas disponibles en su Mini-taller que adecuo en la comodidad de su hogar y sueña con progresar salir adelante mirar por un futuro y ayudar a su comunidad. 

Es madre de un hijo de 25 años de edad que aún vive con ella pro lo que ejerce su papel de ama de casa, y buscando siempre crecer y tener insumos para sacar algunas prendas solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de tela de diferentes colores para realizar sus prendas.
texts.en:
At 60 years of age, Ruth has a pure dream: to employ in her business mothers who are heads of households to help them to get ahead and work hard for their families. 

Ruth is a garment manufacturer who has her own line and works for third parties. She has 4 machines available in her mini-workshop which she has created in the comfort of her home. She hopes to progress, move forward, look towards the future and help her community.

She has a 25 year old son who still lives with her, which means she still has a role as housewife. As she is always seeking to develop and have supplies to make garments, she is requesting a loan, all of which she will use to invest in buying fabric of different colors to make her garments.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her own line of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gifts, flowers and decorations to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business where neighbors and town dwellers shop. This is how she earns money to support her family.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase stocks of goods, such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods, such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 38 years old. He is married with five children between the ages of 11 and 1. Two of them go to school.  He sells clothes and has been working in this business for the past year. With the loan requested, he would like to buy more skirts, shorts and dresses to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested and used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more skirts, shorts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Yesenia Yaneth

texts.es:
Yesenia, mejoro la venta de huevos con la inversión del financiamiento anterior en su negocio, comenta que hoy puede dar a su familia una mejor alimentación y la situación económica es más favorable.
Opta por solicitar más capital con el que comprara huevos al por mayor, de esta manera tendrá más clientes satisfechos y el margen de ganancias será mayor, espera administrar muy bien el crédito para tener buenos resultados.
texts.en: Yesenia improved her egg sales with the investment of the previous loan into her business. She comments that she can now provide her family with better food and their economic situation has improved. She has decided to request another loan which she will use to buy eggs wholesale, and in this way she will have more satisfied customers and her profit margins will be larger. She hopes to manage the loan very well so that she can get good results.

loans.use: to buy eggs wholesale so that she will have more satisfied customers and her profit margins will be larger

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Caminando Juntos” conformada por  05 socias solidarias y responsables. Anita de 28 años de edad, casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida como el cebiche. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos como talcos y colonias. Gracias a su esfuerzo y buen servicio ha logrado mejorar su negocio captando más clientes. Solicitó el crédito  para la compra de camote, limón, papa, pollo y pescado.
