Anita junto al grupo “Caminando Juntos” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por colaborar en su progreso. Anita es la primera del lado Izquierdo y viste polo manga larga de color negro.
texts.en: This is the "Caminando Juntos" ('Walking Together') group, made up of 5 supportive and responsible members. Anita is 28 years old and married with two dependent children. She makes a living selling food such as cebiche. As a secondary activity she sells cosmetic products such as talcum powder and cologne. As a result of her efforts and good service she has managed to develop her business and have more customers. She has requested the loan to purchase sweet potatoes, lemons, potatoes, chicken and fish. Anita and the "Caminando Juntos" group would like to thank the Kiva investors for supporting their progress. Anita is the first on the left and is wearing a black, long sleeved sweater.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, lemons, potatoes, chicken and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, beans, sugar, rice, sardines, bread, flour, corn, and sausages, among other products, to keep her store running

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, 27, is a dairy farmer in Kiangoso village in the rural western part of Kenya. The mother of four started dairy farming in 2009 in a run-down farm. Today, she keeps dairy cattle and poultry and grows various types of food crops. Her main income sources are milk and eggs.

Annah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Her farm has enough room for more cows but she is taking it one step at a time. The additional cow on the farm will help utilize the available space and pasture. There are other merits to this expansion, such as increased production of milk and reduced chances of shortages in case one animal cannot be milked for a particular reason.

Annah is going to use the profits from this investment to pay for her children's education. The availability of more milk will benefit her family in terms of food security and increased income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 31 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 10, and all of them go to school. 

She has been farming for 9 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 47 years old, married, and a resident of Don Jose Aguirre, Manukan Za Norte. She earns a living through farming and a sari-sari store.

She has been a member of PMPC for five years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for her farm and also to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store.

Beverly deeply wishes to continue being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste, aged 25 years, has been farming for 7 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, de produit cosmétique et de jus.
Les femmes du groupe DJEKADI sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA, personne au milieu est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du sel, du poisson fumé, du cube Maggi et des boites de patte de tomate sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 38 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJEKADI is composed of married women, who average 42 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, clothing, and cosmetic products, and juice drinks. 

The women of the group DJEKADI are on their 8th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, FANTA, who is the person in the middle in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase some onions, salt, smoked fish, Maggi cubes [bouillon], and cans of tomato paste locally from wholesalers. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 38,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions, salt, and tomato paste.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de fruits et légumes et d’encens.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente CHATA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du piment et des paniers de tomate chez les grossistes à N’Golodougou. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group consists of married women who are on average 37 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell condiments, fruit and vegetables, and incense. The Benkadi group of women are on their second group loan. Seeking to meet the huge demand of their customers, they resort to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Chata, the first person from right to left, is illiterate and currently sells condiments. She plans to buy onions, peppers and baskets of tomatoes from wholesalers in N'Golodougou. Retail sales are made for cash in the market, to a mixed clientele.

She expects monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Janeth de  46  años de edad, vive con sus  hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general,  en su negocio vende arroz, azúcar, maíz, café, frescos, manteca, frijoles, harina, papel higiénico, etc. vive en la aldea  los Chorritos,  al sur de Honduras.
Doña Ruth es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ruth está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, pollo, frescos, huevos, leche, azúcar, harina, aceite, etc. con el préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Ruth Janeth is 46 years old and lives with her children in her own home.  She has been selling groceries for 5 years and her store sells rice, sugar, corn, coffee, soft drinks, butter, beans, flour, and toilet paper, among other things.  She lives in the village of Chorritos in the south of Honduras.  She is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and she fights every day to improve her life.  

Ruth is asking for a loan to buy products such as corn, chicken, soft drinks, eggs, milk, sugar, flour, and oil so that she can increase her profits and improve the quality of her life as well.  Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, and at the same time to make the future better for her family.  

September 2014
San Lorenzo, Honduras

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, soft drinks, eggs, milk, sugar, flour, and oil for her business, among other products

loans.name: Timinadia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIMINADIA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 49 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de l’habillement et de savons.
Les femmes du groupe TIMINADIA sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MAMA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des puces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group TIMINADIA is composed of married women, who average 49 years of age and five children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Fana, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, clothing, and soaps. 

The women of the group TIMINADIA are on their 12th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, MAMA, who is the person sitting first from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of clothing. She intends to purchase a few lengths of Wax ’pagnes’ (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash her home and sometimes as she goes door to door. She plans on making a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 47 years old. She is married with four children aged between 23 and 8 years old, three of whom go to school. She sells vegetables and has been running a business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more vegetables to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, de produit cosmétique et de jus.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOU, première personne de la gauche vers la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de l’habillement. Elle compte acheter des pagnes de Bazin chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists of married women who are on average 34 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell condiments, clothing, cosmetics and juice. The Danaya group of women are on their fifteenth group loan. Seeking to meet the huge demand of their customers, they resort to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Fatou, the first person from left to right, is illiterate and currently sells clothing. She plans to buy Bazin pagnes (high-quality hand-dyed polished cotton fabric) from wholesalers in Bamako. Retail sales are made for cash from her home and in the market, to a mixed clientele.

She expects monthly profits of 55,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUIDOLO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, de lait et de calebasse.
Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDOLO sont à leurs vingt unième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente OUMOU, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de calebasse. Elle compte acheter des calebasses chez les grossistes à Somo. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group SIGUIDOLO is composed of married women, who average 32 years of age and two children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Konobougou, Préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, clothing, milk, and calabashes. 

The women of the group SIGUIDOLO are on their 21st solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, OUMOU, who is the person standing in the middle in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of calabashes. She intends to purchase some calabashes from wholesalers in Somo. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase calabashes

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet lives in the city of Ijevan in the Tavush region. He lives with his wife and retired mother. His son lives and works in Yerevan city as a football arbiter. Hamlet has no higher education and for many years he worked at the carpet factory as a worker, but after the collapse of the Soviet Union, the factory dissolved and after that he established his business. Since 1996 Hamlet and his wife have sold animal fodder such as wheat, barley and corn at the city’s wholesale market. As he says, this is a rather profitable business for his family especially during the autumn-winter period, but sometimes because of the lack of money it is hard for Hamlet to keep his stall assortment full.

He greatly needs this loan in order to buy a lot of animal fodder to sell, since as he says he will surely have a decent income with the coming cold seasons.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder to sell.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 44 years old and lives in the frontier village of Aygehovit in the Tavush region. Narine now lives alone since her son is in the army doing his military service, and her husband is working abroad and transferring money to his family. 

Narine has a vocational medical education and for several years she worked at the school as a nurse. Now she is unemployed and she has become a skilled grape grower. She established her nice vineyard with her husband when they were very young. They were also good at swine breeding, but since her husband is abroad now, she can manage only the grape growing activity. 

She sells the harvest from her vineyard to the workers of the grape processing plants right next to her house. She says she is happy with her work - it is a lot of work but she enjoys it. 

Narine is a master in her work and plans to improve her vineyard, so she is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy cords and pillars for her vineyard. This will fix the vines, as the harvest is heavy on the trees, and the pillars will help to prevent the branches from breaking.

loans.use: to buy cords and pillars for her vineyard, to help prevent the branches from breaking

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de savons modernes.
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente AMINATA, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savons modernes. Elle compte acheter des cartons de savons sur place chez les grossistes.
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group consists of married women who are on average 48 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell condiments, food preparations, and modern soaps. The Tiessiri group of women are on their sixteenth group loan. Seeking to meet the huge demand of their customers, they resort to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Aminata, the second person from right to left, is illiterate and currently sells modern soaps. She plans to buy cartons of soap from local wholesalers. Retail sales are made for cash from her home and sometimes as an itinerant vendor, to a mixed clientele.

She expects monthly profits of 35,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: buy modern soaps

loans.name: Timinadia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIMINADIA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de fruits et légumes.
Les femmes du groupe TIMINADIA sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente BAFOUNE, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du sel, du cube Maggi, et des boites de patte de tomate sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Timinadia group consists of married women who are on average 37 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the city of Dioïla in the Dioïla district, which is part of the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell food preparations, condiments, and fruit and vegetables. The Timinadia group of women are on their fifteenth group loan. Seeking to meet the huge demand of their customers, they resort to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Bafoune, the first person standing from left to right, is illiterate and currently sells condiments. She plans to buy onions, salt, Maggi cubes and cans of tomato paste from wholesalers. Retail sales are made for cash in the market, to a mixed clientele.

She expects monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina has been a farmer since she got married. For many years, this has been her only way of living. She had her previous loan used for her farm and she repaid it successfully. Her farm is in need of fertilization in order to restore farm nutrients. For this, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure. In the future, Felina wants to make improvements to her house and to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store with rice, oil, cold cuts, milk, eggs, cleaning supplies, and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, sheetrock, and other materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has four children with whom she lives in a two-room house. She has had some problems, like inadequate finances to send her children to school, the death of her father, and the disappearance of her sister who when she was sixteen years old left their home and till present no one has even seen or heard from her again. 

With the new loan requested, she will buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pay for labor; she will also invest part of the loan in poultry farming by buying more chicks, feed, and vaccines.  This activity will help the community in that food will be in constant supply while the waste from the poultry will be used as manure for the cultivated food crops.

With the profit from these agricultural activities, she will be able to sponsor her children in school, use some to pay for hospital bills and improve on the needs of the family; she will save some for the future. 

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the organization trains on income generating activities before disbursing out the loan, their interest rates are extremely low

loans.use: To buy seedlings like beans, corns, yams, and for fertilizer, chicks, and things for the chicks

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en: Fiona lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with no children .She takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.  She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler.  She resides in a rented house and the family house has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses include medication, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mirembe

texts.en:
Mirembe lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; two of them go to school. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and utilities.

She operates a beauty salon at the market in a shop that she rents on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy braids, weaves, relaxers, treatments and oils. Her major business challenge includes power shortages and seasonality. Her goal is to buy better hair dryers and seats for her salon.

loans.use: To buy braids,weaves,relaxers,treatments and oils for her beauty salon

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni is married with four children and three of them go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy fingers of green bananas, beans, and cooking oil.   She works six days a week. Her major business challenge is seasonality. She is aspiring of building rental houses. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy fingers of green bananas, beans, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mily

texts.en: Milly is single and has four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas and charcoal and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal. She sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to educate her children to the university level. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married with three children; all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells green bananas and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation. She aspires to build rental houses.  She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is single with three children and all go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a restaurant from home and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy irish potatoes, cooking oil, green bananas, rice and flour. She works  seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to expand her business and also to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy irish potatoes, green bananas, rice, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is single with three children. She has no additional family members. 

She sells used clothes door-to-door on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She aspires to open up a boutique to serve her customers better. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their good customer care. 

She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Voeng's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Bakan district of Pursat province, Voeng is 60 years old and married. She has three children and now they all have their own employment. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer for 31 years. She can earn about 42,000 KHR per day and save about 30,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Voeng with VisionFund. She has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already. She completely paid back the loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Om Santi Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is named "Om Santi Shg" and is from a small village in Koraput district in Odisha, India. This small village is very far from the capital and is in its growth stage. All of the members of the group want to help their families and their community. All the group members are women. All of the members work at rural activities such as raising farmyard animals, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Kunti, the lady seated third from the left hand side, is president of this group. Kunti is 35 years old and married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children. Currently, she has 15 goats. She, along with her group, is requesting this loan and she will use her portion to buy balanced feed to continue raising her animals. She hopes to continue fighting for her family and to improve their lifestyle. All the group members are very excited and very grateful to Kiva's lenders for this kind of help and support.

Note:- Kunti the name listed first in the list is the president and the other Kunti is a member of this group.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Chheang, 60, is married with nine children. For the last 30 years, she has been farming rice as the primary business for her family.  She also supplements this income by making snacks which she sells. Her businesses earn her about KHR 40,000 per day to live on and she is also able to save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Chheang through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Maa Santoshi (A) Group

texts.en:
The self help group “Maa Santoshi Shg (A)” is starting its first loan cycle with People's Forum. This group consists of 10 members and Rajini is the president. She is the lady seated second from the right-hand side in the picture. The members of this self help group are engaged in various businesses such as producing and selling vegetables, selling food, producing milk, and selling flowers. This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Rajini. She says that she has a business in which she produces and sells vegetables and also sells cow's milk. She learned the trade from her family, since they had the same type of business. With a small amount of capital, she was able to start her own enterprise. The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying cows. She will acquire the animals in her community and raise them. Rajini will sell her products at the markets in the city of Jeypore. Working in this manner enables her to generate income so that she can support her family. 

Rajini is 36 years old, married and has five children. When asked what she likes about People's Forum, Rajini said that she enjoys the loans and the training classes offered by the organization. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase cows for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Sudhansu

texts.en:
Sudhansu is a bright young boy. He is 23 years old and was born and raised in Balasore, a small city in Odisha, India. He was raised by his mother, father, grandmother, and grandfather, and is a well-brought up boy. He was a good student in high school and went to university after high schooling. 

Sudhansu studies in the Hotel Management and Tourism department. He is currently a second-year student and takes classes on campus. Sudhansu needs to pay for his course fee for this semester but does not have the money, so he is applying for a loan. 

The recent marriage of his elder sister had caused huge expenditure for his family. As a result, Sudhansu’s father was unable to finance the rest of his son’s course fees. Sudhanshu was somehow paying the college fees by working in restaurants but there was no planning for his future payment  of his course fees. 

A People's Forum Student education loan made this possible by providing him this loan, which drives out all his worries.

loans.use: to pay the course fee for his Hotel Management studies

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar is 37 years old and living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land. Mostly, he likes to cultivate rice. In his land area, there is no canal system for watering but the rice crop needs much water for irrigation purposes. So he has to arrange another source for his crop irrigation. Now he has decided to irrigate his land by the tube well system. For this purpose, he has to bear some additional amount. Therefore, Azhar has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to irrigate his crop with the tube well system

loans.name: Sarba Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a 24-year-old a married lady who lives with her husband, parent-in-laws and a four year old child. For the past five years she has run a grocery shop and tailoring business out of a sheet metal structure that she has set up near the house. Her shop is always well stocked with vegetables, cosmetics, bangles, and items for her tailoring business, such as thread and various colored cloths. 

She dreams of having a big, formal shop that’s filled with all of the grocery and cosmetic items the women in her village want, along with an expanded tailoring business. She wants to use her loan to buy more of the necessary items, specifically bracelets, prepackaged food, and face creams. She would also like to buy more high-quality cloth to use for her tailoring. With the additional income, she hopes to be able to pay for her child to have a good education.

Lakshmi, along with her group, has requested this loan and she will use her portion to  expand her grocery shop and tailoring business by purchasing vegetables, bangles and high quality cloth.The other members of this group are engaged in different activities such as tailoring, milk selling, etc.They are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: To expand her grocery shop and tailoring business by purchasing vegetables, bangles, and high quality cloth.

loans.name: Jay Hanumana Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2014, eleven women from a small village of Angul district stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families. They formed a group named Jay Hanumana Self-Help Group (SHG). The members of Jay Hanumana Self-Help Group are all women from a district of Angul in Odisha, India. One of them is Nirmala, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her raised hand in the photo is Nirmala. 

Nirmala is 22 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. 

Initially, she started with growing only a few vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumber, lady finger and brinjal. She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale. 

Nirmala, along with her group, has requested a loan from which she will use her portion to purchase land, seeds, and fertilizers. She is very thankful to Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tanveer Ahmad

texts.en:
Tanveer Ahmad is 25, living with his parents and sibling in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a milkman by trade; he sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in large quantity. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in large quantity.

Therefore, Tanveer Ahmad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

Tanveer Ahmad is very happy receiving this loan; he thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Bhubaneswari Group

texts.en:
Ahalya is the leader of a group that lives in Paikbahal of Tarbha block in the district of Subarnapur, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 31 years. She has a small family comprising four members: her husband and one daughter and one son, aged 5 and 10 years. The member sitting 1st from the left in the first row with  is Ahalya.  

Like most families in the locality, she and her husband are running a vegetable shop. She sells tomatoes, brinjal, potatoes, cauliflower, etc. in her shop. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

Ahalya’s husband helps her in purchasing vegetables from different villages and nearby towns to run the shop smoothly. At present, her family income is Rs. 5,000 per month from her vegetable shop, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to avail herself of a loan from Mahashakti. From the loan amount, she will purchase rice in bulk quantity and grocery items to access a cash discount and also save transportation cost, which she incurs frequently. 

She has a dream to have a wholesale shop in the town and educate her children in a better school in the town.

Previously there were 15 members but subsequently one member refused to take loan, hence in the group 
there are 14 members. The other members of her group are Hemanti, Kabita, Pankajini, Tul, Lakshmi, Jashobanti, Saraswiti, Souda, Basanti, Suruchi, Mithila, Urmila, and Bhala, who are doing individual businesses in the town.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables from vendors.

loans.name: M. Iqbal

texts.en:
M. Iqbal is 44, married, and a proud father of three. He laid the foundations of his business at a very young age, 20 years ago. Now his business has a good name. Items such as ovens, refrigerators, washing machines, irons, juicers and blenders, and a variety of other electronics are available at his shop. His hard work and dedication has helped him make many loyal customers. 

Given the advancement of technology, new and updated models of electronics come to the market everyday. Therefore he wants to buy new and upgraded electronics to provide to his customers and increase his sales.

M. Iqbal has therefore requested a loan to help him with the purchase. He wants to expand his business in the future with the savings he will make from his sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of additional electronic items for his shop.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia, age 38, is a mother of four children. Her son owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop including threads, needles, cloth etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his mother, Safia, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her son. Her son will purchase the needed things such as a tailoring machine, needles, thread and fabric with the help of the loan. Safia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine, needles, thread and fabric for her son's business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales, des produits divers, du poisson et des cartes de recharge.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 16ème prêt solidaire. SALI, 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 cartes ORANGE de 1000F, 15 cartes MALITEL de 1000F, 60 cartes MALITEL de 200F, 10 cartes ORANGE de 2000F, 2 cartes ORANGE de 5000F, 3 cartes MALITEL de 5000F, 1 carte ORANGE de 10 000F et 1 carte MALITEL de 10 000F. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya group are on average 43 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in Tene/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women became acquainted through kinship and run businesses trading grain cereals, miscellaneous products, fish and mobile phone recharge cards. Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women ine the Danaya group are on their sixteenth group loan.

Sali, the first woman sitting from left to right in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy twenty 1,000-franc Orange cards, fifteen 1,000-franc Malitel cards, sixty  200-franc Malitel cards, ten 2,000-franc Orange cards, two 5,000-franc Orange cards, three 5,000-franc Malitel cards, one 10,000-franc Orange card, and one 10,000-franc Malitel card.

She buys locally from wholesalers, and conducts her sales to a customer base of both women and men, in cash and often on credit. 

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs she will spend on health, food, clothing, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Maria Abelina

texts.es:
María, tiene granja de gallinas mejoradas y también una porqueriza, es casada, tiene dos hijos varones y una hembra, todos viven juntos; su negocio inicio a funcionar hace 20 años, con ayuda de su madre aprendió el oficio, trabaja en un horario de cinco de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, su negocio poco a poco ha ido evolucionando, su experiencia le permite tener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Utilizará el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de concentrado para cerdos y gallinas, así como también insumos agrícolas para poder cultivar granos básicos, espera administrar muy bien el crédito para mejorar el cuido de los animales y mejorar el margen de ganancias cuando los venda.
Sus aspiraciones son diversificar más su negocio, cancelar sus deudas y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
María has a hen farm and pigs. She is married and has three children - two boys and a girl. The family lives together. María started her business 20 years ago. She learned her trade with the help of her mother. María works from 5am until 5pm. Her business has evolved little by little and her experience allows her to ensure that she has satisfied customers.

María will use this loan to buy feed for pigs and hens as well as farming supplies for growing basic grains. María hopes to manage this loan very well in order to improve how she cares for the animals and to improve her profit margin.

María aspires to diversifying her business, paying off her debts, and paying for necessities for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and hens as well as farming supplies for growing basic grains.

loans.name: Sandra Rosibel

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene una hija, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien reside en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura junto a su familia, lleva dos año de hacer sus propios cultivos de arroz, siendo esta su generación de ingresos. La producción es de buena calidad y es vendida en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras, el cual va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, urea, formula,fungicidas, herbicidas y otros insumos para dar asistencia al cultivo de arroz, con el propósito de sacar mejor producción. Su plan es poder construir su propia casa y darle buen estudio a su hija.
texts.en: Sandra is 23 years old and has a daughter. She lives with her husband in the municipality of Negrito, in Yoro. Sandra has always worked with her family in farming. For two years now she has had her own rice crops, and it is with this work that she earns an income. Snadra's crops are of good quality and they are sold at the local market. This is Sandra's second loan cycle. She is applying for 10,000 Lempira, which she will use to buy fertilisers, urea, chemicals for helping crops to grow, anti-fungal treatments, weed-killer and other supplies to look after her rice crops. The aim of this loan is to have a better production of crops. Sandra's plan for the future is to build her own house and to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, urea, chemicals for helping crops to grow, anti-fungal treatments, weed-killer and other supplies to look after her rice crops.

loans.name: Maa Hundi Thakurani Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Hundi Thakurani Shg consists of 10 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. One of them is Lalita, who was selected as the President of Maa Hundi Thakurani Shg. The lady standing with her raised hand in the photo is Lalita. She is 29 years old and is living with her husband and her four children. All her children are in school. She hopes to see them later on as officers serving the country. She is engaged in the activity of selling cow's milk in the village and nearby market. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

Lalita, along with her group, has requested a loan of 150,000 INR, which will help her to purchase more cows and fodder for her dairy business. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase a cow and fodder for cows.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and fodder for her dairy business.

loans.name: Saikrupa Shg Group

texts.en:
Sunadei, the lady standing with her raised hand, is a 26-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her parents-in-law and husband. Her husband is a farmer. For the past four years, Sunadei has been selling flower plants and cultivating vegetables in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Sunadei is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the second leader of the group, Saikrupa Self Help Group (SHG). There are 11 members in the group and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture, selling milk, and operating grocery shops. Sunadei has a dream of providing a better standard of living to her family. 

Sunadei, along with her group, has requested a loan of 165,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase small flower plants, seeds and fertilizers. She, along with her group, says "Thank you Kiva and People's Forum" for this help and support.

loans.use: To purchase small plants, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariela Yaquelin

texts.es:
La Joven Mariela de 25  años de edad, vive con su mama  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo, huevos, papel higiénico, etc. vive en una ciudad al sur de Honduras. 
Mariela es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos y surtir la pulpería como ser: pollo, arroz, frijoles, harina, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc.  Con  el préstamo desea mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio,  bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del  2014.
texts.en:
Young Mariela, of 25 years of age, lives with her mom in her own house. She has made a living for 5 years selling groceries. In her store she sells sodas, fried pastries, beans, rice, dairy products, chicken, eggs, toilet paper, etc. She lives in a city south of Honduras. 

Mariela is an entrepreneurial woman who wishes to move forward and improve her quality of life. She is requesting a loan to purchase products and replenish her small grocery store with: chicken, rice, beans, flour, lard, soap, sodas, etc. With the loan, she wishes to improve her income and also  her quality of life and her family's. 

Her dream is to have a good business, well replenished, and at the same time improve her future alongside her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2014.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, rice, beans, flour, lard, soap, sodas, etc. for her business

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Nirupama, the lady standing with her raised hand, is a 34-year-old divorced lady living with her parents and her two children. She runs a snacks stall in her village; she has a few years of experience in this activity. She sells snack items like samosas (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), 'Idli' (a popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice),and  'Wada' (lentil doughnuts) etc. in her shop. She wants to expand her business by selling more of the items she sells now and to make a display case for her shop for the products she cooks. She says that doing so will attract more customers to her shop. 

Nirupama, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 180,000 INR. She wants to use her portion of the loan for purchasing raw materials like potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, rice, etc. and for making a display case for her shop. She has a dream of having her children study in a good school and saving some money for their future. Maa Mangala self Help Group(SHG) has 12 members of which all are women, and are all neighbours.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, spices, edible oil, lentils, and rice and for making a display case for her shop.

loans.name: Jay Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Kanchana, the lady standing with her raised hand, is a 56-year-old lady living with her husband and two children. She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffaloes. She sells five litres of milk per day and earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of four persons. She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it bigger. 

Kanchana, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 120,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to expand her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future. All the members of this group are engaged in the dairy business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and renovate the cattle shed.

loans.name: Basudev Shg Group

texts.en:
Bimala, the lady standing with her raised hand, is 47 years old and married. She lives in a village in the Angul district of Odisha, India with her husband and her one daughter. Her husband earns a living by farming rice and vegetables. She is engaged in the activity of selling rice in her village, having been in this business for three years, and she manages to earn about 3,000 INR per month. This is a group loan for Bimala's group of eight women named Basudev SHG. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Bimala wants to use her loan portion to buy more rice in bulk and sell it in the market. She hopes to increase her rice business and earn more income to better her living conditions. The members of the group Basudev Shg are very ambitious and are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, retail stores, catering, dairy farming, vegetable selling etc.

They are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for this kind opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Samuel Antonio

texts.es:
Samuel, es una persona reconocida en su comunidad por dedicarse a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo de un año de edad; el negocio lo desempeña junto a su compañera de vida en un horario de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, es una actividad que heredo de sus padres, lo realiza de manera independiente hace 5 años, los terrenos en que trabaja son de su propiedad, por lo que no es necesario pagar arrendamiento.
Invertirá en comprar concentrado para ganado y 10 bolsas de alimento para cerdos, le permitirá alimentar a los animales que ya posee, se mantendrá trabajando y generando ingresos económicos para mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar, como dificultad para el negocio es el alto nivel de competencia y las diferentes enfermedades a las que están expuestos los cerdos y el ganado. 
Sus proyectos son trabajar de la mano con Padecomsm para ir mejorando su negocio, tener más ganancias necesarias para darle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Samuel is a person known in his community for working in the raising of cattle and pigs. He lives with his life's companion and a one year old son. He works at his business with his wife from six in the morning until three in the afternoon. He inherited this activity from his parents and he has done it independently for 5 years. He owns the and he worked on so he doesn't have to pay rent. 

He will invest in buying concentrate for cattle and 10 bags of pig feed. This will allow him to feed his animals that he already has. He will keep working and generating income to improve his family's living conditions. A difficulty for his business is the high level of competition and the different diseases the pigs and cattle are exposed to.

His projects are to work with Padecomsm to improve his business,and earn the income he needs to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for cattle and 10 bags of pig feed, which will allow him to feed his animals.

loans.name: Ligia Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ligia de 41  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa,  se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y hojaldras,  vive en la aldea  de los Chorritos,  al sur de Honduras.
Doña Ligia es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, queso, manteca, azúcar y leña, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Doña Ligia su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Ligia is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in her house. For 20 years, she has had a business selling doughnuts, quesadillas and puff pastries. She lives in the town of Los Chorritos, in southern Honduras.  

Ligia is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and who fights every day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for the loan to buy products such as corn, cheese, lard, sugar and firewood. With the help of this loan she intends to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a new client who wants to work Prisma.

Ligia's dream is to have a good business and to increase her clientele as well as improve her future with her family.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, lard, sugar, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La Señora Isidora de 56  años de edad es casada vive con su pareja en su casa ubicada en la aldea el comercio San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la comercialización de golosinas de manera ambulante.
Doña Isidora está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, verduras, carnes, pollo, leche, arroz, frijoles, etc. con su ganancia desea comprar mas productos para comercializar y seguir progresando y mejorando su calidad de vida. 
Doña Isidora es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora que día con día se prepara para salir a vender sus productos que a diario prepara para ofrecer a sus clientes.
El sueño de doña Isidora es mejorar sus ingresos y terminar de reparar su vivienda porque la desea repellar y pintar.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Isidora is 56 years old. She is married and lives with her spouse in her house located in San Lorenzo, in the valley in southern  Honduras. For a long time she has worked selling snacks as a street vendor. 

Isidora is asking for the loan to buy corn, firewood, vegetables, meat, chicken., milk, rice, beans, etc. With her profits she wants to buy more products to sell and keep progressing and improving her quality of life.
 
Isidora is a very humble and hardworking person who day to day prepares to go out and sell her products that she prepares every day to offer her customers. 

Isidora's dream is to improve her income and finish repairing her home. She wants to re-finish the walls and paint it.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September of 2014.

loans.use: to buy firewood, vegetables, meat, chicken, milk, beans, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yalile

texts.es:
Yalile es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Yalile y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Yalile desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Yalile is a humble and hardworking woman who has dedicated a great portion of her life to caring for her children. She lives in the municipality of La Dorada, where she outdoes herself in the kitchen, since her business is preparing orders of food such as tamales, chorizo sausage, empanadas, and more.

She sells these foods mainly to local people who know how good a cook Yalile is and that they will always get delicious dishes that have been prepared very well.

Yalile wants to increase her food sales and to work more comfortably, so she is requesting a loan to buy some cooking utensils and supplies to continue making her recipes. 

This loan will allow her to further her business, and so to make enough money to give her the opportunity to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and supplies to prepare her recipes and continue with her work

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, desea continuar mejorando el estilo de vida familiar y su situación económica, por lo que se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar dos cerdos y una vaquilla, de esta manera ampliará su negocio y podrá tener un nuevo rubro para atraer nuevos clientes.
Con el crédito anterior logro fortalecer su negocio lo suficiente para mejorar su situación económica y cubrir las necesidades de su familia, estos buenos resultados le han hecho motivarse para continuar trabajando con préstamos para lograr progresar.
texts.en:
Lucio wants to continue improving his family’s living conditions and financial situation, so he decided to request a new loan to buy two pigs and a heifer. In this way, he will expand his business and will attract new customers.

He was able to strengthen his business with the previous loan. His financial situation improved and he was able to cover the home expenses. Such good results have motivated him to continue working to get ahead with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two milk cows and 300 chickens for fattening to try to save her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee farm

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José, vive con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene casa propia, no recibe ayuda económica del extranjero; se dedica a atender una mini ferretería, su negocio nació hace dos años, lo atiende solo y los fines de semana le apoyan sus hijos, hasta el momento lo ha administrado bien.
El préstamo le será de utilidad para comprar bombillos, linternas, baterías, cintas aislantes, etc., surtirá mejor su negocio, venderá más y tendrá mayores ganancias, espera que con la inversión su negocio tenga mayor popularidad y lograr cancelar su deuda con buen record crediticio.
Los sueños de José son que su negocio crezca y así tener una economía más estable para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose lives with his two young children. He has his own house. He does not receive financial support from abroad. He works in a mini hardware store which he opened two years ago. He works alone and during the weekends his children help him. Until now he has managed it well. He will use the loan to buy light bulbs, flashlights, batteries, insulating tape, etc. He will stock up his business better, will sell more and will have more earnings. He hopes that with this investment his business becomes more popular and he is able to pay off his debt with a good credit record. Jose's dreams are that his business grows so that his finances are more stable to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy light bulbs, flashlights, batteries, insulating tape, etc. to stock up his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a supply of mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, porque es una herramienta importante para mejorar su negocio, comprará insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos, concentrado para alimentar el ganado y le dará mantenimiento al molino nixtamal, así seguirá satisfaciendo  a sus clientes.
Don Rubén invirtió el crédito anterior en su negocio, con lo que mejoró la rentabilidad y las ganancias, por la buena administración los efectos han sido positivos, da a sus clientes un servicio de calidad y las condiciones familias son más favorables.
texts.en:
Rubén decided to request a new loan because it's an important tool for improving his business.

He'll buy agricultural inputs to grow basic grains and concentrated feed for the livestock, and he'll provide maintenance for the nixtamal mill.  That way he can continue to satisfy his customers.

Rubén invested the previous loan in his business and improved his profitability and earnings.  The effects have been positive because of his good administration.  He gives his customers quality customer service and his family's circumstances are more favorable.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and concentrated feed, and to maintain his nixtamal mill

loans.name: Jose Elenilson

texts.es:
José, ofrece el servicio de transporte, esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para subsistir con su familia, lo fundo hace 3 años, no tiene un horario fijo, tiene como ventaja la preferencia de los clientes y como desventaja son los desperfectos mecánicos que su vehículo presenta en algunas ocasiones y por tal razón no puede realizar su trabajo; José es soltero, pero tiene hijos, los cueles dependen económicamente de él.
Lo utilizara para comprar alicate, destornilladores, juego de llaves, etc., y dar mantenimiento al vehículo; brindara seguridad y tendrá a su disposición herramientas para portar en su vehículo en caso de una emergencia, pretende tener su equipo de trabajo en buenas condiciones para mantenerse trabajando y mejorando su situación económica. 
Su visión es mejorar las condiciones de su equipo de trabajo para tener su negocio funcionando y dar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Jose offers transportation services. This work is his source of income to support himself and his family. He started 3 years ago and has no fixed schedule. His advantage is being preferred by his customers, and his disadvantage are the occasional breakdowns of his vehicle due to mechanical failures, which at times do not let him work. Jose is single, but he has children who depend on him financially. He will use the loan to buy pliers, screwdrivers, key sets, etc., and to maintain his vehicle. This will make him safe and he will have some tools handy to carry in his vehicle in case of an emergency. He wants to have his work tools in good condition so he keeps on working and improving his financial situation. His goal is to improve the condition of his work tools in order to have a running business and give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy pliers, screwdrivers, key sets, etc. and maintain his vehicle; to be safe and have tools handy to carry in his vehicle.

loans.name: Luis Mario

texts.es: Luis tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su padre de 60 años de edad quien está bajo su cargo. Luis trabaja como jornalero desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite mantener la economía de su hogar. Luis habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea reparar las condiciones de su vivienda de manera progresiva. En esta ocasión  desea mejorar las condiciones del techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Luis is 42  years old and he lives in his own house with his 60 year old father who is under his care. Luis has worked as a daily laborer for many years which allows him to support the household finances. Luis lives in very humble conditions and wishes to repair his house progressively. This time he wants to improve his house's roof, so he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheet, wood and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheet, wood and nails to repair his house's roof.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Cuando su esposo fue pensionado y recibió su dinero por concepto de jubilación, Claudia de 34 años convenció a su esposo de invertir en bienes raices y así fue que compró una casa, la remodeló, construyendo apartamentos que finalmente arrendó y empezaron a generarle nuevos ingresos. Hoy su meta no se detiene y ha planeado para mas adelante, construír dos apartamentos nuevos y abrir una miscelanea en uno de ellos al que piensa adicionarle un local, pues su decisión es generar ingresos familiares, para lograr educar a sus hijos con la mayor calidad posible. Ella y su esposo tienen 5 años de experiencia y aprovechan su saber, para producir nuevas ideas que le permitan multiplicar su dinero, asi como la de vender minutos de lunes a domingos, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, negocio que constituye nuevas entradas de dinero para su hogar. En la actualidad  está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financimiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Materiales constructivos, para hacer mejoramiento a sus apartamentos y comprar planes de  minutos a celulares, con ello su negocio mejorará pues tendra aumento en sus utilidades de negocio y mejorara las condiciones de sus inquilinos.
io principalmente
texts.en:
Claudia, 34, convinced her husband to invest in real estate when he retired and received his retirement income.  She bought and remodeled a house, building apartments that ultimately she rented, which began to generate new income.  She keeps going with her current goal, and she has planned ahead to build two new apartments and open a variety store in one of them.  She decided to generate income for the family to be able to give her children the highest quality education possible.

She and her husband have five years of experience and they're making the most of their knowledge to come up with new ideas for greatly increasing their money.  For example, selling minutes from Monday through Sunday, from 7 in the morning until 8 at night, is a business that will provide new household income. 

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She's going to buy construction supplies to make improvements on her apartments.  She's also going to buy mobile phone minutes.  With this her business will improve because she'll increase her business profits and improve her tenants' circumstances.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and mobile phone minutes

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina, invirtió en la compra de cerdos y aves de corral el préstamo anterior, ha recuperado lo invertido con buenas ganancias con las que puede cancelar sus deudas, da a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida y tiene  más oportunidades de continuar trabajando para progresar.
Para ampliar su negocio ha optado por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el cultivo de maíz, comprara 8 qq de abono y pagara mano de obra para realizar los trabajos en el campo, abastecerá a su familia de alimento y no tendrá necesidad de comprar maíz a precios altos.
texts.en:
Angelina invested the previous loan in buying pigs and poultry.  She recouped her investment with good profits, with which she can pay back her debt.  She gives her children a better quality of life and has more opportunities to keep on working and making progress.

Angelina decided to request another loan to invest in growing corn to expand her business.  She's going to buy eight quintals of soil amendments and pay for the labor to do the farm work.  She'll supply her family with food and not have to buy corn at high prices.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Bakan district, Sok is aged 51 years and married with seven children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last 35 years, she and her husband have been farming rice. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sok with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow rice successfully and make more rice so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Ra is aged 48 years and married with two children. To make a living, she has been farming cassava and growing rubber for 28 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Ra is just beginning with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to increase her family’s income for a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sreylim's Group

texts.en:
Aged 28 years, Sreylim is widowed and lives with her two children in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She earns a living through farming rice, which she has been in for 10 years. She can earn about 36,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and is able to save about 24,000 KHR each day for the future.
 
This is the first loan for Sreylim with VisionFund. She is now leading her group of two to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nilakatheswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Nilakatheswar Self Help Group was formed with nine members in 2014 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Swagatika as the leader of their group. 

The lady standing with her raised hand is Swagatika. She is a 30-year-old single mother living with her parents and her only child. For seven years, Swagatika has been working as a daily laborer to support her small family. Her income is not sufficient to support the family, so Swagatika started cultivating vegetables, paddy and being involved in the mushroom cultivating business. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Swagatika, along with her group, has requested a loan from which she will use her portion to buy more mushroom seeds, straw, and other raw materials, and to repair her space where the mushrooms are cultivated, so that she can add to her family’s income. 

Swagatika says that by selling mushrooms, she can support her family and she can send her child to a good school; through that, she can provide a better education to her child. The other members of the group Nilakatheswar Self Help Group are involved in fish selling, agriculture, and retail stores.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing mushroom seeds, straw, and other raw materials, and to repair her space where the mushrooms are cultivated.

loans.name: Maa Adishakti Shg Group

texts.en:
The group Maa Adishakti Self Help Group (SHG) has 12 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing with her raised hand in the photo is Aparna, who is the leader of the group. 

Aparna is a 35-year-old woman who is married to a worker of Nuagaon village in Cuttack district, Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are in school. Aparna lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, Aparna has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling her product to distributors for the past five years. She supplies her rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Aparna, together with the group Maa Adishakti Shg, are requesting a loan from Peoples Forum from which she will use her portion for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover operational costs. 

Their goal is to increase their business activity. All are very thankful to Kiva and People's Forum for this great help and support.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover operational costs.

loans.name: Sampurna Shg Group

texts.en:
Sampurna Self Help Group (SHG) consists of eight women from a village in the Cuttack district of Odisha. They formed this group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among them. One of them is Amita, who was selected as the president of Sampurna Self Help Group.
