The lady standing with her raised hand in the photo is Amita. Amita is 36 years old and is staying with her husband and her only child. Her child is in school. She hopes to see him as an officer in a company. She has a few acres of land in her village and she is utilizing her land in sugarcane cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

Amita, along with her group, has requested a loan of 120,000 INR, in which she will use her portion to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Shg Group

texts.en:
Sita is a 47-year-old woman living with her husband, her one daughter and her one son who are 20 and 16 years old, respectively, in a small village of Odisha. To manage her family she started a grocery store at her home, where 100 families depend on her grocery store. 

In this way, she is earning 3,500 INR per month. She has kept grocery items like rice, lentils, cooking oil, salt, sugar, spices, noodles, potatoes, onions etc., in her grocery store. She purchases these items in small amounts, not in bulk, because she lacks funds. She cannot meet the growing customer demands. As a woman, it is difficult to go to the market very frequently, and she is not able to make her products available when her customers need them. 

She wants to purchase these grocery items in bulk and set up shelves in her grocery store, so that she can meet the present growing customer demand for grocery items. 

Sita, along with her group, has applied for a loan of 150,000 INR in which she will use her portion to purchase the above grocery items. The other members of this Jay Jagannath Self Help Group (SHG) are engaged in different activities, and their aim is to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, lentils, cooking oil, salt, sugar, spices, noodles, potatoes, onion, etc., in bulk for her grocery store

loans.name: Franklin Alexander

texts.es: Franklin de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven trabajador que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante desempeñándose como albañil, esta actividad él,  la realiza desde hace más de 6 años por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia y tiene muchos clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Franklin desea construir un pozo en su vivienda, para lo que necesita pagar mano de obra y comprar algunos materiales y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tubos de cemento, ladrillo, cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra para construir un pozo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Franklin, age 24, lives in his own home, together with his family.  He is a hardworking young man who makes an effort everyday to get ahead.  He works in construction.  He has been in this line of work for more than six years, so he has a lot of experience and many customers who ask for his services.  

Franklin wants to build a well for his home.  Because of this, he needs to pay for labor and some supplies, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement tubes, bricks, cement, sand, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: to invest in cement tubes, bricks, cement, and sand, and to pay for the labor to build a well for his home.

loans.name: Akyz

texts.ru: Акыз 63 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Акыз высшее педагогическое образование, она на пенсии, однако не прекращает работать в школе библиотекарем, также дополнительно много лет занимается полеводством и  животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Акыз на сегодняшний день имеется 1 дойная корова и 1,52 ГА земли, где Акыз выращивает фасоль для реализации оптовым покупателям. Экологически чистая фасоль пользуется большим спросом. Также она реализует молоко и яблоки. Акыз начала сбор урожая фасоли, однако не хватает средств для завершения, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является найм рабочих и аренда сельскохозяйственной техники для сбора урожая фасоли. Доходы от кредита Акыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует купить машину для своей семьи.
texts.en: Akyz is 63, married, and the mother of five children. She has a college degree in education and receives a pension, though she hasn't stopped working as a librarian at the school. For many years she has also planted crops and raised livestock. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a dairy cow and a 1.52 hectare plot of land where she grows beans for wholesale. Organic beans sell for a good price, and she also sells milk and apples. Akyz has started to harvest the beans, but she doesn't have the resources to finish, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank in order to hire workers and rent equipment to harvest the beans. She will use her profits to continue investing in her business and to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest organic beans

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has two children, both of whom go to school. Margaret has a business selling used clothes at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works seven days a week.

Margaret has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more blouses, skirts, and shirts. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully-stocked boutique and also to start importing used clothes.  Margaret resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, and shirts

loans.name: Maa Lankeswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Santosini is a responsible lady, age 41, who lives with her husband and one son. She is the main source of income for her family because her husband is a daily laborer and he makes less. 

She sells bangles, nail polish, gold-plated jewelry items, clips, hair accessories, beads, etc., in her ladies' novelty store. She has been in the business of selling cosmetics and jewelry for the past eight years. She is applying for a loan to buy more jewelry and beauty products such as makeup, lipsticks and creams in order to improve and enrich the business through the availability of more variety of products to meet customer demand. 

This loan will help to improve her sales and enable her to offer a new product line to her customers. Her objective is to expand the business and include new products such as clothing in her existing business, and save enough for her family's future with the increased revenues from the increased sales supported by the variety in products.

Santosini, along with her group, has applied for this loan, and she will use her portion to purchase gold-plated jewelry and beauty products for her ladies' novelty store. She is very happy and thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase gold-plated jewelry and beauty products for her ladies' novelty store.

loans.name: Baba Jogeswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 37-year-old lady living with her parents-in-law, her husband and her two children. She has a goat farm in which she presently has six goats. She purchases goat kids and sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes 8-9 months for her to grow and sell them. 

She goes out in the morning to bring the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. She then helps her mother in the household activities and then resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband assists her in maintaining the goats. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. 

She says that there is a lot of demand during the months of April to July and October to December, the auspicious time for Indian weddings. Currently, she is not able to meet the demand during these months and other peak demand times. 

Kalpana, along with her group, has requested a loan of 20,000 INR for each member, and she will use her portion to purchase some more goat kids to be able to sell more and seize the opportunity during this peak demand period, and to construct a shelter for the goats to protect them from the rain.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing goat kids and building a shelter for her goats.

loans.name: Jay Maa Durga Shg Group

texts.en:
Gulapi is 35-year-old a divorced lady who lives with her parents-in-law and three children. She is engaged in the activity of tailoring, and has one sewing machine by which she stitches ladies dresses, blouses, frocks, and dresses for kids. From this business, she earns 6,500 INR per month, which is not enough for her family. 

She started this business eight years ago to help her husband in managing the family's monthly cash flow, but nowadays she is the only earning member in her family. Gulapi has a plan to grow her business and do this activity on a large scale, so that she can render her services to the maximum number of customers. She wants to purchase two new sewing machines and some fabrics for her shop. 

Gulapi, along with her group having the name Jay Maa Durga Shg, has requested a loan of 130,000 INR, and she will use her portion for purchasing two more sewing machines to meet her customers' demand and make them highly satisfied. She also wants to hire some workforce to help her in the business. 

Gulapi hopes to provide a better education and study materials to her children and take good care of her family. She has a dream to live a happy life with her family members by fulfilling the family members' requirements.

loans.use: to purchase two new sewing machines and fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: El grupo “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” está conformada por mujeres entusiastas por mejorar su economía familiar. Lizbeth tiene 28 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de CDS hace 03 meses es de esta manera que puede apoyar a su esposo quien se dedica a dar servicios  de mototaxista. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más CDS para expenderlos de manera ambulatoria. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Lizbeth es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The “Luchando por un Sueño” [Fighting for a Dream] group is made up of women who are enthusiastic about improving their families' finances.  

Lizbeth is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and her three dependent children.  She has worked selling CDs for three years.  This is how she supports her husband, who works as a mototaxi driver.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of more CDs in order to sell them as a mobile vendor.  

The group is thankful to Kiva investors for the loan that was granted.  Lizbeth is the second one from the left-hand side.

loans.use: to buy CDs

loans.name: Indira Shg Group

texts.en:
Gangabati is 40 years old and lives with her husband, her four children and in-laws. 

She is engaged in selling dried and fresh fish in the market, which is six kilometers away from her village. Her husband catches fish from the lake near to her village. The demand for fish in the region is very high as it is consumed by most of the people. She makes dried fish by keeping the fish in sunlight until all the water evaporates and preserves them for future use (like when fish are not available in the market, in the rainy season). Dried fish is also used as a supplement to fresh fish. 

Gangabati, along with her group, is requesting a loan and she will use her portion to buy a cool storage box for keeping fish, fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery business. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand. 

This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group Indira Self-Help Group (SHG). The members of the group have selected Gangabati as their president. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase a cool storage box, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for 10 years. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.

Susan has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, fish, beef, sweet potatoes, and cassava. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. Susan aspires to own a big restaurant and also to start outside catering. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. Susan resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes, beef, sweet potatoes, cassava, green bananas, and other food for her restaurant

loans.name: M.afzal

texts.en:
M.Afzal is 47 years old and lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of seven children. He provides local rural transport services with his tractor to the people of his community. He runs his tractor as a loader and cargo transport and has had his own tractor for the last 15 years.

Due to continuous use, his tractor needs some maintenance. So M.Afzal has decided to repair it as soon as possible. But due to lack of finances, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his tractor. Therefore, M.Afzal has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help him to cover the repairs. M.Afzal is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing his tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bars and tubes for his business as a welder in order to expand his business

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Rozeena is 30 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and therefore he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Rozeena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rozeena is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the expense of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Chandni's Group

texts.en:
Chandni is a 26 year old, married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For that reason, Chandni is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of the profit he will put a side some savings to pay for electricity and gas bills. Chandni hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Zeeshan Ahmed

texts.en:
Zeeshan 30, married and a father of two, owns a shop where he sells electrical goods. He is a friendly and jolly person. 

He needs a loan to buy additional electrical items for his shop. He started this business at a very young age and by now has learnt many tricks of doing business. His has managed to make many loyal customers. 

He wants to provide a steady income to his family by becoming self sufficient. This investment will help him increase his earnings which he plans to save for the future for his children's higher studies. 

He is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for his shop.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Marta es una mujer que se gana la vida gracias a la venta de pupusas y fruta que realiza frente a su vivienda desde hace 15 años, y en la que ella habita desde que era una niña, actualmente viven con ella su esposo y su hijo de 13 años de edad. Marta ha sufrido mucho para llegar a tener una familia y una solidez económica, por lo que desea que su hijo crezca en mejores condiciones de las que ella tuvo, es por ello que desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda, por lo que Marta solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento y arena para repellar su vivienda.
texts.en: Marta is a woman who earns her living selling pupusas and fruit, which she has done in front of her house for 15 years. She has lived in that house since she was a child. She lives with her husband and 13 year old son. Marta has worked a lot to get to have  family and a solid economic situation so she hopes that her son grows up in better conditions than what she had. So she wants to plaster the walls of her house. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement and sand to plaster her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster her house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with four children and all of them go to school. She has additional family members that she takes care of. She sells used clothes at the market. She has been in this business for the last 13 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land to start farming. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of good customer care and timely loans. She owns a house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married and has three children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. Jennifer sells used clothes door-to-door on a retail basis and has been in this business for two years. She works six days a week.

Jennifer has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality. Jennifer aspires to expand her business. She rents a house and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is widowed with seven children, and four of the children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. She operates a retail shop in a space that she rents. She has been in business for 11 years. She works seven days a week. Margaret has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, boxes of soap and sugar. Her major business challenges include transportation. She aspires to build rental houses. She lives in a rental house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy flour, cooking oil, soap and sugar

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is a married mother of six children; all of them go to school.  She has additional family members living in her home. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy  bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling snacks like fried cassava and chapati .  She works seven days a week . Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation . She aspires to own a fully stocked stall of charcoal and sell on wholesale basis. She owns a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is single with five children, all of them go to school. She also has additional family members. She is a hairdresser and has been in this business for 8 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair chemical relaxers, chairs and rollers.  She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and power shortages. She is aspiring to start another branch. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, hair chemicals, chairs and rollers.

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en: Cotilda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Her major challenge includes transportation and defaulters. She would like to work hard so as to expand her business and also start importing used clothes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses includes school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is single and has one child. She has additional family members. Harriet operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for one year. She generates additional income from selling eggs at the market. She works six days a week. 

Harriet has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, beans, and green bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Harriet aspires to build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. Harriet rents a house and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, beans, and green bananas for her restaurant

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah owns and operates a retail hardware shop. She has been in this business for six years, and she works in her shop six days out of every week. Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of cement. She also generates additional income by selling fried cassava and chapatti. Her primary business challenges include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked hardware shop. She also plans to build a house for the family. She lives in a rented home with their five children .  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family. All five of her children go to school. Sarah also takes care of her sister and brother.

loans.use: To buy cement

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 47 years old. She is a responsible mother of seven children, living in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a wood stall from which he sells pieces of wood for fuel. In his area there is a large shortfall of cooking gas, so people like to burn pieces of wood for cooking. He carries out his business at the corner of his residence. 

He purchases large pieces of trees, cuts them into small pieces and sells to his customers for fuel purposes. Now, he needs to buy a wood-cutting machine but he has no cash in hand for purchasing the wood-cutting machine. Therefore, Samina, his wife has requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy a wood-cutting machine for his business.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a wood-cutting machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Maroof

texts.en: Maroof is 45 years old and a mother of nine children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. One of her sons is a fruit seller by profession, he sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Maroof's son needs to purchase different types of fruits for resale so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore, Maroof has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her son to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Mehraj

texts.en:
Mehraj is 38 years old and a mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, he sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Mehraj's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore, Mehraj has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruit to resell

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 39-year-old woman and mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. One of her sons is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nazeeran's son needs to purchase different types of fruits to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore Nazeeran has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her son. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Pervaiz Ahmed

texts.en:
Pervaiz is 46 and lives in Karachi. He is married and has three children. His wife is a stay-at-home mother. Pervaiz is in the business of paper roll making. He manufactures paper rolls of different sizes that are used to wrap fabric and thread. His customers are usually textile mills and wholesalers. His business provides him enough to manage his household activities and pay for his children's school fees. 

Pervaiz wants to save some money for his children's higher education.  Therefore, he has applied for a loan in order to increase his sales by buying more inventory for his business. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to grow his paper roll making business

loans.name: Maa Maheswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Pankajini is a 34-year-old lady living with her husband and three children in a village named Ambasharbhata in Sonepur district of Odisha, India. Pankajini is engaged in the activity of selling milk and milk products in her house. She has two cows in her herd. She has been involved in this activity for the past few years. She sells 15 litres of milk daily at the rate of 30 INR per litre. She started to sell milk in her house and assists her husband financially. 

Pankajini, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 195,000 INR and she will use her portion for purchasing more cows. She says that doing so will let her increase her customers and then she can supply milk in large amounts. She also wants to repair the cattle shed. She has a dream to give a better living standard to her family and save some money for future misfortunes. The other 12 members of this group are engaged in various activities and all are very happy with this loan.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more cows and renovating the cattle shed.

loans.name: Muhammmad Shehzad

texts.en:
Shehzad is 32 years old, married and a father of three children. He is a dedicated father and hardworking entrepreneur. He has run a small general store in Karachi for the past 10 years. He started with a very small investment and now has established himself well. 

In order to provide more variety of groceries to his customers he wants to buy more stock. Therefore, he has requested a loan as he does not currently have sufficient income.

He plans to broaden his business in the future and wants to make it self sustaining.

loans.use: to buy general grocery items for his shop

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is single and has four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Harriet sells green bananas from home on a retail basis and has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week.

Harriet has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Harriet aspires to turn her business into a wholesale business. She rents a house and her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Rebacca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married mother of one child.  She has no additional family members. She sells used clothes, and also does tailoring in a shop that she rents at the market. She has been in this business for 3 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes and also materials for making clothes. She works six days a week and sells on a retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include defaulters and the fluctuating price of used clothes. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked shop of both used and first class clothes. 

She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes and a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: María Ínes

texts.es:
María es vendedora de productos de revista (cosméticos, perfumes etc.) de casa en casa por toda la comunidad donde vive, ya tiene clientela, realizando su actividad ella sola de 10:00 AM a 5:00 PM. Cuenta con una experiencia de seis años, una amiga le indujo a la actividad, ya que María en ese momento no estaba generando ingresos y opto por tener una fuente propia de ingresos.

Mencionamos que con  créditos anteriores ha logrado un desarrollo en sus ventas y estilo de vida, debido a que ha podido pagar los pedidos de mercadería. Pero en estos meses ha presentado problemas de salud, lo que ha ocasionado que ella use sus ganancias para el pago de medicinas y no tiene efectivo para cancelar el nuevo pedido, ya que debe esperar que sus clientes le cancelen y el pedido lo tiene que cancelar en le momento que se lo llevan a su casa. Por eso solicita este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
María is a vendor of catalog products (cosmetics, perfume, etc.) from door to door in the community where she lives. She has her clientele and works from 10 am to 5 pm. She has six years experience in the field. A friend encouraged her to start as at the time María was not generating any revenue and she decided to have her own source of income.

She mentioned that with the previous loans she managed to develop her sales and her lifestyle as she was able to pay for the orders for merchandise that she had. In the last months there have been some health problems and she has had to use her income to pay for medicine. So she has no cash to pay for her new order and she has to wait for her clients to pay her off. She has to pay for the order when it arrives at her house. So she is requesting this new loan.

loans.use: to pay for an order of merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any other additional family members. 

Mary operates a clinic in a shop that she rents and has been in this business for twenty years. She gets additional income from poultry farming. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy drugs like boxes of syrups, vaccines and injections. She works seven days of the week. 

Her major business challenges include taxes, defaulters and seasonality. She aspires to build more rental rooms. 

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: To buy syrups, injections, vaccines and tablets.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children. She takes care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She is aspiring of buying a van to reduce transportation costs. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include utilities and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Muhammad Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is 35 years old, married, and a father of 2. He laid the foundations of his business 10 years ago at a young age. Since then this business has been the source of income for his family. He runs a small general store in his community. 

Ashraf is planning to expand his product offerings by providing mobile phone sim cards and accessories. Also, he wants to refresh his current stock of groceries. For this he needs investment.  But due to insufficient funds, he has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help him buy these items to generate more income. His dream is to expand his business in the future so that he can provide a better and more secure life for his family.

loans.use: to restock grocery items and buy mobile phone cards for his general store

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat is a 24-year-old differently able man who lives with his father and mother in a small village of Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. 

He started a photo studio in a good location in the market near to his village with the help of his father three years ago. He earns 4,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month, which has been the only source of income for him to give his family a good life. He provides a variety of services like digital passport-size photographs, full-sized photographs and video shoots for various auspicious ceremonies like weddings and other functions in his village and the four surrounding it. He says that showing people looking beautiful and happy, and being part of their happy moments to provide those memories, is what he likes the most about his work. He has earned a good name for his studio by providing quality work. 

Taking his interest further in showing people looking beautiful, he wants to purchase a high-quality camera and renovate his studio. He sees a good opportunity for business as there is no other photo studio in the village. 

Sarat needs a loan to purchase a high-quality camera, renovate his studio and rent out the new room.

loans.use: To purchase a high-quality camera and  renovate his studio and rent out the new room.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida, 48, is married and lives in Lahore. With six children to feed and look after, she started the art work of embroidery to bring home some income and help out her husband in providing financing for the household expenses. Now she has become an expert at her work and gets frequent orders for embroidery work. She is an inspiration for other women in her community.

In order to fulfill some orders she requires different varieties of material like cloth, thread, fancy beads, pearls etc. She has requested a loan through her group from BRAC Pakistan to help her buy these materials. She hopes that this will help her increase earnings and effectively manage her household expenses. 

Her dream is to give for children a good life. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Rizwan Qureshi

texts.en:
Rizwan 35, runs a general store in Karachi.  

Having started this business at a very young age, he has become good at it. He has captured a good population in his community and is known for his polite and kind behavior. 

He wants to refresh the current stock at his general store with items like rice, flour, lentils, and utensils, with the hope of increasing sales. He therefore has requested a loan to help him buy these items. 

His future plans are to expand his business and to add more variety to his shop by using the savings he expects to make from this investment.

loans.use: to purchase items for his general store.

loans.name: Rehan Ahmed

texts.en:
Rehan is 32 years old and living in Karachi. He is married and and has four children. He owns an electrical shop in his community. He started this business at a very young age and now his business has become stable. 

Given the increase in demand for certain electrical items, Rehan wants to buy more stock of electrical items to avoid any out-of-stock situation and increase his sales. Therefore, he has requested a loan as he is short of funds. He is certain of a bright future for his family and is thankful for Kiva lenders' kind support.

loans.use: To buy electrical items for his store for future growth

loans.name: Maa Sarala Shg Group

texts.en:
Tilottama is a 37-year-old lady staying with her husband and three children in a small village of Sonepur district, Odisha, India. 

She started a mobile business 10 years ago where she sells cooking oil, salt, spices, lentils, rice, snacks made of lentils, and other grocery items. She sells her products in the weekly markets that are organized in the villages near her village. She started this business to assist her husband financially and to manage the family requirements. In this way she earns 3,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient to support her family. She wants to grow her business by purchasing more quantity of what she sells, so that she can easily satisfy her customers' demands. 

Tilottama, along with her group, has requested a loan of 165,000 INR to invest in their businesses. Tilottama will use her portion to purchase goods in bulk amount and add some new varieties of stationery items and snacks to her shop. All members are grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this great help and support.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing cooking oil, salt, spices, lentils, rice and other grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Muhammad Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 58-year-old businessman who lives in Karachi. He is married and has 3 children. 

Shamin operates a grocery store where he sells tea, lentils, rice, spices, salt, flour, snacks, cooking oil and sugar. He is a friendly and nice person. 15 years in this business has taught him a lot. He provides quality products to his customers.

With the loan that he is requesting from Kiva, Shamim would like to make bulk purchases of groceries from wholesalers. He will then sell the products at his store. More sales would lead to higher profits, and Shamim will be able to expand his business and create employment opportunities for the people of his community. 

His dream is to give his children a University education

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Santosh

texts.en:
Santosh is a 38-year-old differently able man who lives with his wife and a son, age 19 years, in a small village of the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. His son goes to school. 

Santosh has been engaged in vegetable and flower cultivation and selling for the last 18 years and earns 10,000 INR per month from this business. He sells his products to the vendor and also sells in a near market as retailing. He says, "My current income is very low so I am unable to send my son in a good school, so I need a financial assistance from any organization so I can invest to in my business." 

He has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase high-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland. Now he is very happy with this loan and eager to expand his current activity. 

 He also says, "Thank People's Forum and Kiva for providing this opportunity to grow."

loans.use: to purchase high-quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Jay Hanuman Shg Group

texts.en:
Rajani is a 37-year-old lady with two children. She lives in the Tikirapada village in Sonepur district of Odisha, India, with her husband and her children. 

A few years back, she started growing vegetables and paddy rice. She grows different types of vegetables in her field depending upon the demand of her customers and the season. 

The group Jay Hanuman Shg is requesting a loan of 150,000 INR. Rajani will use her part to buy more supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. 

She is part of a group of 10 members, all of whom are women who live in the same community. They named their group Jay Hanuman Self-Help Group (SHG), which is located in the Sonepur district of Odisha, India.

The other members of this group are engaged in various activities such as milk selling, daily labor, flower and fruits selling, etc. All are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She has had a restaurant business for five years. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, beef, cooking oil, beans, cassava, sweet potatoes, and Irish potatoes. She works in a market and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a big hotel and also build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, cassava, flour, beans, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, 59, is married and a mother of 5 children. 

She is an entrepreneur and has run a beauty salon in her community for the past 19 years. She is skilled and many other women come to her parlour to learn from her.  She started this business to help her husband meet their regular household expenses. She has many loyal customers and they all appreciate her talent. 

She needs to refresh her stock of beauty products such as creams, bleaches, different facial creams, face wash, make-up kits, manicure and pedicure kits, etc. for salon. She does not have sufficient funds for this purpose and therefore has requested a loan. 

In the future, she wants to start a small beauty training center in her community. She also wants to retain and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Muhammad Nouman

texts.en:
Muhammad lives in Karachi with his wife and parents. 

He started his business seven years ago. He owns a decoration shop where he sells different types of designing products and accessories and provides fancy lights services at weddings and different festive occasions. He loves his work and works hard to earn a high income. 

Due to his kind attitude towards people and good people skills, he has managed to gain many loyal customers. Now he wants to enlarge his business and increase sales at the shop. He has applied for this loan to purchase fancy light bulbs in different colors and designs along with wires for the shop. This loan is very important for Muhammad to enlarge his shop and make it more profitable.

loans.use: To buy more fancy light bulbs, wires and extensions for his decoration shop.

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS POSITIVAS” está conformada por socios responsables y puntuales en sus cuotas de grupo. Elena tiene 54 años de edad es soltera con 03 hijos independientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda con la finalidad de pasar más tiempo con sus hijos años atrás trabajaba como domestica fuera de la zona que radica. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y trabaja como líder de una línea de productos de belleza. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes arroz azúcar aceite fideos bebidas y golosinas. Ella cumple la función de tesorera en el grupo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elena es la cuarta del lado izquierdo viste saco negro y polo fucsia.
texts.en:
Las Positivas Group is made up of responsible members who are punctual with their group payments.

Elena, the treasurer of the group, is 54 years old and has three independent children.  She set up her grocery store in her home years ago so she could spend more time with her children.  She used to work as a domestic employee outside the area where she lives.  In her free time, she makes a living selling beauty products, and she works as the leader of a line of products.

She's going to invest the loan in buying more groceries such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, beverages, and snacks.

The group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan.  Elena's the fourth from the left; she's wearing a black jacket and a fuchsia shirt.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Zhanara

texts.ru: Жанаре 23 года, замужем, у нее средне-специальное образование. Жанара вместе с супругом воспитывает сына.  Она известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. Жанара с 2011 года в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, начала свой бизнес в увеличении поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в полеводстве. В хозяйстве у Жанары имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади и 3,50 ГА земельной доли, где она выращивает фасоль и клевер. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жанара обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на закупку коровы, часть средств будет потрачена на сбор урожая фасоли. Доходы от кредита Жанара планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhanara is 23 and married with one son. She has a specialist high school education and is known as a principled, honest and kindhearted person. In search of an additional source of income for her family, she started her own business in 2011 in animal husbandry and farming. She has two dairy cows, two horses and 3.5 hectares of agricultural land where she grows beans and clover.

With the goal of further developing her business, Zhanara has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a cow and for help harvesting her crop of beans. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to harvest her crop of beans

loans.name: Asad Zafar

texts.en:
Asad owns a small general store in Karachi. He is youth of 28 as seen in the picture. He is energetic and ambitious about his business. He recently got married and now wants to get more stable and self-sufficient. He is working towards making his store self-sustaining so that he can use the extra income to restock the general store items in the future. 

He has applied for a loan to help him add more stock to his shop as he is short of money. He is hopeful that it will help him do more business and he will be able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for his general store.

loans.name: Shahid Ahmed

texts.en:
Shahid from Karachi runs a ladies' garment business and sells ready-to-wear fancy and regular clothes to his customers. He is eager to bolster his sales and make more profits.

He is married and a father of three children. His dream is to give his children university education and make them responsible citizens. Therefore he wants to invest more in his business to make it more profitable.
   
He is thankful to Kiva lenders for allowing him to buy more stock and is hopeful for fruitful results.

loans.use: To purchase additional garments for his shop.

loans.name: Victor  Omondi

texts.en:
Victor Omondi is 23 years of old and a final year student at Technical University of Kenya, taking a Diploma Course in Technology - Civil Engineering, in Nairobi.  

Victor is from a family of four children. His father is a casual labourer and his mother is unemployed. Due to financial constraints he has sometimes missed his exams. He has been trying to raise money through bursaries but still it is not enough to cover his education.
 He is requesting for a loan to help him pay his tuition fee so that he can focus on studying in his final year.

loans.use: To pay for Tuition Fees

loans.name: Justin Onduso

texts.en:
Justin Onduso  is 22 years old. He is currently a student at SOS Technical Training Institute pursuing a certificate in Electrical Installation as a second year student. 

Justin was born in a family of 5 siblings and his both parents are deceased.

He has been paying for his education through grants from well wishers since his High School education and now that he is in college, the people who paid for his tuition withdrew and that also led to him missing school for two months.
He is requesting KIVA to consider him for the loan to enable him pay fees for the last academic year which will enable him to complete his studies, progress his career and be financially stable.  
Thank You in advance

loans.use: To pay tuition fees,accomodation,food and transport costs

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en: Da’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Da makes a living cultivating rice, raising pigs and chickens and he also does extra work as a construction worker and factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ellis Wanderi

texts.en:
Ellis Wanderi is 22 years old. He is currently a final year student at Technical University of Kenya pursuing a diploma in Technology – Civil Engineering.  
 
He is struggling to pay school fees and upkeep because his father is retired and his mother is a housewife. 
His childhood interest has been to become a Civil Engineer and be  a source of hope for kids from poor back grounds to enable them  realize their dreams.  He is requesting for a loan to enable him complete his studies and become a skilled construction worker. 

He  believes he will  be able to secure a job due to the high demand of skilled construction workers in Kenya and also through be able to assist his family which  looks up to him.

loans.use: To pay Tuition,buy books ,pay for accommodation,buy food and meet transport expenses

loans.name: Siyawa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SIYAWA ont en moyenne 29ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SEOULASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des boissons,des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SIYAWA sont à leur 8èmeprêt solidaire.DIDIA, 1èrefemme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter5Kgs d’oignon, 5Litres d’huile, 1 demi paquet de Cube Maggi, 2Kgs de Sel, 10Kgs de riz et 5Kgs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de20000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Siyawa Group average 29 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Seoulasso / Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell beverages, cereals, and condiments. Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Siyawa Group are seeking their eighth solidarity loan (group loan).

Didia is the woman standing on the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 5 kg of onions, 5 liters of cooking oil, half a pack of Maggi bouillon cubes, 2 kg of salt, 10 kg of rice, and 5 kg of millet.

She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers, and sells for cash, and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, cooking oil, Maggi bouillon cubes, salt, rice, and millet

loans.name: Ankadignogoye Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe ANKADIGNOGOYE ont en moyenne 53 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe ANKADIGNOGOYE sont à leur 12ème prêt solidaire. SITAN, 1ère femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10 paires de collier, 15 paires de chaussure en plastique, 10 boîtes de pommade, 10 boîtes de crème à lèvre et 5 pièces de Wax. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Ankadignogoye Group average 53 years of age and six children. They all live in extended traditional families in Kimparana / Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and various products and condiments. Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Ankadignogoye Group are seeking their twelfth solidarity loan (group loan).

Sitan is the woman sitting on the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 pairs of necklaces, 15 pairs of plastic shoes, 10 boxes of balsam, 10 boxes of lip cream, and 5 lengths of Wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth).

She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers, and sells for cash, and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, plastic shoes, balsam, lip cream, and Wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Balimayadjourou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYADJOUROU ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BALIMAYADJOUROU sont à leur 15ème prêt solidaire. KOROBA, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10Kgs de d’haricot, 40Kgs de riz et 20Kgs de mil, 1 demi carton de Spaghetti, 15Litres d’huile, 15Kgs d’oignon et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 43 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Balimayadjourou Group average 40 years of age and four children. They all live in extended traditional families in Kimparana / Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. They buy and sell various products, cereals, and condiments. Having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of Balimayadjourou Group are seeking their fifteenth solidarity loan (group loan).

Koroba is the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 kg of beans, 40 kg of rice, 20 kg of millet, half a box of spaghetti, 15 liters of cooking oil, 15 kg of onions, and one pack of Maggi bouillon cubes.

She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers, and sells for cash, and often on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 43'000, to be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, millet, spaghetti, cooking oil, onions, and bouillon cubes

loans.name: Milca Marisol

texts.es: Milca de 20 años de edad es soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una joven que siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante, desde muy pequeña inicio vendiendo productos de belleza, por lo que actualmente cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos por las buenas ofertas que ofrece y su amabilidad. Milca siempre con ánimos de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su grupo familiar desea construir un muro perimetral que le brinde mayor seguridad a su vivienda, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Milca, 20, is single and lives in her own house with her family.  She's a young woman who has always made an effort to get ahead.  She started selling beauty products when she was very young.  Currently she has a good number of customers who always look for her products because of her good offers and her friendliness.

Milca always wants to improve her family's and her own living conditions.  She wants to build a perimeter wall to provide better security at her house, so she's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a wall around her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Saudah

texts.en: Saudah is a single mother of two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells soft drinks in a shop that she rents, and she has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of soda, pineapples, watermelon, passion fruits, and oranges. She works in the shop seven days a week, and her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their timely loans. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy pineapples, watermelon, crates of soda, passion fruits, and oranges.

loans.name: Rosinda

texts.en:
Rosinda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 9000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Rosinda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is forty nine years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aida's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Aida has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Aida has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour.

Aida is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Edward  Luke

texts.en:
Edward Luke is 26 years old. He is currently a student at SOS Technical Training Institute pursuing a certificate in Electrical Installation as a second year student. 

He is struggling to pay school fees and upkeep because he has been depending on relatives and school bursaries which sometimes are not easy to get.  

His aim is to complete his studies and obtain skills which will enable him to secure a job and also open his own business with an aim of empowering fellow youths in his  community.

loans.use: Tuition,Accommodation, Food, Transportation

loans.name: Lamek Otieno

texts.en:
Lameck Otieno is 22 years old student and a student at the Technical University of Kenya. He is in his final year pursuing a diploma in Civil Engineering.
He is the third born in a family of four children but currently he is the only one who has had the opportunity of joining higher education.  His other sibling is currently in high school. His parents are casual labourers and struggle to pay for his education.
Lameck’s objective is to finish his studies and become a civil engineer to assist his family financially and also be an example to his younger sibling so that she also can achieve her dreams too.
He humbly requests for this loan to pay for his final year tuition and upkeep so that he can concentrate on his studies.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Her name is Marivic, 48, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Herlito and has two children. She and her husband work hard to meet their everyday needs and to support her child’s schooling. 

Marivic operates a tricycle and has a small variety store. Her husband drives the tricycle that carries up to four passengers. In the  Philippines, especially in the provinces like Palawan, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even use tricycles to go from one town to the other. 

Marivic also has a small general store which sells, rice, sugar and other condiments. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,700 a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan that she will use for repairs and maintenance of her tricycle and also to add some grocery items for her small variety store. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation and variety store are really needed in their place.

Marivic dreams to be successful in her business so she can give her children the best education possible and give them a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma, 51, a resident of  Coron, Philippines. She is a single mother with one child who is a high school student. She works hard to provide for their daily household needs and to send her child to school.

Thelma makes and sells delicacies like native doughnuts. Filipinos love to eat sweets and doughnuts are a favorite snack to bring home to their children.  She also sells fish as a sideline. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, she would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy ingredients, such as sticky rice, flour, sugar, and margarine. She is positive that she will earn a good return on her investment. 
 
Thelma aims to grow her business and dreams of sending her child to college. She dreams of having a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members where she can share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for flour and other ingredients to make doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Adrian John

texts.en:
Adrian John, 25, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  He is married to Jona Ann, a food vendor and his partner in business. They are blessed with two kids who are still at Elementary Level at school. He works hard to meet their daily household needs and for the schooling of his children.  

Adrian John is in the food business. He cooks hamburgers, kikiam and other favorite food snacks and sells them at his food stall. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight especially in populated areas. Working people usually buy their snacks at food stalls for convenience. He is a good cook and that is why his food stall is popular in their area. He has neighbors and the local working community as his regular customers. He earns a minimum of 1000 PHP net income a day.

To help him maintain his business, Adrian is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy additional raw ingredients like pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for his cooking. He is positive that he will have a good return on his investment. He is thanking God in advance for your great help.

Adrian John dreams to build and expand his business to give his children the best education possible for them to have a bright future.  He values family and hard work.  He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the ingredients for the food items he sells at his food stall.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 48 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Melodia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Melodia has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Marjore

texts.en:
Marjore is thirty-seven years old and has seven children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Marjore and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour to build a house for her family. 

Marjore has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.

With your help, Marjore can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: James Maina

texts.en:
Profile: 
James Maina is 22 years old and a final year student at Technical University of Kenya, taking a Diploma in Technology - Civil Engineering, in Nairobi.  
James comes from a single parent family and they are going through financial difficulties and due to this it has not been easy to pay for his school fees, which he needs in order to achieve his dream of becoming a Civil Engineer. 
His passion and ambition is to become a Civil Engineer and be able to give back to his society and make a difference in Kenya and globally in terms of structural and building facilities.
 He kindly requests for a loan to help him pay his tuition and accommodation expenses so that he can focus on studying in his final year.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees,books, accommodation,food, transport.

loans.name: Kenneth Kihara

texts.en:
Kenneth Kihara is  21 years old. He is currently a final year student at Technical University of Kenya pursuing a diploma in Technology – Civil Engineering.   

He has always desired to study Construction Works since he was little but with limited opportunities for students in Technical Institutions in Kenya to receive loans in order to pay for their education it has been a challenge to pay for tuition. His parents are peasant farmers who have been struggling to pay for his school fees. 

He is requesting for a loan to enable him pay for tuition expenses and focus on completing his final year in school. He is grateful to KIVA for the opportunity to get a loan and finish his studies.
With the demand for construction workers across Africa and particularly in Kenya, he believes he will be able to secure a job and improve the livelihood of his family and contribute to the growth of his country.
Thank You in advance.

loans.use: To pay tuition,buy books,pay accomodation, buy food and pay for transport costs

loans.name: Linus Mwangi

texts.en:
Linus Mwangi is 19 years old. He is currently a student at SOS Technical Training Institute pursuing a Certificate Course in Electrical Installation as a second year student. 

Linus’ is the oldest of among his siblings. His parents who support him in higher education are struggling financially. He had dropped out of school due to problems with school fees.

He is requesting KIVA for a loan to support him financially for his studies. This will help him achieve his goals to become self employed in his field of study and be financially stable.

loans.use: to pay, Tuition Fees, Books, Accommodation, Food and Transport,

loans.name: William

texts.es: William de 25 años habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edadades de 1 y 8 años en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde tien un ngocio mediante el cual se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas desde el año 2012. Su idea de negocio se forjó desde que trabajó en una tienda de comidas rápidas y allí aprendió todo lo que hoy sabe. Añorando ser independiente reunió poco a poco dinéro e inició su propia aventura emprendedora. Su negocio está ubicado en un local donde ofrece de contado perros calientes, derivados de maíz, hamburguesas y otros manjares que combina muy bien con deliciosas salsas que él mismo prepara, Su dia laboral inicia a las 2 d la tarde y termina a las 12 de  la noche de lunes a domingos. Su meta es abrir nuevos puntos de venta para aumentar la cobertura y finalmente poder comprar una vivienda que beneficie a su familia. Su mayor desafio es el insufieinte capital de trabajo para lograr su propósito rapidamente, En la actualidad esta aplicando  a un credikiva, primer finacimeinto que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpará un horno para pizza y realizará mejoras a su local. Con esta inversión responderá a la demanda y agregará un nuevo producto, que adicionará nuevos ingresos y esto es lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
William, 25, lives with his spouse and his two children, ages 1 and 8, in a town near the city of Barranquilla.

He has a business where he has earned a living selling fast food since 2012.  He shaped his business plan since he worked in a fast food store, where he learned everything he knows today.  Wanting to be independent, he got the money together little by little and started his own entrepreneurial venture.

His business is located in a place where he accepts cash for hot dogs, corn products, hamburgers, and other delicacies that he combines very well with delicious sauces that he himself makes.  His work day starts at 2 in the afternoon and ends at 12 midnight, Monday through Sunday.

His goal is to open new locales to increase his coverage and ultimately be able to buy a house for his family's benefit.  His greatest challenge is insufficient working capital to achieve his goal quickly.

Currently he's applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He's going to buy a pizza oven and make improvements on his space.  With this investment, he'll respond to demand and add a new product.  This will add additional income, which will make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a pizza oven and to make improvements on his locale

loans.name: Zhuzugul

texts.ru: Жузугул 51 год, не замужем, мать 2 детей. Старший сын помогает по хозяйству, дочь учится в школе.  По характеру Жузугул очень добрая, веселая, трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается полеводством, также сдает в аренду помещение и земельный участок для автостоянки. Полеводческой деятельностью Жузугул занимается с 1991 года, на 5,1 ГА собственной земли она выращивает фасоль, а также фруктовые деревья.  Жузугул получает совокупную ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на сбор урожая фасоли, которую после она планирует перепродать оптовым покупателям. Полученные кредитные средства она направит на оплату услуг трактора, покупку ГСМ, также Жузугул для сбора урожая наймет 60 человек, зарплата которых по ее расчетам составит 60,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Жузугул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также накопить средства на достойное высшее образование ее дочери.
texts.en:
Zhuzugul is 51 years old, not married, and the mother of two children. Her eldest son helps her with her business, her daughter goes to school. Zhuzugul is a very good, happy, hardworking and purposeful woman by nature. As a main source of income for her family, she works with field crop cultivation. She also rents out premises and land for parking. 

Zhuzugul has worked with the agriculture business since 1991. She grows beans on her own land of 5.1 hectares, and she also has fruit trees there. Zhuzugul receives a total income of the amount of 18,000 som (KGS) per month. With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to harvest beans which she plans to sell wholesale, pay the tractor's services, buy fuel, and employee workers. Zhuzugul plans to invest the income in further developing her business, and also save money for higher education expenses for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay the tractor' services, to buy fuel and employ 60 workers to harvest ecological haricot

loans.name: Jonatan Noe

texts.es: Jonatan tiene 24 años de edad y trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Jonatan es un joven muy trabajador y visionario quien además de su trabajo también se dedica a la venta de tamales y tostadas en sus tiempos libres. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. para levantar paredes para ampliación de vivienda. Espera poder contar con el apoyo y así poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Jonatan is 24 years old and works as an employee for a company near his town. He is a hardworking and visionary young man. In addition to his job, he sells tamales and tostadas in his free time.

In order to improve his living conditions, Jonatan decided to request this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of bricks, galvanized sheets, cement, sand, iron, and other materials so that he can build walls to expand his home. He hopes to receive assistance so that he can proceed with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can expand his house.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a married  mother of four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She has a bar in a shop that she rents and has been in this business for 1 year. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy jerrycans of local brew and spirits and crates of beer. She works seven days a week.
