Her major business challenges include power shortages, thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to increase her sales so she can widen her capital base and attract more customers .She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy local brew, spirits and crates of beer

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
At the age of 50, Balqees is a married woman with a business of animals purchase and sale with the help of her husband. Four years ago, she started her business, as it seemed very difficult for her to fulfill her basic necessities of life.  Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle, and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize the loan amount to purchase baby goats. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase baby goats

loans.name: Reuben Odhiambo

texts.en:
Reuben Odhiambo is 22 years old and a final year student at Technical University of Kenya, taking a Diploma Course in Technology - Civil Engineering, in Nairobi.  

His parents are separated and due to this, it has not been easy to pay for his school fees, which he needs in order to achieve his dream of becoming a Civil Engineer. There are limited opportunities for students to obtain loans in Kenya but there is a high demand for skilled artisans in the construction industry for the growing population.

He is kindly requesting for a loan to help him pay his tuition and accommodation expenses so that he can focus on studying in his final year.

loans.use: to pay for Tuition Fees and Accomodation

loans.name: Krisna

texts.en:
Krisna is an enthusiastic and optimistic woman. She is 48-year-old woman from a small village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has six children, and is raising them after facing a lot of difficulties. She lost her husband a few years back. At that time, her children were so young that her main challenge was to do something to look after her children and provide them with their basic needs.   

Thus, she chose livestock breeding as her profession. Now two of her children are students, three sons are unemployed, and one is working as a worker for house painting. Krisna has been actively involved in livestock business for the many of the last years. She purchases baby goats, raises them, and sells them in the market when they are grown up. For additional income she also sells milk to her neighbors. 

However, income from this source is not enough to take good care of a family of six children.

Thus Krisna is seeking a loan from the Kiva lenders (field partner BJS) to purchase goats. The goats will produce more milk that Krisna will use to fill the demand in the marketplace in order to generate more income to run her huge family. Her biggest challenge is lack of capital. 

She wants to expand her business activity to widen her existing portfolio to generate additional income to meet her children's education needs and her reinvestment needs.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase goats for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Huoykaominnoy Group

texts.en:
Phet's village takes water from wells and from the local streams. Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water. The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water.    

Phet is excited that she and her neighbors were able to purchase water filters. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter; this is because the filter removes bacteria and other waterborne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works from three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so shen have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Enock Oberi

texts.en:
Enock Oberi is 26 years old. He is currently a final year student at PC Kinyanjui Technical Training Institute pursuing a Diploma in Civil Engineering. 
  
His parents are small scale farmers and are financially unstable. After high school, he worked as a laborer and through that saved some money which he used to pay for school fees together with the little amount that his parents give him.
He grew up in a place with very poor infrastructure especially in housing, road network and sewage system and therefore and decided to join school and study Civil Engineering, in order to improve the infrastructure in his region.

His aim is to be able to work after completing his studies and in future begin his own engineering company and become a role model to the youth and help those from poor families financially to achieve their goals.
His request for this loan is to enable him pay for his studies which will in turn help him realize his goals.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees,buy books,pay accomodation,buy food and pay for transport

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: Jenifer is a single mother of five children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis and she has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava and dried fish. She works seven days a week, and her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to buy a plot of land to farm, and to supplement her income. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their timely loans. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, cassava, and dried fish.

loans.name: Mera

texts.en: Mera is a single mother of five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis, and she has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, cassava, and maize. She works seven days a week, and her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land to build on. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, cassava, and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, in order to replace the roof on his old house

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma, 45, is a woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 4 children and her husband. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, so he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Asma also provides sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to managing the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil and other items for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories, thereby allowing her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

loans.use: to run her own tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina tiene 60 años de edad, su estado civil es casada, tiene una 4 hijos mayores de edad los cuales ya son independientes económicamente, vive en casa propia junto a su conyugue, su vivienda esta construida de material noble. La vida en el lugar es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería; el lugar donde vive es un caserio de aproximadamente 60 familias dicho caserio tiene aproximadamente 35 años de creación política y está ubicado en distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza nuestro María Cristina es la crianza y engorde de ganado caprino. Dicho ganado lo compra y lo alimenta para engorde por un determinado tiempo y luego lo comercializa en el mercado local. La actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años, en la parte posterior de su vivienda ahí tiene sus corrales para la crianza.

El destino del crédito es para la compra de un lote de animales (cerdos) que un vecino le está ofertando a un buen precio y también será para ampliar sus corrales ya que el número de animales que tiene va incrementándose. La inversión le ayudará a incrementar las ventas y a obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el negocio es una de las actividades principales en la zona, como ingresos económico, y ella piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que año tras año sus ventas vienen creciendo. Y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Cristina is in the business of raising and fattening goats. She buys these animals and feeds them so that they will gain weight over a determined period of time. Later on, she will sell the animals at the local market. María Cristina has been in this business for 20 years and conducts this activity in an area behind her house where there are pens that contain the animals.

This loan will be used to buy a litter of pigs that a neighbor is offering to her at a good price. She will also expand her pens since the number of animals that she has is increasing. This investment will help to increase her sales and generate more income for her family. The market forecast is good since her type of business is one of the main income-generating activities in the area. María Cristina plans to continue investing in her business in the coming year since her sales keep growing. With the revenue she expects to generate in the short and medium terms, she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a litter of pigs.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Because Raeda is a conservative lady, she asked her husband's sister to appear in the photo instead. Raeda is a 34-years-old married woman living with her husband and five sons and daughters. Sewing has been one of her hobbies since she learnt it from her mother, and it became a source of income for her family three years ago. She became well-known in her neighborhood with the help of her husbands' sister. She is seeking to open her own sewing workshop in the future. To do so, she needs to expand her business more and to build a good customer base. Now she needs to purchase more sewing and embroidery tools to start her own embroidery business which will attract more customers. However, she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more sewing and embroidery tools to expand her business more

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es:
Uriel es un hombre con todas las pilas puestas para enfrentar el mundo y tener una vida plena gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Tiene un negocio de Café Bar en el que vende licores y algunos comestibles.

Inicio el negocio hace 5 años y a pesar de su poco tiempo en funcionamiento ha tenido buena acogida en el sector.

El desea ampliar su oferta de productos y mejorar aun mas sus ventas inyectándole capital a su empresa, es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para darse la oportunidad de ser independiente y tener las razones suficientes para dedicarse en pleno a su negocio. 

El dinero será invertido en la compra de surtido de licores con los que actualmente no cuenta para mejorar su atención y variedad.

Tiene grandes esperanzas en su negocio y piensa que su futuro puede mejorar considerablemente gracias al apoyo de estas entidades que hacen lo posible para que las personas puedan soñar con una vida mejor y más estable.
texts.en:
Uriel is a man that is ready to face the world and enjoy a full life thanks to his efforts. He has a business which is a coffee house bar where he sells liquors and some foods. He started the business 5 years ago and in spite of the short time it has been functioning it has been well accepted in the area.

He wants to expand his offering of products and improve his sales even more by injecting capital into his business. For this reason he is requesting a loan to give himself the opportunity to be independent and have sufficient reason to dedicated himself fully to his business. The money will be invested in buying an assortment of liquors that he does not have to improve his service and variety.

He has great hopes in this business and thinks that his future might improve considerably thanks to the support of these entities that make it possible for people to dream of a more stable and better life..

loans.use: to buy an assortment of liquors to stock his bar.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mr. Enkhjargal used his previous loan for building a greenhouse and planting potatoes and carrots in large amounts. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to rent and renovate an old cafeteria and buy food stuffs in order to open a grocery store. His youngest daughter is unemployed due to downsizing of the company where she worked. His daughter will work as a seller at his grocery store. If this business succeeds, he will no longer worry about his daughter's well-being.

loans.use: to rent and renovate an old cafeteria and buy food stuffs in order to open a grocery store

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is 43 years old and married, with two children. Thủy runs her business in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

This is Thủy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that she faces in her life is low profit margins. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a biogas system.

Through her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for a vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production.  Violeta has been in this business for 7 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Violeta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is 42 years old and married with four children and three of the four children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlita has a hollow block-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like cement, sand, etc. for her business.

Erlita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Erlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like cement, sand, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosa Delmy

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a vender tortillas, vive con su familia nuclear integrada por su esposo y 5 hijos, los cueles son dependientes; como una madre responsable y con el propósito de dar a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida se decidió hace un tiempo a fundar su propio negocio, que consiste en vender tortillas, su negocio se está evolucionando positivamente, ya que la rentabilidad y popularidad están creciendo.
Solicita un crédito para comprar maíz al por mayor, tendrá materia prima para la elaboración de la venta de tortillas, de esta forma tendrá una mayor producción, atraerá nuevos clientes y podrá generar más ingresos con los que pueda cumplir con sus compromisos. Foto fue tomada en su vivienda.
Los proyectos que tiene Rosa son cancelar su deuda con buena calificación y un corto tiempo tener un nuevo punto de venta.
texts.en:
Rosa works selling tortillas. She lives with her nuclear family which consists of her husband and five children who are dependent on her. As a responsible mother and with the goal of providing her children with a more stable life she decided some time ago to start her own business. She sells tortillas and her business has been evolving positively. It`s profit and popularity have been rising.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale so that she has raw material to make the tortillas to sell. In this way she can have higher production, attract new customers and can generate more income so that she can meet her obligations. The photo was taken in her house. Rosa`s projects are to pay off her loan with good ratings and in a short time have another sales location.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale to make tortillas.

loans.name: Eva Cecilia

texts.en:
Eva Cecilia, 48 years old, has a live-in partner with four children, two of the children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Eva Cecilia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Eva Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Eva Cecilia has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BEN ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BEN sont à leur 2ème prêt solidaire. KADIA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10Kgs de fonio, 40Kgs de riz et 10Kgs de mil, 10Litres d’huile, 10Kgs d’oignon et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the  Ben group  are all women living in traditional households. On the average, they are 42 years old, with three children. They all live in the village of  Kimpara in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family ties or through their work as vendors. They sell miscellaneous products, cereals and condiments.

After having duly repaid their prior loans, the members of the group are on their second solidarity loan. Kadia, the first one standing from left to right in the photo, plans to user her loan to buy 10 kg [22lbs] of fonio [a West African grain related to millet], 40 kg [88 lbs] of rice and 10 kg [22 lbs] of millet, 10 liters [10.5 quarts] of oil, 10 kg [22 lbs] of onions and one pack of Maggi bouillon cubes. She stocks up from local wholesalers. She sells  to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit. She anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 17,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and condiments.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta, ha mantenido su negocio de venta de lácteos activo con la ayuda del capital que se les presto anteriormente, hoy en día cuenta con nuevos clientes, ha incluido más variedad de lácteos, sus nuevos ingresos le permiten cumplir con sus compromisos.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito, debido a que debe mantener surtido su inventario para no perder la preferencia de sus clientes, comprara quesillo, quesos, crema, requesón, cuajada, etc. con la inversión se mantendrá trabajando y teniendo ingresos para subsistir.
texts.en:
Berta has kept active her business of selling dairy products with the help of the capital from her previous loan. Today she has new customers and has incorporated a wider variety of dairy products. Her new income allows her to fulfill her commitments.

Berta decided to apply for a new loan. She wants to keep her inventory stocked so that she can hold on to her customers’ loyalty. Berta will buy soft cheeses, hard cheeses, cream, cottage cheese, curds, and other products. This investment will allow her to keep working and having an income on which to survive.

loans.use: to buy soft cheeses, hard cheeses, cream, cottage cheese, curds, and other products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Ozamiz and supports her eight children.

Maria is repairing parts of her house. She is applying for a loan to buy building materials and paints. 

She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paint for her house.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Doña Dionicia, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada, reside en el municipio de Santa Cruz, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, hace 15 años cultiva café, el cual vende en grano oro en la zona o a intermediarios. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la siembra de media manzana de cultivo de café. Su propósito es obtener mejores ingresos de la finca para que su hijo pueda terminar los estudios.
texts.en: Dionicia is 55 years old, married and lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz, Lempira. She has always work in agriculture growing basic grains. For the past 15 years she has grown coffee. She sells the parchment coffee in the area or to middlemen. The loan she is requesting is for 15,000 HNL and she will invest it in planting half a manzana of coffee. Her goal is to obtain higher revenues from the farm so that her children can finish their studies

loans.use: to plant half a manzana of coffee.

loans.name: Selami

texts.en:
Selami, a villager from the southeastern Albania, is requesting a loan to pay for his only child's, a 23-year-old son's, university fees and also pay for his wife’s medical expenses. In the photograph is Fitrete, his wife; Fatjon, his son, and himself, Selami.

While his wife is on a disability pension since she has been suffering from some organ disease for sometime now, Selami earns a living doing agriculture; he has apple orchards and plants potatoes and beans. He sells to wholesalers as he finds this route easier.  

Selami and his family live in a village with a large population that is situated on a mountain. Fruit-growing is what the majority of villagers practice, and also planting/selling potatoes and beans in large quantities and in smaller ones, corn and wheat.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical expenses and his son's university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chicken, pork, beef, and fish

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 20 años de edad. Como buena mujer trabajadora ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar los ingredientes para cocinar los tamales de gallina que luego vende en los cantones cercanos de su localidad, además su compañero de vida a porta a la economía familiar por medio de las siembras de maíz que realiza, actualmente posee dos manzanas de terreno que están sembradas. María y su familia se han visto beneficiados, ya que ella solicito un crédito anteriormente a FUSAI el cual invirtió en la construcción de un corredor frontal, de lo cual se siente muy agradecida por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro y mano de obra para construir un cuarto en la parte de atrás de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and her 20-year-old daughter. Being a good working woman, María wakes up extremely early so that she can prepare the ingredients for making chicken tamales. She sells her food in the nearby cantons of her town. Her companion contributes to the family’s finances by growing corn. They currently have two plots of land for planting crops. María and her family have reaped the benefits.

With the previous loan she requested from FUSAI, María invested in the construction of a corridor in the front of her house and is very grateful. She is requesting a new loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron, and labor for building a room at the back of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a room.

loans.name: Rodelita

texts.en:
Rodelita, a 60-year-old mother of an only child, has settled in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her family. She has helped her husband operate their own repair shop in order to earn a living. For over 25 years doing this activity, she has been able to support her child's education and sustain their business. 

Rodelita joined Gata Daku MPC and has taken a new loan to purchase new wheel aligner, tire changer and engine scanner.  Rodelita is hoping to expand her business by providing more services to her costumers.

loans.use: to purchase new wheel aligner, tire changer and engine scanner

loans.name: Marco Vinicio

texts.es: Marco es un joven de 21 años de edad que vive con su abuelita, el se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajo en el campo y a la crianza de chanchos, actividad que le enseña su abuelita, Marco comenta que no se encuentra estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos, Marco va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio, Marco aspira seguir con su negocio para  que su abuelita crie los chanchos y se ayude con los ingresos del hogar.
texts.en: Marco is a 21 year old young man who lives with his grandmother. He works as a day-labourer doing farm work and he raises pigs, an activity that he was taught by his grandmother. Marco says he is not studying because of the lack of economic resources.  Marco will invest the loan in buying pigs to improve his business. Marco aims to continue with his business so that his grandmother can raise the pigs to help her with the household income.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 33-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Farzana is also providing sewing services and earns the income to contribute, along with her husband, to managing the household.
 
Farzana needs different kinds of goods for her business, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore, Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Lamees

texts.en:
Lamees is an 18-year-old single young lady from a village called Belien, near Ramallah city. She lives with her family in a small house near to the Apartheid Wall. Her father works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. Lamees is a student in a local university where she studies law. She would like to become a lawyer and help her family in part of their expenses. 

Lamees took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Lamees will be able to read online articles and write reports easily.
 
Lamees appears in the photo with her new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is from Maria Aurora, Aurora. He is taking up Consumer Electronics at St. John Bosco Faith Academy. Though struggling financially, he aspires to finish this course and find a stable job to be able to help his family out of poverty. To make this possible, he wants to ask for P15,000 financial assistance from the KIVA lenders which he will use to pay for his studying expenses.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gasoline for retail

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single man from a village called Abood near Ramallah City. He lives with his family in a small house. His mother works as a teacher in a local school where she earns a modest income. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies engineering. He would like to find a job and help his family with part of their expenses. 

Mohammad took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan helps him to buy a new laptop for his studies. Mohammad will be able to read online articles and write reports more easily. Mohammad appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy needles, as well as nylon and cotton thread in a variety of colours

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is a 22-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Rifat is also providing sewing services, and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories, and this will be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Rifat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her sewing business

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been happily doing business selling shoes with her son for the past eight years. She sells beautiful shoes in different colors and designs in the local market at reasonable prices. She has attained a regular list of customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Shehnaz has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a new collection of shoes in different colors and sizes. In this way, she will be able to handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of shoes in different colors and sizes.

loans.name: Blanca Belisa

texts.es: A sus  45 Años de edad Blanca está casada y tiene 6 hijos, de los mismos que 3 viven, pero solo una está estudiando, Blanca juntamente con su esposo trabajan al jornal y en ocasiones ella cocina para todos los que van a trabajar, son alrededor de 30 personas que forman una cuadrilla,  adicionalmente cría animales menores, Blanca va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos, lo que Blanca es una señora colombiana que aspira mejorar su negocio y establecerse en Ecuador para quedarse viviendo en este lugar ya que se tiene una vida tranquila y fuera de peligro.
texts.en:
Blanca is 45 years old, married, and has six children. Three of her children live with her, but only one of them is studying. Both Blanca and her husband are daily wage earners and on occasion she will cook for everyone in their group. There are approximately 30 people who make up their work crew.

In addition, Blanca raises small animals. She will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs. Blanca is a Colombian woman who aspires to improve her business and become established in Ecuador. She wants to make a home for herself in this place so that she can have a peaceful life away from any danger.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May, 47 years old, is married and a resident of Plaridel. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  

Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. Last June, 2011 both May and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to take out a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. 

She is hopeful that, with Paglaum’s help and the patience & diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 45 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, and has one child. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Parveen provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute to managing the household with her husband.
 
Parveen needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, fabric, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and will help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 41-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Shabana is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her stitching business

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 35-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Rehana is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her sewing business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a snack vendor and hog raiser who lives with her family in Piat. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She wants to keep maintaining good profits in her business but has insufficient funds to invest in her business.

For this reason, Veronica is now asking for additional capital of PHP 4,000 to buy cooking oil, banana and flour to cook snacks to sell. This loan will help her food-selling business became profitable. She will invest additional revenue to improve her hog-raising business and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, banana and flour to cook snacks to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des condiments et des céréales.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 18ème prêt solidaire. ROKIA, 1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  50Kgs de riz, 50Kgs de mil, 50Kgs de fonio, 50Kgs de maïs, 30Kgs d’arachide et 20Ks d’haricot. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 31 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group BENKADI average 41 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in KIMPARANA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling general merchandise, condiments, and grains. 

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group BENKADI are now on their 18th solidarity loan. ROKIA, the woman standing first from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 40 kg of rice, 50 kg of millet, 50 kg of fonio [a type of millet], 50 kg of corn, 30 kg of peanuts, and 20 kg of beans. She gets her supplies locally and from surrounding villages. She makes her sales to men and women customers paying with cash and often with credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 31,000 francs CFA that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 40 years old, married, and lives in Pines, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidenta, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profits when they are sold, which are divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through PMPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep the piglets in more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feed

loans.name: Jeng

texts.en:
Jeng resides in Zamboanga Sibugay with his big family. He has 11 siblings, and his father's source of income is from their own farm.

Jeng is studying in the university, taking basic seaman training. He is determined to become successful for he wants to augment the general living situation of his family. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to pay his tuition fee for the first semester. He is thankful to GDMPC for helping poor people to uplift their lives.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is thankful that she was granted a 25,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense.

Now she would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more of popular brands of beauty products, toiletries, and cleaning products. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and pay for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance, for the financial help that will be given her.

Bella dreams of having an outlet of her own, for her direct-selling business. She prays that her husband and children will come to know and love God more. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .


*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty products, cleaning products, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a 35-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Nabila is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nabila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her sewing business

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
52-year-old Khalida is a married woman with two children. The only source of earning in her family is from the rickshaw that her husband, also shown in the picture, drives. This rickshaw helps him provide transportation services to passengers in their city. 

Khalida has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan amount will help her husband to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw. She hopes that her husband will able to earn more income in future.

loans.use: to bear the maintenance costs and change the tires of the rickshaw.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 39-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Robina is also providing sewing services, and earns the income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her sewing business

loans.name: Irine

texts.en: Irine is 29 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in Akhmeta district, Kakheti region with her two children and pensioner parents. In spite of having a university degree, Irine is still unemployed. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, Irine decided to start her own business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Irine’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn't satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program, that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 450 Gel, she will purchase all the needed equipment and work as a stylist. She will offer different styles of hair cuts, hair styles and so on to her clients. Irine is very motivated to be involved in this business and to generate her own income in order to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed equipment to work as a stylist

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen 51, is married and a mother of five children. She acquired her embroidery skills from her mother and used to make embroidery as hobby until her family's expenses started exceedingits income. She then decided to start her own business and contribute to the family's income. Since then, Nasreen has become more empowered and is able to help her husband meet the family's expenses. She takes embroidery orders and gives them to the workers to finish on a timely basis. This way she has created employment for other women in her community. Currently, she needs financing to buy fabric, beads, pearls and thread to fill orders. Therefore, she has requested a loan to help her with financing.
Her dream is to improve the living standards for her family. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for their timely assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for emboirdery

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 54 years old and lives with her husband and 11 children in Lahore. Her husband is a milkman by profession. Every morning he wakes up,  milks the cows, pours the milk into containers and then delivers it to households, shops and restaurants. Suriya lends a hand to her husband and prepares animal feed. Though some of their children are married, it is still difficult to manage their expenses with only one source of income. Recently a cow died of a disease, limiting the production of milk. 

Buying a new cow requires money but they do not have sufficient savings. Therefore Suriya has applied for a loan to help her husband in buying a new cow to resume maximum income generation for the family. She is hopeful that Kiva lenders will provide them with maximum assistance.

loans.use: to buy a cow for producing milk

loans.name: Shahzadi's Group

texts.en: Shahzadi, who lives in Lahore, is a hard-working housewife. Her husband has a fruit shop in the nearby market. He sells seasonal fresh fruit at his shop. He has seven years of experience in this business. He is hard working and honest. He is the sole earner in the family and tries his best to meet their regular expenses. But they run short of income at times. He wants to buy fresh and seasonal fruits from the local market. Summer season is ending and the next season fruits will be in the market but he does not have savings for that. For this reason, Shahzadi has requested a loan to help her husband. She belongs to a group of four women. They are thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is 41 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, and has one child. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Rasheeda provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute to managing the household with her husband.
 
Rasheeda needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, fabric, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items and will help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Rasheeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat, who lives in Lahore, is 38 years old and a mother of five children. She is a loving and caring mother. Her husband runs a general store in the community. He is hard working and polite. He wants to replenish the inventory to avoid running out of stock and also to provide more variety for his customers. Currently, he is short on cash due to increasing daily expenses. 
Riffat has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy the necessary inventory. She belongs to a group of two persons. They want to save money for the future to educate their children. Riffat is thankful to Kiva lenders for empowering her to help her husband.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a general store

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, who lives in Lahore, is 43 years old and a caring mother of five children. Her husband sells three-piece ladies' suits (called shalwar kameez) in his community. He has five years of experience running this business. He sells a variety of clothes to his customers. He has managed to maintain a good customer base. But he has to work really hard to meet his family's expenses. He wants to stay ahead of his competitors and buy winter clothing and also some fancy fabric for the coming Eid festival with the hope of increasing his sales. Therefore Robina, in order to help her husband, has applied for loan to buy more clothes.
They are hopeful for a better future and they are thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy clothing for reselling

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is 43 years old, married and is blessed with five children. Her husband is a blacksmith who makes iron and steel tools. He has 10 years of experience in this business. He is skilled and expert at his work. He currently wants to buy cast iron and wrought iron for manufacturing different products but due to a shortage of funds is unable to do so. Shehnaz has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy iron. They are thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy iron goods for manufacturing

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, 44, lives in Lahore. She is married and a mother of six. Her husband runs a crockery store in his community where he sells kitchenware like nonstick cookware, dinner sets, spoon sets, glasses, and tea sets. He is a kind and loving father. Most of his time is spent in the shop. He is the sole earner in the family. Given their big family, they manage their expenses with difficulty. 

Her husband wants to buy more variety of items with the hope of increasing sales and earning more profit. Therefore Shaheen has requested a loan to help her husband as they do not have sufficient savings. They are thankful to Kiva lenders for their assistance and hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware for reselling

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: José tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. José es un hombre emprendedor y muy trabajador quien se dedica a la venta de calculadoras en diferentes lugares de su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo. José solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica en su vivienda dado que no cuenta con el servicio. Pagará el derecho y la mano de obra para la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
45-year old José lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He is an enterprising and very hardworking man who has earned his living selling calculators in various locations in his neighbourhood for many years. 

He is seeking a loan from FUSAI to install electricity in his home as he doesn’t currently have this service. He will pay for a permit and the cost of installation.

loans.use: pay for a permit and the cost of installation of electricity in his home

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TERIYA ont en moyenne 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe TERIYA sont à leur 12ème prêt solidaire. FOUNE, 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  1 carton de Spaghetti, 3 boîtes de tomate concentré, 5Kgs lait en poudre, 20Kgs de sucre, 1 carton de venin gré et 1 carton d’eau de javel. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 500 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group TERIYA average 46 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in KIMPARANA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they have businesses buying and selling general merchandise, grains and condiments. 

After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group TERIYA are now on their 12th solidarity loan. FOUNE, the woman first on the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase a box of spaghetti, 3 boxes of tomato paste, 5 kg of powdered milk, 20 kg of sugar, a box of venin gré [vinegar?], and a box of bleach. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She makes her sales to men and women customers paying with cash and often with credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,500 francs CFA that will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Living in Lahore, Farzana runs a beauty salon in her community. She is 28, married and blessed with a daughter. She is an enthusiastic and hardworking young entrepreneur. She wants to become a helping hand to her husband and aims to save money for her daughter's education. Due to her polite and friendly nature people like her. Her customer are satisfied and appreciate her services. 

Apart from her salon services, she wants to sell cosmetics to her customers for additional income. Therefore she has requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan. She wants to become an inspiration for her daughter and is thankful to Kiva lenders for helping her with her dream to become successful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for reselling

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is a 42 year old, married man and a father of four children. His oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old. He lives with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. 

Yahya is an employee as a soldier with a small salary. He is the sole breadwinner of the family. His salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Yahaya's house lacks many home appliances, and most of the ones it has are very old. In fact, Yahya's wife can't stand these miserable conditions. Unfortunately, her husband doesn't have enough money to purchase new home appliances for the house.

For this reason, Yahya is requesting a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances as new; cooking pots, spoons, glasses and some other simple home appliances for his house. Yahya took the photo beside the home appliances store where he will purchase his home appliances. 

Yahya looks forward to improving the  living condition of his family. He hopes to have a wedding ceremony for one of his sons soon.

loans.use: to purchase appliances as new; cooking pots, a small refrigerator, and some simple home appliances for his house.

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbaatar, 35 years old, lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling furniture since 2007. His wife makes dresses at home. Their eldest daughter goes to high school while two younger daughters began to go to elementary school.

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy an electric sewing machine in order to support his wife's business. His wife will make dresses more efficiently, and attract more customers. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine in order to increase output

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbons et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur vingt sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente NAH, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbons. Elle compte acheter des 60 sacs de charbons de bois sur place. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Bamako à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJANTOYERELA is composed of married women, who average 41 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in charcoal and general merchandise. 

The women of the group DJANTOYERELA are on their 26th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, NAH, who is the person standing first from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of charcoal. She intends to purchase 60 sacks of charcoal locally. She sells at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Bamako. She plans on making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: El Titanic Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias emprendedoras, lo coordina la señora Juana de 59 años de edad, soltera, dedicada a la comercialización de artesanías en la capital, este negocio lo impulso hace veinticuatro años, cuando trabajo como enfermera y de la liquidación obtenida impulso su negocio, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de artesanías en maderas como es maracas, boleros, trompos, yoyos, etc. Otra integrante es la señora Carolina de 32 años de edad, propietaria de una mini pulpería en su domicilio desde hace ocho años, Daysi de 42 años de edad, quien se dedica a la comercialización de calzado en los departamentos de Masaya y Managua, y la señora Aurora quien tiene la edad de 34 años y es propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group consists of four enterprising members. It is coordinated by Juana who is 59 years old, single and sells handicrafts in the capital. She started this business twenty-four years ago, when she worked as a nurse and then from her redundancy pay she started her business.

She is asking for the loan to buy artisan craft items made of wood such as maracas, boleros, tops, yo-yos, etc. Another member is Carolina who is 32 years old and has owned a mini grocery store in her home for eight years. Daysi is 42 years old and sells footwear in the departments of Masaya and Managua. Aurora is 34 years old and has run a sewing workshop from her home for five years.

loans.use: to buy artisan craft items made of wood

loans.name: Zainiar

texts.en:
Meet Zainar. Zainar, her husband, and their two children live together in North Bogor, a suburban area that is located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. To support her family, Zainar runs a small Indonesian food restaurant. 

Zainar was introduced to Ruma by one of her friends and she quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income and she wanted to try to be a mobile phone airtime agent. She is excited about her new business, which is selling mobile phone airtime to her community. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions on the weekends. 

In the photo, Zainar is in her small restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services for her community

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is a farmer and store owner within his village. He just started his store last May 2014. Generating income from farming corn and vegetables helps him much, especially in putting up his store. Emilio has four children; three of them have settled for marriage while his youngest is still at high school level.

Emilio wants to keep his store profitable, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 which allows him to buy grocery items to sell, such as condiments, canned goods, sugar, and soft drinks. He hopes to avail himself of this amount of loan for further growth of his store and farming business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell, such as condiments, canned goods, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Laasen

texts.en:
Twenty-nine-year-old Laasen has been running a school for many years. Though young, he has gained enough experience to become a dynamic and motivated entrepreneur and educator. Teachers and students are very fond of his good nature and praise his teaching skills. 

Laasen says he has worked hard to make his school the top school in the community. His school has over 200 students, more than half of whom are girls. This year, Laasen has started a college for the girls who graduate from his school. 

He needs a loan of PKR 100,000 to buy furniture for his students, as well as a computer lab. He wants to be able to provide the students in his school with the best learning environment that he can offer in order to improve the level of education in the community.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his students, as well as a computer lab.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en: Annabel is 44 years old, married and has three school-age children. She lives in Sandugan, Larena Siquijor, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter but had no permanent work until she decided to start a new business. Annabel and her husband engaged in a furniture-making business, since her husband has carpentry skills. With the help of PHP5,000 in starting capital, Annabel is now earning income from her first sale. Seeing the good opportunity, she rolled up her husband and her capital to increase her resources. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP35,000 to buy more raw materials for her furniture-making business. Through this, she hopes to earn more income and help expand her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Rudianto

texts.en:
Mr. Rudianto lives in Kuantan, in Riau province on Sumatra Island. Rudianto runs a pharmacy and is as such very concerned with the health of the people. As he says: “One of the basic daily needs for all living beings, in this world is water. Without water, there is no possibility of life in the world. Unfortunately, clean water is not available everywhere, in the area where I live there is no access to clean water"

That is why he started to sell Nazava Water Filters that can be used to filter dirty well, tap or rain water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling or using electricity. Mr. Rudianto has been selling through a network of health centers, marketers that go to markets and bazaars and also through pharmacies run by friends. 

This is his second KIVA loan and he would like to use this to more deeply penetrate the market in his region. Because many of the people in his area have brown water, Rudianto is also selling filters that make dirty water clear so it can be used for washing and cooking. 

With this loan Rudianto, can buy up to 400 filters which help hem provide safe drinking water to around 2000 people

loans.use: to rapidly expand drinking water filter sales and improve the health of his community

loans.name: Sonephanxai Group

texts.en:
Hienthong is excited that he, like his group members, was able to purchase a water filter. The silver nitrate-infused ceramic element removes and destroys bacteria and similar agents of water borne diseases. 

Hienthong's village takes water from relatively shallow wells and from local streams; however, the water from natural sources in his village is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment. Even though some people in the village, including Hienthong, are able to buy bottled water, the water filter increases the disposable income available to users by decreasing the amount of money used to purchase bottled water. Hienthong and other filter users also decrease the amount of money spent to boil water by purchasing less charcoal and decreasing the time spent foraging for firewood. 

Hienthong's filter is guaranteed for 2 years, though most users find the filter works from 3-5 years. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter. Increasing time available for productive work also improves a family's income and overall well-being.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar home system to charge the car battery and improve their lifestyle

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 51 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur vingt sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente YA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’articles divers. Elle compte acheter des sacs de sucre, des cartons de thé, de Lipton et des paquets de cigarette chez les grossistes à Bamako. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJEKAFO is composed of married women, who average 51 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, and general merchandise. 

The women of the group DJEKAFO are on their 26th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, YA, the person standing first from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of general merchandise. She intends to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of Lipton tea, and packets of cigarettes from wholesalers in Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et de poisson.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente DJENEBA, première personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du poisson fumé, du cube Maggi et du grain d’arachide sur place chez les grossistes. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUISSEME is composed of married women, who average 44 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the city of Fana, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, and fish. 

The women of the group DJIGUISSEME are on their 16th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, DJENEBA, the person standing first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase onions, smoked fish, Maggi cubes [bouillon], and peanuts locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as onions and flavorings

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is single and lives in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental with her parents. Her parents have their own farm to support the family. Aside from this, Marissa has a motorcycle that she uses for transportation services. The revenue she gets from this helps her to support her family's daily expenditures. She also works in a private company, from which she earns more income. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to buy new tires. A portion of this amount will also be used to buy fertilizer. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar home system to reduce his energy cost

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil lives in Karachi. He is 35 years old and has 3 children. He started a crockery business 8 years ago at a very young age. He has managed to make many loyal customers over the years. It is the only source of income for his family. His children go to school and he is very keen and eager to give them a higher education.

In order to make his business more profitable, Jamil wants to buy silver and glass dinner sets to resell. A loan of 150,000 PKR will help him buy these items as he is short of financing. He hopes that he will have higher profit margins with the investment this time and that he will be able to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy sliver and dinner sets for his crockery store.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es: Walter  de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su grupo familiar. Él es un joven que desde hace mucho tiempo se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia, y para ello se desempeña como albañil independiente, además es agricultor de maíz y frijol en pequeño. Walter siempre buscando mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar ha decidido repellar las paredes de su vivienda y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Walter is 22 years old and resides in his own home along with his life companion and the rest of his family. He is a young man who has spent a great deal of time trying to get ahead on behalf of his family. For this reason, he has been working as an independent bricklayer. In addition, he grows corn and beans on a small scale.

Walter is always looking to improve his family’s living conditions, so he decided to plaster the walls of his house. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in the purchase of cement and sand in order to plaster the walls of his home.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand in order to plaster the walls of his home.

loans.name: La Reforma Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario La Reforma, lo integran tres socios trabajadores, quienes se esfuerzan por brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, lo coordina el señor Roger quien tiene la edad de 35 años, casado, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras desde hace ocho años en uno de los mercados de la capital, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de sacos de mamón, calala, limón, chiltoma, cebolla, etc., con el fin de mantener su negocio que es el que le permite obtener ingresos a diario. Los otros socios son los señores Gilberto de 59 años de edad, propietario de un taller de carpintería en su domicilio desde hace treinta años, y Denis quien tiene la edad de 24 años comercializa frutas y verduras en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace diez años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group La Reforma is made up of three partners who are all working men who strive to provide the best living conditions for their families.

Roger coordinates the group. He is 35 years old, married, and has worked selling fruit and vegetables in one of the markets in the capital for eight years. He is asking for this loan to buy sacks of papaya, passion fruit, lemons, peppers, onions, etc. in order to maintain his business which provides him with his daily income.

The other partners are Gilberto who is 59 years old and has owned a woodworking shop at his home for thirty years and Denis who is 24 and has been selling fruit and vegetables in the market of the municipality for ten years.

loans.use: to buy papaya, passion fruit, lemons, peppers, onions, etc

loans.name: M. Atif Shehzad

texts.en:
Atif, a youth of 27, is an electrical goods supplier and he supplies electrical items to retailers in Lahore. His hard work and dedication towards his work have made him reliable and has earned him many loyal customers. He ventured into this business five years ago and, now, he has well-established himself in the market. His good business skills are going to take him a long way, that is what his clients say.

Currently, some of Atif's clients and retailers have ordered electrical goods and copper wires, for which he is short of funds. He has, therefore, requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner.

Atif plans to save money for his business, to become self-sustaining, get married, and bear all the wedding expenses.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods and copper wires for his business.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina, who is married to a barber, requested a loan to help her husband set up a barber shop. The loan would be used to buy items such as scissors for cutting hair, water sprayer, seats, and a mirror. Unable to make the ends meet, the new barber shop would generate enough earnings to help Rubina come out of difficult financial times. Moreover, Rubina's husband plans to expand his barber shop buy inserting more seats and hiring more personnel who would help him to cut hair. The loan is extremely important for the inflow of income into Rubina's home and for meeting the basic requirements of her household.

loans.use: to purchase a front mirror, chair, scissors for cutting hair, water sprayer, and seats

loans.name: Abdul Sattar

texts.en:
Abdul lives in Karachi. He is 42 years old, married and the father of three children. He has a milk-selling business, which he has run for the past 11 years. His wife works with him in feeding and milking the buffaloes. Abdul has given his time and hard work to get to this position. The income he makes is utilized mainly to pay for the regular family expenses and his children's school fees.

Recently his buffalo died due to disease, which affected Abdul's earnings. Therefore, he requested a loan to help him increase milk production and have a steady income. He dreams of having his own farm one day.

loans.use: to purchase new buffaloes

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is 52 years old. She lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile phone shop for a few years and is earning sufficient income. He troubleshoots mobile phones, sells accessories such as chargers, bodies, data cables, etc., and provides the recharge facilities of different networks.

Nowadays demand has greatly increased for accessories and for recharging. Sometimes he has to refuse his worthy customers. But he does not have savings to further invest in his business because he has already spent all of his savings on household expenses.
