Therefore, Azra has requested a loan for her son so that he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for his recharge facility. Azra thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honourable support.

loans.use: to buy accessories for mobile phones and extra credit for her son's mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is the age of 35 years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. She properly maintains her household activities. 

Khadija has been running a beauty salon for the last two years. She is a well-trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day. 

So, she requires some beauty salon-related items, such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items, like dressing chairs and mirrors. Khadija made contact with Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. 

Khadija is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon, such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items, like dressing chairs, and mirrors.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has a business of selling tomatoes and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, cabbages, cassava and sweet potatoes. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include transportation of boxes of tomatoes from villages to her stall and also perishability. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation and also to buy a plot of land and start growing tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages, cassava and sweet potatoes

loans.name: El Chilamate Ii Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por la señora Leila, quien tiene la edad de 44 años, acompañada, dedicada a la fabricación de delantar, este negocio lo impulso hace veintiún años, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de dacron, hilo, ente tela, zipper, cinta de mantequilla, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mantener su negocio, y se ha propuesto abrir nuevos mercados para la comercialización de sus productos. Las otras socias son las señoras, Isolda quien tiene la edad de 24 años, y se dedica a la fabricación de delantares, comercializándolos en el mercado más populoso de la capital, y Marlyn de 33 años de edad, quien comercializa delantares desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group consists of three hard-working women, and is coordinated by Leila who is 44 years old, married and makes aprons for a living. She launched this business 21 years ago. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy Dacron, thread, lining, zippers, ribbon, etc. The previous loans allowed her to maintain her business, and she has decided to open new markets to sell her products. 

The other members are these women: Isolda is 24 years old and she makes and sells aprons for a living in the most famous market in the capital. Marlyn is 33 years old and she has been selling aprons for the past two years.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Primavera lo integran cuatro socios emprendedores, y es coordinado por la señora Elizabeth quien tiene la edad de 27 años, casada, dedicada a la comercialización de ropa en el mercado más populoso de la capital, este negocio lo impulso hace ocho con ayuda de su compañero de vida, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisetas, talladores, licras, tobilleras, bóxer, camisolas, etc., también invertirá en calzado para damas como es sandalias bajas y zapatos, uno de sus logros es que ha invertido en calzado, pues antes solo comercializaba ropa. Los otros socios son las señoras Yessenia quien tiene la edad de 35 años y comercializa materiales de construcción desde hace diez años, Martha de 50 años de edad, comerciante de ropa y electrodomésticos en el mercado más populoso de la capital desde hace veinticinco años, y el señor Ervin de 24 años de edad, quien comercializa accesorios para vehículos.
texts.en: The Primavera (Spring) group is composed of four enterprising members. The group is coordinated by Elizabeth, who is 27 years old and married. She works selling clothing at the biggest market in the capital. She started this business eight years ago with the support of her domestic partner. She is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, women tops, sport shorts, ankle braces, boxers, sport shirts, etc.  She will also use it to buy women's footwear such as low heel sandals and shoes. One of her achievements is that she has invested in footwear, because previously she was only selling clothing. The other members are Yessenia who is 35 years old and has been selling building materials for ten years; Martha, 50 years old, who has been selling clothing and electric appliances at the biggest market of the capital; and Ervin, 24 years old, who sells vehicle accessories.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of machine-stitching and selling embroidered dresses in his nearby town. He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages. He also brings some material home for Farzana, because she helps him in the completion of embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his art and appreciate his efforts. 

Farzana's husband wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy the materials he needs to make them, in advance. For this purpose, he requires some capital to buy the desired inventories, but he does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Farzana made this humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan, her husband will be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. 

Farzana is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Kelys Marilu

texts.es:
Kelys es una mujer de 42 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9° grado, luego se vio obligada a migrar a la ciudad debido a la guerra, fue ahí donde estudio y logro terminar un curso de elaboración de pasteles y hoy de nuevo vive en la comunidad, y elabora los ricos pasteles.

Esta  casada, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería  casi permanente, de los tres hijos solo dos estudian bachillerato un barón y una hembra.
  
Al trabajo que le dedica mayor tiempo es a los oficios domésticos y como segundo la elaboración de pasteles, casi solo por encargos, aprendió más o menos desde hace unos 15 años, también le ayuda su hija quien ya está aprendiendo y quiere heredar sus conocimientos.
 
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar lamina y polín para techar una parte de la casa, ya que es bien pequeña y solo tiene dos habitaciones y necesitan privacidad cosa que en este momento no la tienen.
  
El sueño de Kelys es tener un local en la ciudad donde pueda vender más y explotar lo que sabe hacer y tener recursos económicos que le permitan mandar a una universidad a su hija quien tiene un sueño de ser una profesional en salud, por lo que tendrá la oportunidad solo si es apoyada con créditos.
texts.en:
Kelys is a 42-year-old woman. She studied up to ninth grade. Then, because of the war, she was forced to migrate to the city. It is there where she took and managed to complete a cake baking course. Now she is back in her community and bakes delicious cakes.

She is married. Her husband makes a living as a builder, almost on a full-time basis. They have three children, of whom only two (a boy and a girl) go to high school.

She spends most of her time being a homemaker and bakes cakes on the side—almost only to order. She learned the trade approximately 15 years ago. Her daughter, who is currently learning from her and wants to absorb all of her knowledge, also helps her out. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase metal sheeting and purlins to roof a part of her house because it is too small, only has two rooms, and they need privacy, which they don't have at the moment.

Kelys's dream is to have a retail space in her city, where she will be able to exploit her know-how, sell more, and have the means to send her daughter to university. Her daughter dreams of becoming a health care professional. She will have the opportunity only through the loans.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting and purlins to roof a part of her house.

loans.name: Mukhtara

texts.en:
Mukhtara is 40 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, which he has been doing for  five years. His rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. Most of its parts are out of order so he is unable to generate any income. 

Mukhtara's husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost. Mukhtara requested a loan from  BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This loan will help him to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been preparing graves in a nearby graveyard. His tools have been depreciating with the passage of time, so he is required to buy a shovel and digging bar for digging graves.

Lubna requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy soil, bricks, shovel, and digging bar for preparing graves. He hopes to generate maximum income.

loans.use: to purchase soil, bricks, shovel, and digging bar

loans.name: Fahmeeda's Group

texts.en:
Fahmeeda is a 40-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. She knits handmade embroidery in her home. Her children also help her with the completion of her tasks. Her husband has been running a small business of fiber sales. He buys raw material for his fiber work and sells the finished fiber to his customers for profit. 

Now he wants to increase his current business, but due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Fahmeeda, has requested a loan from Kiva lenders. She hopes that through this Kiva loan her husband will be able to enhance his fiber business. She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fibers.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 30-year-old woman who is a responsible mother with two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. Mariyam’s husband has been driving an auto-rickshaw for the last two years. Unfortunately, his rickshaw is not working properly and he is therefore unable to generate any amount of income. Do to the lack of money, Mariyam’s husband is unable to quickly repair his rickshaw.

Mariyam is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Her loan will help him to continue his business. Mariyam is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, a housewife, needs a loan for her husband so that he can refurbish and expand his restaurant. Shamim is blessed with children, and she aims at getting them educated with the funds generated from this restaurant.

The items required include furniture (tables and chairs), groceries (vegetables and meat), plus a new gas cylinder.

This loan is pivotal for Shamim as expanding her husband's restaurant would help increase his earnings, simultaneously fulfilling her aim of getting a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy furniture, groceries and a new gas cylinder for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace algunos años a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce y pan francés, su panadería la tiene ubicada en su lugar de residencia y posee mucha clientela, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos del hogar vive en casa proa con su madre, su padrastro y sus dos hermanos quienes trabajan y también ayudan en el hogar, el joven esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, levadura, azúcar, miel, manteca, etc. para continua con su trabajo que le generan buena ganancias.
texts.en: This young man’s image was pixilated because he is 22 years old and lives in a high risk area.  He has been making and selling sweet bread and French bread in his bakery, located in his home, for several years.  He has many customers and uses his earnings to help with the household expenses.  He lives in his own home, along with his mother, stepfather, and two siblings who work and also help with the household.  He is asking for a loan to buy flour, yeast, sugar, honey, lard, etc. to continue with his work, which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family, living hand to mouth.

Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells clothing of various types and colours. He has been running this business for many years. His business is unable to generate sufficient income for his family. It is necessary to grow the business to meet the family's needs but a lack of capital is the major problem for him.

Therefore, Shahida took out a loan for her husband’s business. With help from this loan, he will purchase more clothes to sell. Shahida thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing of various colours for reselling.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 30 years old and her family consists of four people, including her two kids. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. For the last five years, Yasmeen’s husband has been running a restaurant and he provides good and fresh food and meals at the main market. Many shopkeepers come into his restaurant to eat delicious food. 

Yasmeen is requesting a loan through the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy some crockery and fresh food items to develop her husband’s business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crockery and fresh food items for her husband’s small restaurant

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 45-year-old woman, living with her six children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Parveen’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent for it because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been able to feed his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Parveen has been saving for a long time to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan so that, along with the contribution of savings, her son can buy a new rickshaw.

She hopes that now her son will be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone. She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
Esperanza en Cristo está integrado por tres socios emprendedores y laboriosos. Es coordinado por el señor Humberto quien tiene la edad de 58 años de edad, soltero, se dedica a la comercialización de productos Eskimos y pan, es el segundo préstamo que solicita a la institución y ha logrado impulsar la venta de pan, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de variedad de productos Eskimos como es sandwish, chocobanano, cono, paleta de cocoa, paleta de chocolate, etc., y pan como es pico, empanada, polvorones, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Rosa de 34 años de edad, y se dedica a la comercialización de pescado en el municipio de 
Tipitapa y la joven Blanca quien tiene la edad de 23 años y se dedica a la comercialización de ropa en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Esperanza en Cristo (Hope in Christ) is composed of three entrepreneurial and industrious members, and is coordinated by Humberto. He is 58 years old, single, and works selling ice cream and bread products. This is the second loan he is requesting; with the previous one he managed to boost the sale of bread. 

He is now requesting this loan to buy a variety of ice cream products, such as chocolate covered bananas, cones, chocolate pops, cocoa pops, etc., and bread products such as sugar loaf, empanada, polveron (shortbread), etc. The other group members are Rosa, who is 35, and sells fish in the Tipitapa market, and Blanca, who is 23 and sells clothes in her community.

loans.use: to buy ice cream and bread to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale à Lomé, Afi âgée de 43ans à pour mari un soudeur et maman d'un enfant de 19ans. Madame Afi a commencé l'activité en 2007 et s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Pour réinvestir dans la vente des produits alimentaires, elle sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES. Elle espère à l'avenir variée ses produits et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Afi is a re-seller of general foodstuffs in Lomé, and is 43 years old. She is married to a welder, and has one child aged 19. She began her trade in 2007 and purchases her goods from the Great Market in Lomé. She is seeking a third loan from WAGES in order to purchase more foodstuffs. She aims to diversify her product range in future, and also wishes to look after her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase general foodstuffs

loans.name: Deyra Aracelys

texts.es:
La pulpería de Deyra ya cumplió los 10 años como principal fuente de comercio en su barrio. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo debido a las inversiones que hay hecho. Actualmente se siente muy agradecida con los que la apoyaron en su última inversión, pues gracias a ese crédito pudo comprar arroz, azúcar, productos escolares, entre otros productos para vender. Además, con el mismo préstamo adquirió una vitrina para almacenar esta nueva mercadería. 
A sus 34 años, Deyra siempre ha trabajado fuerte para salir adelante. Por lo mismo, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para cambiar el piso de tierra de su pulpería por una superficie de ladrillos. Esto evitará pérdidas en los granos básicos que se almacenan en sacos, los cuales se mojan debido al tipo de suelo. Al terminar de pagar este crédito, optará por uno nuevo de saneamiento para construir un baño en su vivienda. Ella no se considera una persona autosuficiente porque necesita créditos para mejorar su negocio, pero sabe que poco a poco lo logrará.
texts.en:
Deyra's store has celebrated ten years as the main business in her neighbourhood. Bit by bit, it has grown due to her investments.
She is very grateful to those who supported her previous investment; thanks to this loan she was able to buy rice, sugar, school supplies, and other products to sell. With the same loan, she was also able to buy a display case to display her new merchandise.
At the age of 34, Deyra has always worked hard to get ahead. For this reason, she wants to continue investing in her business. She is requesting a new loan to replace the dirt floor of her business with brick. This will prevent losses of grains, which she stores in bags and which get wet due to the dirt floor.
When she repays this loan, she will take out another in order to build a bathroom in her home. She doesn't consider herself to be self-sufficient because needs loans to improve her business, but she knows that bit by bit she will get there.

loans.use: to lay a brick floor in her store; it is currently dirt.

loans.name: M. Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem, 36 is married and has four children. He runs a small paan (betel, a local delight) and cigarette shop in the local market. 

He started this business 5 years ago and wants to expand his business by adding more products to his shop. He started selling beverages in his shop recently for which he needs another refrigerator to keep them chilled. He hopes expanding his business gradually like this would be beneficial, as he will be able to earn more and give a better life to his family. Though he managed to arrange financing for the beverages he is short of funds to pay for the refrigerator expense. A loan of 150,000 PKR would help him buy a refrigerator. 

It would be his second term of loan from BRAC Pakistan and he is hopeful that he would reap its fruits just as he did previously. 

He is thankful to Kiva Lenders

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for cold drinks.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a diligent mother of five children. She is the wife of a rickshaw driver. Her husband works day and night so that he can earn enough to fulfill the needs of his family. He wants to provide a quality education and a bright future to his children. 

Currently the wheels of his rickshaw are not in good condition, and due to this he is unable to continue his work properly. So he wants to buy new wheels for his rickshaw. He is facing many financial issues because of this, as he is unable to pay for the monthly bills, the school fees of his children or fulfill their daily basic needs.

Rubina wants to help her husband, therefore she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will go towards helping her husband to continue generating income. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Darwin Rolando

texts.es: Rolando es un joven de 24 años de edad,  vive con su madre y los dos se dedican a trabajar a la cuadrilla (personas que se reúnen en  la madrugada  esperando que llegue alguien y les lleva a trabajar) y también se dedican a la crianza de animales, el crédito lo necesita para comprar  chanchos y criarlos en unos lotecitos que pertenecen a personas que no los utilizan, ya que rolando y su madre no tiene donde  tener sus animalitos,  Rolando  aspira seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio y a futuro para comprarse un lotecito para tener espacio donde construir chancheras para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rolando es a 24-year old young man who lives with his mother. They work with a "cuadrilla" (a group of people who get together at dawn waiting for someone to take them to work) and also breed animals. 

He needs the loan to buy pigs and breed them in small fields which are unused (Rolando and his mother do not have a space to keep the animals). Rolando expects to keep working and to improve the business. His goal for the future is to buy a small plot so that he can build pig houses and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ifrah

texts.en:
Ifrah, aged 25, is a married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children, and this is the reason for her working extremely hard - to keep her children smiling.

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her kid, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and since then she has been sewing clothes for her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her craft so she would like to buy a Juki sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance.

She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community. She has requested a loan to buy a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

Ifrah is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kofra Bamana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de galette et de vanne.
Les femmes du groupe KOTOTALA sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FANTA, deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de galette. Elle compte acheter de l’huile et de la farine boulangère chez les grossistes à Massigui. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The KOTOTALA group is made up of married women who are 45 years old on average, and have 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kofra Bamana, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They met through family, neighbours and friends. They work in food preparation, the sale of cereals, pancakes and baskets. The KOTOTALA group women are on their fifth loan. 

In order to satisfy their large customer demand, they are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 
One of the group's members, FANTA, the second from the right, is illiterate, and currently sells pancakes for a living. She aims to purchase oil and baking flour from the wholesalers in Massigui. 
She sells her goods at retail at the market, for cash sales and to a mixed customer base. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase baking flour and oil

loans.name: Denia Carolina

texts.es:
Denia es una joven estudiante de Psicología, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Denia, nací en la Ciudad de La Vega, tengo 18 años de edad,  vivo con mis padres y hermanos. Soy la menor de 3 hermanos,
 Mi madre trabaja como profesora en un colegio privado, mi padre no puede trabajar, ya que está incapacitado físicamente a causa de un accidente de tránsito.   Mi  hermano y mi hermana se dedican a estudiar. 
Con el inmenso deseo de superarme y ser alguien útil a la sociedad y de seguir mis ideales, estudio en la  Universidad Católica Tecnológica del  Cibao  (UCATECI), la carrea de psicología  con el firme propósito de poder terminarla, de la misma ya he dado las materias de: Español I, Matemática I,  y Orientación Universitaria, todas en el primer cuatrimestre, tuve que retirarme por no poder saldar mis cuotas para inscribirme. Mis padres con muy bajos ingresos y de no obtener  el préstamo no será posible continuar con mis estudios.  
Me identifico con la carrera, soy una joven que le gusta ayudar a los demás, poseo el don de escuchar, orientar  y dar consejos.
Dentro de mis metas están: Alcanzar aprendizaje y conocimientos cognoscitivos en el área, obtener excelentes calificaciones, llegar a graduarme, ser una profesional eficiente y capaz, trabajar digna y honradamente para pagar mi préstamo a las instituciones que me ayudaron. Y aportar para el desarrollo de la economía de mis padres.
texts.en:
Denia is a young Psychology student who is requesting a loan to cover tuition expenses. This is her story: 

"My name is Denia and I am from Ciudad de La Vega. I am 18 years old, the youngest of three siblings, and live with my parents and siblings. My mother works as a teacher in a private school and my dad is handicapped and incapable of working due to a car accident. My brother and sister are still studying. 

I have a strong will to improve, become useful to society and follow my beliefs. I attend classes at the Catholic Technological University of Cibao (UCATECI) and expect to graduate with a degree in Psychology. I have passed Spanish I, Math I and University Orientation in the first semester, but had to withdraw because I could not cover my tuition expenses. My parents do not have many resources, so this loan is my only option to keep studying. 

I identify myself with this career as I enjoy helping others, listening, guiding and giving advice. My goals are to gain knowledge of the field, get good grades, graduate and become an efficient and capable professional. I want to have a decent and honest job to pay back the loan and to contribute to my parents' financial situation."

loans.use: to cover higher education tuition expenses.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine, age 36, runs a school in her local area. She is an educated lady and is respected by everyone in the community. She and her husband have three children.

She has introduced a specific syllabus requiring specific books for her school, as she wants to deliver extra curriculum knowledge through teaching. Some of these books are not easily available in local book shops. Therefore, Josphine has decided to sell the books through the school stationery shop. However, due to lack of money, she finds it difficult to buy the books she needs to offer. Therefore, she has applied for a loan. This will allow her to offer the needed schoolbooks to her students. 

She is hopeful for a better future for her students and wishes to serve as a role model for many in the community.

She is thankful to her Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy schoolbooks to sell through her school stationery shop

loans.name: Nazmeen

texts.en:
Nazmeen, age 35, sells clothing to earn an income. She is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan and the mother of four children. Her husband is an employee in a public sector organization, and he applies his income toward the needs of the entire family. Nazmeen has also been engaged in her business of clothes selling for many years, and she supplements her husband's income with her own in order to help sustain the needs of the household.

Nazmeen needs to buy different types of clothes in bulk to offer for sale, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not presently in the position to buy these items. She has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can easily purchase the clothes she requires to fulfill her business needs. In this way, she can earn a more profitable income to support her family and business.
 
Nazmeen is very thankful to her Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy different types of clothes in bulk to offer for resale

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Sonia de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de productos para la agricultura como: fierros, hachas, corvos, chuzos, vainas, entre otros, desde hace 39 años, tiene muchos clientes que la buscan por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Sonia is 55 years old and lives in a home of her own with her mother.  She sells agricultural products such as irons, axes, pikes, pods, and other things, and has been doing so for 39 years.  She has many customers who seek her out due to the quality of her products and good prices.  She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise in quantity and continue with her sales because they generate a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for resale.

loans.name: Maa Gelhadevi Shg Group

texts.en:
Alladin is a 34-year-old married woman from a village near a small city called Boudh, in Odisha, India. She is a mother of two children. Alladin and her husband work as farmers on their own land. They plant seasonal crops and sell them to the local traders. It is a very good business, but seasonal.

Alladin, along with her group, took a loan from People's Forum. This loan will help her and her group members to buy more seeds and seedlings to increase and improve their farms. They will also be able to improve their families’ living conditions.

The other members of this group are also engaged in the same business activity.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and seedlings for their farm.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur vingt sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente FATOUMATA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’articles divers. Elle compte acheter des sacs de sucre, des cartons de thé, de Lipton, du sachet plastique et des paquets de cigarette chez les grossistes à Fana. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The LAIDOU gropu is made up of married women, who are aged 42 years old and each have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 
They met through family, neighbours and friends. They sell condiments and various items for a living. 
The LAIDOU women are on their 26th loan. 
They are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the large demand of their customers. 
FATOUMATA, the first lady standing on the left, is illiterate, and sells various items for a living. She aims to purchase bags of sugar, boxes of tea, Lipton, plastic sachets, and packs of cigarettes from the wholesalers in Fana. She take cash sales at retail to a mixed customer base. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to have maintenance done on his Taxi because its current condition is not good. It incurs maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nasreen's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and then provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Nasreen also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's future needs.

Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay the expense of her husband's taxi repair.

loans.name: Veronica Lizette

texts.es: Verónica tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 años y 7 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de productos por catalogo desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar. Verónica ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones del techo de su vivienda, poniendo cielo falso para dar mayor seguridad a su familia. Espera poder contar con el financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Veronica is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, 7 and 12 years old.  She has been earning her living by selling catalog products for a long time and in this way together with her husband maintains the finances of their home.

 Veronica has decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI because she wants to improve the conditions of their home, putting in a false ceiling to provide better security to her family.  She hopes to be able to depend on the financing, and thus to begin the improvement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy and install a false ceiling in her home

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is thirty years old and a mother of two children. Her husband has been working as a wood carpenter for many years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Gulshan's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other tools for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy this merchandise. Therefore Gulshan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of both family and business.

Gulshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of tools and merchandise for her husband's furniture shop business.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran, age 50, and her husband live in Lahore. They have five children. Her husband is a very hard-working and honest man who owns a small restaurant, where he offers many types of delicious foods. Sughran cooks some of the dishes for the restaurant at her home. 

Many people like to eat at this family restaurant, and Sughran's husband has been running it for many years. This is the reason why most of the chairs, utensils, and crockery have broken. He would like to buy new plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery, but the bulk of his income is used to cover household expenses. 

Sughran has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery for his restaurant. She offers her thanks to her Kiva lenders and appreciates the warmth of the support given to her.

loans.use: to buy new plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery for her husband's small restaurant

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Nosheen is a 29-year-old woman, and mother of two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a sweet shop where he sells a variety of sweets with different flavors. He is the only one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Nosheen's husband needs to purchase different types of ingredients and flavors for sweet-making purposes, so that he can increase his sale growth and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purposes. Therefore, Nosheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of sweet ingredients for her husband's sweet-making business.

loans.name: Shaukat Ali

texts.en:
Shaukat, age 51, entered into the business of clock manufacturing four years ago. He started with a small investment and was able to hire a few workers for assembling clocks. His business is proving to be successful. He lives with his wife and their five children in Lahore. He is a kindhearted and honest person.
 
His business is doing well, and he wants to help the enterprise to become more profitable Therefore, he wishes to manufacture more clocks to offer for sale to wholesalers and retailers. Shaukat has requested a loan in order to obtain the raw materials for assembling clocks.

He wants to continue expanding his business in this manner. Most of all, he hopes to create further employment opportunities for the needy in his community.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for manufacturing and assembling wall clocks

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, no tiene hijos bajo su poder, vive en el caserío de Cuyca; en dicho caserío la poblacion esta dedicada al cultivo de arroz principalmente, pero también se dedican a la ganadería; dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Irma se dedica al Cultivo de arroz, desde hace 10 años. Ella requiere del crédito para la inversión en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo de arroz, así como también necesita realizar la compra de semillas. Esto le permitirá realizar su siembra sin complicaciones y obtener una buena cosecha ya que Irma posee conocimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Irma is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner, and has no children depending on her.  Irma lives in the small town of Cuyca.  In that town, people mostly work at growing rice, but also at raising cattle.  Cuyca is in the Colasay district, Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Irma has been earning her living by growing rice for the past 10 years.  She needs the loan to buy manure and fertilizers for her rice crop, and also needs to buy seeds.  This will allow her to sow  her crop without problems and have a good harvest, since Irma has the knowledge needed for this business.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for her rice crop and also seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce  de charbons, de la farine boulangère et de savons.
Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur vingt sixième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente YENA, première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbons. Elle compte 50 sacs de charbons de bois sur place. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Bamako à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The SABOUGNOUMA group is made up of married women, who are aged 34 years old on average, and have three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, in the Diola prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They met through family, neighbours and friends. They work in food preparation, and in the sale of charcoal, baking flour and soap. The SABOUGNOUMA women are on their 26th loan. 
In order to satisfy their customers' large demand, they are seeking a new loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 
YENA, the first lady sitting on the left, is illiterate and sells charcoal for a living. She aims to purchase 50 bags of charcoal. 
She will sell her goods for cash at retail to a customer base made up of men and women. 
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA which will be reinvested into the business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is a responsible mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the past eight years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Sania has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Sania's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income.  Sania also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in the future.  Sania is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a 38-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 3 sons. She has been providing sewing services for many years and earns income to contribute to the managing of the household. 

She needs a new sewing machine for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase a sewing machine and its accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to provide better sewing services by purchasing a sewing machine and its accessories. It will be helpful for increasing monthly sales, thus creating greater profit.

Sultana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buya  new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en:
Like many others in his community, Abdul, age 40, sells milk to households, retailers, and restaurants. Abdul and his wife have seven children. Though he could not make it to higher education due to financial constraints, this business has provided him with enough income to meet his family's needs. He is a hard-working and disciplined person.
 
In order to make more profit, he wishes to buy another buffalo to increase milk production. He has therefore requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

His goal is for his children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Eloisa De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De  Crédito Nueva Integración. Este lugar muy rico en vegetación en la cual muchos habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y venta de sus productos.
Aquí vive la señora Eloisa, tiene 52 años  de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esa relación tiene ocho hijos, la menor tiene 17 años de edad y estudia en colegio, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es trabaja en el Municipio de la ciudad.
Doña Eloisa es una mujer muy luchadora que le ha gustado siempre trabajar para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella además de ropa también prepara comida y bocadillos para fiestas o compromisos sociales, esto lo hace por pedidos que sus clientes le piden con anticipación. Trabaja todos los días por horas ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas. Tiene más de 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien familiar
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños es seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Los Rosales in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the “Nueva Integración” (New Integration) loan group meet every 15 days. This is a place very rich in vegetation and is one in which many people work in agriculture and in selling products.

Eloisa also lives there. She is 52 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has 8 children from that relationship. The youngest child is 17 years old and is in high school; two of the children still live in her house. Her husband works in the local government in the city.

Eloisa is a very determined woman who has always liked working to get ahead. She sells all types of clothing door to door. She also sells in her house, where her clients come. In addition, she makes food and sandwiches for parties or social engagements. She does this based on orders that her clients give her in advance. She works everyday for hours since she repays the loan and earns by the week. She has done this work for more than 5 years, and she uses what she earns from this for her family’s wellbeing. 

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing and supplies to prepare food. She has been with the loan group since it began, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to continue in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and supplies.

loans.name: Delirosa

texts.en:
Delirosa is 38 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Delirosa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. More recently, she is borrowing from Kiva.

Delirosa is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Najmunnisa

texts.en:
Najmunnisa is responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. One of her sons has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her son needs to make maintenance on his taxi, because the current condition of his taxi is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Najmunnisa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Najmunnisa’s son can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Najmunnisa also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her son's income, to meet her family's needs in the future. Najmunnisa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance on her son's taxi.

loans.name: Bibi Rani

texts.en:
Bibi Rani is the age of 55 and the mother of seven children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a milkman by profession. He has been running a milk sales business for the last five years.

The income generated by his present herd is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so he wants to expand his business of milk sales. He has had this business for the last five years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in his locality.
 
He decided to increase his current milk sales business. Therefore his mother, Bibi Rani, has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, to increase her son's milk sales business. Bibi Rani is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her son's milk sales business.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 49 years old and the mother of five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Nazeeran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nazeeran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairs for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Yervand

texts.en:
This young and laborious man, 27 years old, lives in the village Lusadzor of Tavush region. His name is Yervand. He is not married and he lives with his mother and his brother’s family.  Yervand used to do different construction work, but now his only occupation is farming and agriculture. 

With his mother, Yervand takes care of 17 cows, 5 pigs and 30 chickens. He also has a greenhouse where he cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, beans and greens, the greatest part of which he sells. The dairy products are now few that he sells; milk, macun (Armenian national dairy-product), cheese, also eggs and meat. Like any farmer Yervand is also getting prepared for the coming winter season. So this loan has great function for his farm, particularly for his cattle. With the loan amount, he wants to buy a lot of hay and fodder for his farm cattle for coming long and cold winter period.

loans.use: to buy a lot of hay and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Evaliste

texts.en:
Everest, age 26, is a young farmer who has been farming maize for one year. He has applied for a loan in order to buy fertilizers for his maize crops. 

The expected profits from Everest's farming efforts will be used to buy more land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maize

loans.name: Maria Mary Lou

texts.en: Maria Mary Lou makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a buy and sell business in Liloy, and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access of capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed a loan.  Maria Mary Lou hopes to sustain her business, and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods and personal items to sell.

loans.name: Rudrapala Shg Group

texts.en:
Labanga is a 26-year-old married lady, and she has two kids. She is a responsible mother and lives with her kids and husband in Boudh district. 

Four years ago, in a search of a source of income for her family, she started working in agriculture and animal husbandry. Thanks to her hard work, she has achieved great success in her business and now earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR. Her assets include three milking cows, ten sheep, and one hectare of land, on which she grows cereal crops, both for her own use and for sale. 

Labanga sells organic milk, which is in high demand among local residents. Since demand is growing, she, along with her group, has turned to People's Forum for a loan of 150,000 INR. 

She will use her portion to buy an additional milking cow as well as to build a barn for her livestock. She plans to use the profits from the loan to further develop her business and to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy an additional milking cow.

loans.name: Nabila's Group

texts.en:
Nabila is a 45-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband provides services in shuttering work for buildings. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing accessories to improve his shuttering work. 

So that he can generate more income for the financial support of his family, Nabila is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy shuttering material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Jahangir

texts.en:
Jahangir is 47 years old and a father of 5 living in Lahore. He is a milkman by profession. He earns a living by selling milk to his customers. He has been doing this for 20 years now. He has managed to develop a good customer base. 

He wishes to buy additional buffalo to increase milk production and subsequently increase sales. He has requested a loan to arrange financing for this purpose. Milk selling being the sole source of income for his family, he wants his business to become more self-sustaining. It is important for his family's future and he is hopeful that his business will prosper and flourish. He is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional buffalo for his milk selling business.

loans.name: Farzand Ali

texts.en:
Farzand, age 54, has operated a restaurant for the past 20 years. He works and lives in Lahore. He and his wife have seven children.

In his restaurant, Farzand offers local Pakistani cuisines to his customers. He is hard-working and responsible. At the present time, he would like to expand his business, and would therefore need to buy more food items, purchase plastic furniture (such as tables and chairs), and make some physical improvements (such as whitewashing the restaurant). This loan will allow him to make these investments.

He is hopeful that these changes will improve his business and allow him to earn more profit. He wishes to increase the salaries of his workers as well as to hire an additional employee. 

His goal is to see his business continue to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a cauldron, food items, and plastic furniture for his restaurant. as well as to make physical improvements to the premises

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 42 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband owns a shop for chicken sales in the market. He has been running his chicken sales shop for the last five years. He buys chicken from the wholesaler and sells it in his shop to the customers. 

His number of clients is increasing due to his good attitude towards his clients. Moreover, he is the sole earner of his family, so he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family's requirements. 

He is a very honest shopkeeper. He behaves politely to people. He wants to buy broilers to sell from his chicken shop to improve his standard of living. For the development of his business, he needs a loan. So his wife, Suriya, contacted BRAC Pakistan who issued her a loan for her husband's shop. Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's chicken sales business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 15ème prêt solidaire. ASTAN, 1ère femme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  10Kgs de pomme de terre, 50Kgs de riz et 20Kgs de maïs, 1 carton de Spaghetti, 10Litres d’huile, 5Kgs d’oignon et 1 paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 42 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The  members of the  Benkadi group  are all women living in traditional extended  families. On the average, they are 45 years old, with four children. They all live in the village of  Kimparana in Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family ties and work as vendors selling cereals and condiments.

After having duly repaid their prior loans, the members of the group are on their 15th solidarity loan. Astan, the first one standing from right to rleft in the photo, plans to user her loan to buy  10 kgs [22 lbs] of potatoes, 50 kg [110 lbs] of rice, 20 kg [44 lbs[ of corn, one box of spaghetti, 10 liters [10.5 quarts] of oil, 5 kg [11 lbs] of onions and one pack of Maggi bouillon cubes. She stocks up from local wholesalers. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit.

She anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 42,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and condiments.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas is a 25-year-old, dried fish vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. Tomas has been in the business for more than three years now. This is the source of his income.  Tomas is asking for a loan to buy more fish for making "tuyo" or dried fish.  With this, he will be able to improve his stock thus allowing him to sell more to his customers. In the future, Tomas hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ulysses

texts.en: Ulysses settled for a living at Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. He works as a security guard, and at the same time had a motor transport business to make a living. He has been a member of Gata Daku MPC for almost ten years and used his previous loan for buying spare parts and motor accessories. It has been successfully repaid. To maintain a better service, he took a new loan for maintenance costs and motor improvements. He wants to improve the general living of his family in the near future, and dreams to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and and maintenance for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mirian Violeta

texts.es:
Miriam Violeta tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo dependiente; vive con su hijo y su conyugue en el caserío Las Juntas en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. El caserío Las Juntas es un caserío pequeño con aspiraciones a superarse; en dicho caserío sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Miriam Violeta se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su domicilio, dicho negocio se encuentra ubicado a orillas de la carretera marginal de Olmos - Corral Quemado, es por eso que la mayor parte de sus clientes son los transportistas que circulan por la carretera, su negocio es estable cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia, además Miriam Violeta se dedica a la fabricación de chocolate en barra, ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, por su buen servicio y experiencia, cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de materia prima para la elaboración de chocolates(compra de cacao, azúcar, entre otros) y para compra de productos para surtir su tienda(arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros). Con esta inversión Miriam Violeta podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam Violeta is 61 years old, is married, and has a dependent son. She lives with her son and his wife in the village of Las Juntas in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú. The village of Las Juntas is a small village with aspirations for improvement. In this village, the main activities are agriculture, business, and livestock.

Miriam Violeta works in business. She has a small store located in her home. This business is located at the edge of a minor highway in Olmos, Corral Qumado. As a result, most of her clients are drivers that travel on the highway. Her business is stable, and she has more than 10 years of experience. Additionally, Miriam Violeta makes chocolate bars. She has very good personal and professional references because of her good service and experience. She has many clients in the area. 

The loan will be invested in her business to buy raw materials for making chocolate. This includes buying cacao and sugar, among other things. The loan will also be used to buy products to supply her store, including rice, sugar, and oil, among other things. With this investment, Miriam Violeta will be able to acquire acceptable profits so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making chocolate and to buy products to supply her store (e.g., rice, sugar, oil).

loans.name: Taron

texts.en:
Taron hopes to receive a second loan from Kiva, since the first one brought stability to his business and increased his income. He also gained more customers than he had before.

Taron lives in the village of Gugark in the Lori region with his pretty wife and their two school-aged children. He works in a rented garage in the city of Vanadzor, offering car repair services like the replacement and repair of car engines, car transmission boxes, and other car equipment. He tells us that this business represents the only income supporting his family, and he works night and day, without holidays or vacations, since his children are growing up and therefore incurring an ever greater expense.

Taron is asking Kiva lenders to help him with a second loan, which he will use for the purchase of motor oil to offer for sale. This is a wise investment because with the cold season comes a greater demand among drivers for motor oil.

loans.use: to buy motor oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 46-years young lady. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which consists of six persons. Her son owns a sanitary items shop. He has been running the shop for the last seven years. He sells a variety of sanitary items like pvc pipes, wash basins, bracket pairs for wash basins, lead (solid) looking glass, etc. in his shop. 

He required an amount of money to enhance his business, so Shahida made contact with Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, for a loan. Brac staff visited her son's sanitary shop and issued the loan. Shahida is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her son's sanitary shop.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Five years ago, Ritanjali was able to start her own general store selling basic household items, cases of water, soda, and various other juices in bulk and individually. Only 24 years old, Ritanjali supports a family of five, including her husband, her parents-in-law, and a two-year-old kid. Transportation of drinks always poses a problem for Ritanjali. Drivers charge a high amount, as the area of Boudh district is difficult, and it can often be difficult to find willing drivers in the first place.

Ritanjali is full of business savvy, however, and overcomes her transportation challenges by befriending drivers that she can call upon later. She has gained a loyal clientele by being welcoming and continues to grow her business by handing out business cards with her contact information for customers to pass along. 

In 2013, Ritanjali joined the People's Forum. Ritanjali is the leader of a self-help group of eight other micro-entrepreneurs in Boudh district of Odisha, India. Ritanjali, along with her group, would like to take out a loan of 135,000 INR so that she can use her portion to purchase additional drinks in bulk. 

Ritanjali dreams of eventually being able to go even further with her business to the point where she can start selling milk items. By growing her business, Ritanjali hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Bani

texts.en:
Bani lives in Sipan village of Lori region, with her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and little grandchildren. Bani and her family have been involved in agriculture for more that 15 years. Bani's elder son is an army officer and her third son lives in Russia with his family. The family's farm includes livestock of 31 sheep, 16 cows, 16 calves and some hens. Bani uses the milk in cheese production and her son and husband realize it in the local markets. 

The requested loan of USD 2,000 is very important for Bani to invest in her farm. She plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter.  As this is Bani's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past, because they have no credit history. Please help this hard working woman and her family to invest in her farming business and sustain it.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ermenegildo

texts.es:
Ermenegildo es un padre de familia dedicado, con una maravillosa esposa que siempre lo ha apoyado en las buenas y en las malas y dos hijos que son el motor de su vida, ya que quiere que tengan un mejor futuro que el que él tuvo cuando era pequeño. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, el principal producto cultivado en sus tierras es el cacao, tiene bastante experiencia sobre este rubro es por ello que cree que le está yendo bien, porque trabaja con constancia y dedicación.
Ermenegildo quiere obtener una mejor producción en esta cosecha, es por ello que usará el dinero para comprar abono orgánico para el mantenimiento de sus platas. ÉL está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, porque con ello su producción va a ser de mejor calidad y obteniendo mayores ingresos podrá sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ermenegildo is the father of a dedicated family. He has a wonderful wife, who has supported him through thick and thin, and two children who are the the driving force of his life, as he wants to give them a better life than the one he had growing up. He has been a farmer for over 10 years, growing mainly cocoa. He has a lot of experience in this field, which, along with his perserverance and dedication, he attributes his success to. 

Ermenegildo wants to obtain a better yield in this crop, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer to maintain his plants. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because with their help, his production will be of better quality, and he will increase his income to use for his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to yield a better production of cocoa.

loans.name: Carmen Bienvenida

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De  Crédito Nueva Integración. Este lugar muy rico en vegetación en la cual muchos habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y venta de sus productos.
Aquí vive la señora Carmen, tiene 58 años  de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esa relación tiene 9 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Carmen para ganar algo propio y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería,0 su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, dos días por semana recorre por toda la ciudad realizando sus ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, ella también los días sábados instala un puesto en las calles en la ciudad aprovechando que es día de feria en este lugar y vende mucho ya que son muchas personas que salen de los campos en ese día. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y bisutería. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 ciclos  y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños tener bien arreglada su casa con todas las comodidades.
texts.en:
In Los Rosales in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the “Nueva Integración” (New Integration) loan group meet every 15 days. This is a place very rich in vegetation and is one in which many people work in agriculture and selling products.

Carmen lives here. She is 58 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has 9 adult children from this relationship. Three of her children still live in her house. Her husband is a carpenter.

Carmen, to earn something of her own and to help with the household expenses, sells all types of clothing and costume jewelry door to door. Two days per week, she covers the entire city making her sales, since she sells on credit and collects every 15 days. On Saturdays, she also has a stand in the streets of the city to take advantage of the fact that it is the day of a festival in this place; she sells a lot since many people come from the country on this day. She has been doing this work for 5 years, and it has gone very well.

The loan will be used to buy more merchandise, including pants, blouses, t-shirts, and costume jewelry. She has been in the loan group for 5 cycles, and she likes it because the loans help finance her business. Her dreams are to have her house repaired with all the comforts.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en: Vahagn is 43 years old and he lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. He is married and he lives with his wife, two pretty daughters and his mother (she is a doctor and works at the hospital). His wife works at the city’s musical college as a teacher of piano. His elder daughter works as an accountant and the smallest one is still at school. Vahagn now works by orders, doing a variety of construction work. Thanks to his many years of savings, Vahagn lately has managed to do some repairing of his house.  He especially wanted to provide better living condition for his nice daughters.  Vahagn asks for a loan of 500,000 AMD, since he wants to buy furniture for the bedroom of his daughters, for which he has no finances now.

loans.use: to buy furniture for the bedroom of his daughters.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
A villager from Boudh district of Odisha, Susama, the lady standing with her raised hand, is 35 years old and a divorced mother of two children. She supports her life as a single mother via her occupation as a part-time teacher at a private school, and her rice cropping business. 

This is the first loan for Susama with People's Forum. She leads a group of seven to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can have a better yield than before.

All the members of this group are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 57 year-old married woman and a mother of six grown children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Imelda has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 24 years now. This is the source of their income.
Imelda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a specialized course he wants to take

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 26 years old.  He is married and has one child, aged two years.  He has been farming for three years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a 39 year-old single man. Markus has been running the business of cultivating a farm since his childhood. He plants some vegetables such as corn, tomatoes and snap beans on his farm land. The plants thrive on his 20 acre farm land and usually, after three months, he can harvest the vegetables and then sell them to his regular customers who come directly to his farm.  In his spare time he runs the business of Ojek (motorcycle taxi service) which can help him in generating additional income. 

Currently, he needs more money to purchase his farming needs, such as seeds, fertilizer and insecticides to prevent his plants from getting infection, However, he does not have cash to do so. Therefore, he came to TLM and asked for an individual loan amounting tp  IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on the seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. He is hoping that he is able to produce more income from the harvest, so he can pay the loan to TLM on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 29-year-old married woman who is the mother of three children. She lives in the town of Lahore, Pakistan. Yasmeen’s husband runs a shop providing cloth-dying services to his customers. He is very expert in his profession and people like the dyed cloths that he makes with boiled water and a mixture of colored powders. 

Yasmeen is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy gas cylinders and powdered dye in various colors. She hopes that her loan will improve his business which will result in increased income and savings for her family. Yasmeen is very glad about taking this loan and very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
