loans.use: to buy gas cylinders and powdered dye in various colors

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en: Sylvain IS 27 years old. He is married and has one child who is three years old. He has a shop and has been running a business for the past four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more beans, rice and sugar for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past two years, Betty has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food for the restaurant, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her self and her siblings. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to study a catering course. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more food for the restaurant,

loans.name: Verdiane

texts.en:
Verdiane is 37 years old.  She is married and has six children aged between 2 and 16 years. Three of them go to school. She has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the farming will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kititale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past two years, Paninah has been working hard to manage her second hand clothes business, which sells old clothes. 

To help expand her business, Peninah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more types of clothes for sale, and will help Peninah to generate greater profits and manage to buy a plot of land. Peninah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Peninah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more types of clothes for sale

loans.name: Mishell Katerin

texts.es:
Mishell es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, el motor de su vida es su familia, por ellos es que trabaja actualmente como cajera en un restaurante de su ciudad natal, Ancash. También, con mucho esfuerzo está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, ella sabe que es un poco complicado estudiar y trabajar, pero es un reto que asume con mucho entusiasmo porque quiere ser una gran profesional y más adelante poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Mishell está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar la mensualidad de la Universidad, de esta manera no tendrá inconvenientes con las clases y así más adelante espera convertirse en una gran profesional para orgullo de su familia.
texts.en:
Mishell is a young woman eager to get ahead. 

The driving force behind her life is her family. It is for them that she is currently working as a cashier at a restaurant in Ancash, her hometown. Also, with great effort, she is studying Law. 

She knows that working while studying is a bit challenging, but it is a challenge that she takes on with great enthusiasm because she wants to become a great professional and improve her family's quality of life in the future.

Mishell is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support, she will be able to pay her monthly university tuition fee. This way, she will not have problems continuing with her classes. 

In the future, she hopes to become a great professional, so her family can be proud of her.

loans.use: to pay her Law degree tuition fee.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette is 47 years old. She is married and has five children between 22 and 8 years.  Four of them go to school. She has a restaurant and has been running the business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more food stuffs such as rice, beans and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs such as rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Merchior

texts.en:
Melchior is aged 37 years.  He is married and has three children between two and nine years.  All three go to school. He has been farming for five years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: María Asusena

texts.en:
Although she first could not believe all the benefits the purchase of a biodigester could represent for her farm, Maria let go of the surprise and decided to make a long-term investment by acquiring an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, in order to reduce the operating costs of her farm. 

Letting natural bacteria and heat transform her animals' manure into renewable energy (biogas) and a potent biofertilizer will indeed allow her to stop purchasing the expensive gas and chemical fertilizers she and her family used to rely on for the operations in the farm and the house. Not only will she spend less, but her direct environment will also become more pleasant, as the organic waste of her animals will be put inside the biodigester, as opposed to piling up outside the farm. 

The loan represents 45% of the total cost of the biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, candy, eggs, cheese, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosario Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Caminos.
Aquí vive la señora Rosario, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de edad, una de sus hijos viven con ella y estudia enfermería. Su marido es albañil. 
Doña Rosario es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y con su esfuerzo ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad  como granos, legumbres, plátano y ciertas bebidas, ella también vende ropa de todo tipo, los fines de semana ella sale a ofrecer sus prendas aprovechando que su marido le ayuda en la tienda, lleva más de 2  años con su tienda la cual empezó con uno de los  créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Esta desde el inicio en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful scenery and its lovely freshwater hot springs that are visited by many tourists, the members of the credit group Nuevos Caminos [New Journeys] gather every 2 weeks. 

Rosario lives here--she is 45 years old, is married, and has two adult children. One of her children lives with her and is studying nursing. Her husband is a construction worker.
 
Rosario is a woman who likes to get ahead and through her effort help with the household expenses. She has a small grocery store in her home, where she sells all kinds of staples like grains, beans, bananas, and different types of drinks. She also sells clothing of all kinds. On weekends she goes out to sell her clothing, taking advantage of the fact that her husband helps her in the store. She has had her store for more than 2 years; she started it with one of the loans she received from the group, for which she is very grateful. 

This loan is to buy groceries to stock her store. She has been in this credit group from the beginning, and she likes it because it helped her start her business. Her dream is to have a store that is bigger and well stocked.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener  26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, vive con su hija y se dedica a la  pesca artesanal ya lleva dos años de experiencia  en la pesca, con lo que gana de sus ventas logar solventar la necesidades de su hija, la joven solicita un crédito para  la compra de de 4 trasmallos y combustible, entre otras cosas, para darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y así poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman's face has been pixelated because she is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area. She lives with her daughter and fishes for a living. She has two years of experience in fishing. With her sales she is able to provide for her daughter's necessities. She is requesting a loan to buy 4 fishing nets and fuel, among other things, so that she can give her daughter a better quality of life and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy 4 fishing nets and fuel.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde es tiene 60 años de edad y habita junto a su hijo quien se encuentra estudiando. Ella es una mujer admirable quien a su edad no deja de trabajar y buscar nuevas oportunidades de desarrollo. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al comercio de productos varios como: huevos, lácteos, pescado, chorizo, etc. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y gracias a los ingresos que percibe logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de continuar con su negocio solicita nuevamente un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mercadería como: huevos, pescado, lácteos, chorizo, etc. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo brindado en el pasado dado que gracias al apoyo recibido, ella puede segur manteniendo su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Matilde, 60, lives with her son, who attends school.  She's an admirable woman who looks for new opportunities for growth and doesn't stop working because of her age.

She has worked for a long time selling a variety of products, including eggs, dairy products, fish, chorizo, etc.  She makes sales as a street vendor and manages to support her household with the income she earns.

She wants to continue with her business, so she's asking FUSAI for another loan.  She's going to buy eggs, fish, dairy products, chorizo, and other merchandise.

She's grateful to the institution for the past support, given that she is able to keep her business running.

loans.use: to buy eggs, fish, dairy products, chorizo, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 36 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 2 years. Two of them go to school. He has a shop and has been running a business for the past three years. After getting his loan, he would like to buy more biscuits, soap, and salt for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, soap, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 29 years old, married, and has six children. Four of his children attend school. He deals in fishing and gets additional income from carpentry and selling mukene (silver fish). His dream is to educate his children and also expand his business. However, weather changes affect his business. He will use the loan to buy more Mukene (small fish) for resale.

loans.use: to buy more Mukene (silver fish) for resale.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. 

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Desde hace 4 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside y, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de sus dos hijos.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un secador para el cabello e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Gloria manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Gloria is a woman devoted to her family and her work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to move ahead, overcoming the different obstacles she faces. Four years ago she started her own business, a beauty salon, which she opened in her own home. Also, she goes to her customers' homes, according to their needs. This has allowed her to generate the financial resources to support her husband with the financial burden of the household, and to fulfill the needs of their two children. She will invest the loan in buying a hair dryer and inputs at wholesale prices (hair treatment, shampoo, conditioners, nail polish, among others). This will allow her to continue with her work and provide a more complete service to her customers, in a more agile and efficient way, and she will increase her margin of profits. Gloria states that her greatest wish is to continue to work and strengthen her business so that she is more competitive in the market, and that she has the ability to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and inputs such as hair treatments, shampoo, conditioners and nail polish.

loans.name: Isidro De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Isidro un hombre muy amigable, sonriente y chévere, dedicado de lleno a las actividades del campo, se dedica al engorde de ganado y tiene un cultivo de caña. 

Hablando un poco de la vida personal de Isidro es padre de 7 hijos y vive feliz con su esposa, el sueña con tener una granja  autosuficiente, a la cual no tenga que acudir a préstamos para sobrevivir y es que en épocas de invierno las ventas disminuyen y se requiere préstamos para poder continuar con la labor y sobrevivir al fuerte golpe de las lloviznas.

Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos como abonos, riegos y cuido y montar unos corrales para las nuevas crías de cerdos que están por nacer.
texts.en:
Mr. Isidro is a very friendly, smiling, and great man, who is fully dedicated to farm work. He fattens cattle and grows reeds.

Speaking a little about his personal life, Isidro is the father of 7 children, and he lives happily with his wife. He dreams of having a self-sufficient farm and of not having to turn to loans to sustain the farm. Currently, during the winter, his sales decrease, and he needs loans to be able to continue his work and survive in the strong blow of the rains.

He requests a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, irrigation, and care and to assemble some cowboys for the new, young pigs that are for going

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and irrigation for his crops and build a corral for his pigs.

loans.name: Raghunath Shg Group

texts.en:
Ritanjali lives with her two children and husband. Her husband works as a sanitation worker in the local community.

For the past six years, Ritanjali has been running a food stall to earn more income to support her family. Ritanjali is the Group Leader of a nine-member loan group that lives in a small village of Boudh district of Odisha, India. In the picture she is standing with her hand raised. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Ritanjali is requesting a loan to purchase better quality food items and soft drinks to sell from her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers, and attract new ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase food items and soft drinks to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es casado y tiene 4 hijos Daniel vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Daniel es transportista y necesita credito para seguir con la reparacion y mantenimiento de vehiculo Daniel es la unica fuente de ingreso en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Daniel is married and has four children.  He lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that he rents.

Daniel's a taxi driver and he needs a loan to keep on repairing and maintaining his vehicle.  He's the only source of income in his household, so he needs help.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Somoye, 45 years old, is not married and has four daughters. Two of her daughters attend school, and two are grown. She runs a mamalishe (food stall) business selling breakfast, lunch, and supper. She has been doing this for four years now. She works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fourth loan request. She will use the loan to buy business utensils and food ingredients. She used the previous credits to buy food items for her business: 50 kilos of rice, 20 litres of cooking oil, beans, sugar, maize, and baking flour. She has paid back all loans successfully. Somoye earned extra income from the business and used it to cover school fees and household expenses. She dreams that one day she will be able to take her children to a better school. 

Somoye will share this loan with her group, Ebeneza, which totals five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business utensils and food ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de brosteria,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el socio vende pollos broster, el sueño del socio es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar papas y verduras.

 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edmundo is continuing his work in the broasting business, by way of which he hopes to come out ahead. He sells rotisserie chicken, and his dream is to amplify his business of food sales. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of potatoes and vegetables. 

He is grateful for the loan and he promises to fulfill the payments of his debt.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Recarda

texts.en:
For more than 12 years, Recarda has made a living through her fishing business. A widow and the mother of a grown child, Recarda works hard to earn money and to sustain her business. She also earns an additional income through her hog-raising business.
 
Recarda is asking for a loan in order to buy such necessary items as new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks. With these purchases, she will be able to improve her business as well as to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne, age 28, sells food items to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past year. She and her husband have two children, ages two and four years old, who are as yet too young to attend school.

With her loan funds, she would like to buy more potatoes, beans, and bananas to offer for sale. 

The profits from this enterprise will be used to improve her family's standard of living and will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, beans, and bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Victoria Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Caminos.
En este lugar vive la señora Victoria tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos de 17, 15 y 14 años que estudian en colegio.
Doña Victoria es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es madre y padre a la vez, ella es maestra en una escuela para niños especiales en la ciudad pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale los fines de semana y en sus horas libres a visitar a sus clientes a los que les deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva más de 16 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en: In the city of Santa Ana, known by its beautiful landscapes and its seaside resorts of freshwater which are visited by many tourists, the members of the Credit Group "Nuevos Caminos" meets every two weeks. Victoria lives here. She is a 44 year old, single mother of three children, who are 17, 15 and 14 and attend school. Victoria is a very hardworking woman, who works to bring up her children, being mother and father at the same time. She is a teacher at a special education school in the city, but also works selling clothes of all types. Her way of work is door to door. She goes out on the weekends and in her free time to visit her customers. She leaves her clothes on credit and she gets paid every week. She has worked in this for more than 10 years and she does very well. She will use this loan to buy all types of clothes. She has been more than 16 years with the Credit Group and she likes it because the loans let her finance her business. Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, age 37, lives in Hoima. He and his wife have four children, three of whom attend school. 

He runs a retail shop where he buys and sells such general use items as salt, sugar, and cooking oil. He hopes to expand his business and generate more profits with which to support his family.

He will use the loan facility to buy more sugar and salt to offer for sale,

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to offer for sale

loans.name: Hazell Walescka

texts.es:
Jugar al salón de belleza era una de las actividades favoritas de Walescka cuando era niña. Su interés por el maquillaje y los peinados la llevo a querer trabajar como estilista. Al contar su madre con su propio salón de belleza, aprovecho la oportunidad y a los quince años inició a aprender todo lo relacionado a la materia. A sus 21 años es una excelente estilista, sigue trabajando con su madre, está soltera y desea seguir profesionalizándose, por lo que decidió estudiar un técnico en Contabilidad. Cursa su segundo año en turno matutino.
Con ánimos de desarrollarse como empresaria, Walescka solicita el crédito para establecer su propio negocio, un salón de belleza. Es una joven que está dispuesta a trabajar arduamente hasta cumplir sus ideales, de manera que pueda alcanzar el éxito. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios pero desea marcar un cambio importante en su vida. Anhela mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ser un refuerzo en la economía familiar. Agradece el apoyo incondicional de su madre por lo que quiere luchar para brindarle lo mejor.
texts.en:
Playing "beauty parlor" was one of Walescka's favorite activities when she was a little girl. Her interest in makeup and hairdos made her want to work as a stylist. As her mother ran her own beauty salon, she took advantage of the opportunity and at just fifteen years of age, she started to learn everything she could about the work. Now 21, she is an excellent stylist and she continues to work with her mother.  She's single and wants to continue professionally, which is why she decided to study for a degree in Accounting. She is enrolled in her second year, taking morning classes.

With the drive to develop herself as a businesswoman, Walescka is requesting his loan to establish her own business, a beauty salon. This young woman is disposed to work hard to achieve her goals and reach success. She is placing her faith in this financing since she doesn't have resources she needs, but she wants to mark this important change in her life. She yearns to improve her living conditions and be an economic resource for her family. She is grateful for the unconditional support of her mother, for whom she is now fighting to provide with the best.

loans.use: start up her own beauty salon

loans.name: Mukama Yemubeezi Kisunku Group

texts.en: The group is located in a rural area and is made up of five people, including both men and women. Cate is married, 50 years old and the mother of ten children, four of whom attend school. She also has four grandchilren. Cate earns a living by running a local brewery, and supplements her income by farming and raising livestock. She went into these lines of work in 1990 to improve her standard of living, and today her businesses are very profitable. Her goal for the future is to build rental houses, which will allow her to earn enough money to educate her children. Her main challenge is a lack of capital, but she describes herself as trustworthy and hardworking, and appreciates the help lenders offer.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Radhakrushna Shg Group

texts.en:
Hemabati lives in the small village of Boudh district of Odisha, India with her two children. Hemabati is a 36-year-old, very responsible and hardworking woman. The lady standing with her raised hand is Hemabati.

To be financially secure and ensure a stable income for herself and her children, Hemabati started her retail business eight years ago. She now needs to bring in more stock so she has applied for this loan. She, along with her group, has been approved for a loan within the framework of People's Forum. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help this hard working group of women to enlarge their businesses, as all other members are also involved in petty businesses. Hemabati will use her loan part to enlarge her stock of clothing supplies and provide a larger variety of clothing to her customers.

loans.use: to buy new stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de Ciudad del Este, está estudiando para ser una odontóloga especializada, que ayude a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Las personas que la inspiran son sus hijos y su familia, ya que siempre han estado a su lado. Ella se está esforzando para poder lograr su meta y su sueño.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Laura is from Ciudad del Este. She is studying to become a specialist in Dentistry. She hopes to help other people through her work.

The people who inspire her are her children and her family since they have always been by her side. She is striving to reach her goal and accomplish her dream.

Laura is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her degree expenses. Being able to cover this outstanding expense will be a great help.

loans.use: to pay her degree expenses.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman sells secondhand clothing to earn an income. He cites competition as his primary business challenge, and he earns an additional income through farming. He lives with his wife and their two children in Masindi. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes to offer for sale.

His desire is to educate his children up to the university level and to expand his business into new markets.

loans.use: to  buy clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Grampati Shg Group

texts.en:
The members belong to the "Grampati Shg" Self Help Group. This Group is located in the district of Boudh, which belongs to the state of Odisha, in India.

Kumudini, the lady standing with her hand raised, is the leader of this group. She is married, 48 years old, and has two children. She works in her business selling cereal grains. She sells corn, wheat, and paddy (rice). She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for 12 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her cereal grains. She, along with her group, is requesting the loan and she will use her portion to buy wheat, corn, and paddy. 

The other members have businesses in which they sell cereal grains, sell animals, operate grocery stores, and have restaurants.

Kumudini is grateful to those who are sharing in her dream through this program and she pledges to make her payments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and paddy.

loans.name: Abdul Sattar

texts.en:
Sattar, age 30, runs a general store in his locality. He has been engaged in this business for the past five years. He is hard-working and dedicated. He and his wife have one child.

At the present time, Sarrat would like to expand his business by introducing ice cream items into his shop. He needs a refrigerator in which to store these items. Therefore, he has requested a loan in order to help him buy ice creams and a refrigerator. 
 
He intends to place the money that will be generated by this investment into savings for his child's education.

loans.use: to start selling ice cream at his general store

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, age 61 and blessed with two children, operates a fruit and vegetable stand to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past 10 years and earns an approximate monthly income of KES 8,000. 
 
Catherine was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing a loan in the amount of KES 15,000. With her loan funds, she intends to buy oranges, bananas, vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and cabbages to offer for sale to her customers on a daily basis.

Catherine plans to use the anticipated increase in her income to start a charcoal sales business eventually, as well as to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and cabbages to offer for sale to her customers

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en:
Stellah's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Stellah, age 20, sells charcoal on a retail business to earn a living. She has been involved in this business for the past two years. She lives in the town of Kitintale with her husband and their two children. She works hard to manage her small business.
 
To help expand her business, Stellah has requested a loan in the amount of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal to offer for sale. This investment will help Stellah to generate greater profits and help her husband to provide for the basic needs of the family. 

In the future, Stellah hopes that she will be able to own a beauty salon. 

Stellah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase for more sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn is a young, unmarried entrepreneur who manages a retail store in her village, which is located in Ozamiz City. She wants to improve her business in preparation for having her own family. She recently became a member of Gata Daku MPC, and she has requested a loan in order to buy additional goods to sell in her retail store. 

She plans to add the expected profits from this loan into her business capital.

loans.use: to buy goods to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: William

texts.en: William a 30-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda, where he has sold produce since 2009 alongside farming to earn a living. His businesses are challenged by price fluctuations. William is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell since there is high demand.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell since there is high demand.

loans.name: Sahena

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Sahena is a woman of courage and strength. She lives at South Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district with her family. Her family comprises her husband and two lovely daughters, one of whom is a student in a local primary school. 

In her childhood, Sahena did not get the opportunity for higher study and could not complete her secondary education for her family's poverty. But today, she stands as a testimony to the fact that there is no lack of opportunities for those who are willing to work hard. She works as a dairy farmer and runs her own milk-selling business. Her neighbors are her main clients.

Sahena's husband Antaj is a green grocer at a local market. He is hardly able to cover the food expenses of the family. By running her own business, Sahena is able to support her family and save for a secure future.

However, in a household of four, their current monthly income will not be enough. So, Sahena seeks to take a loan from BJS to buy a new cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Sahena will provide the family with financial sustenance. To Sahena, a cow is not just an animal. To her, a cow is: a source of employment, a source of income; a source of pride, economic development, and welfare of the community. 

She thanks her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel farms bananas to earn her living. She started her business some years ago because she was determined to support herself and her child.

Jessel has repaid her previous loan and is now hoping to avail another. Her farm requires fertilization in order to restore essential farm nutrients, so she has requested a new loan in order to purchase additional manure fertilizer.

Her goal is to expand the farm in order to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer for her banana farm

loans.name: Jackilyn

texts.en:
Jackilyn  is married and settled for a living in Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband operates a motorcycle transportation service to make a living. She helped him make a living by earning from selling cosmetic products in their community. 

She became a member of Gata Daku MPC recently, and had borrowed a new loan to buy new tires for his motorcycle. She hopes for the improvement of their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has been working as a farmer for over 17 years, and it is their main source of income. She resides in Clarin with her family. 

She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for their farm. To restore farm nutrients, she took a new loan to purchase additional manure fertilizer. 

She is hoping for a better income from her farm in order to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional manure fertilizer.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helped him operate their owned farm to make a living.With her farm income, she was able to put up a retail store. 

Her previous loan was used for their farm, and had been repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional manure fertilizer for her farm in order to have a greener farm. 

She plans to use the profit generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional manure fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Gantungo

texts.en: Gantungo deals in cattle trading, and the buying and selling of produce (i.e. maize and beans) to earn a living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is aged 30, married, and hopes to grow his business since he is hard working despite insufficient capital hindering his dream. Gantungo is asking for a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
While her husband is earning abroad as an overseas Filipino worker, Jenalyn has had to find her own way to earn an income to help the family. She operates the family farm, but she also sells grocery goods in their village. She has run this business for more than five years. 

She requested a new loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to purchase manure fertilizer to use on her farm. 

Jenalyn has never stopped hoping to augment her family's standard of living, and by joining GDMPC, she feels that she is bringing these goals within reach.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Laura Estela

texts.es:
En el sitio Los Rosales en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De  Crédito Nueva Integración. Este lugar muy rico en vegetación en la cual muchos habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y venta de sus productos.
Aquí vive la señora Laura, tiene 27 años  de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esa relación tiene 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Su esposo trabaja en una picantería.
Doña Laura es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y con su esfuerzo ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad  como granos, legumbres, plátano y ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería,  le encanta su negocio ya que allí ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus actividades, lleva más de 4  años con su tienda la cual mejora con los  créditos que recibe del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva 2 ciclos en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
The members of Nueva Integración loan group meet every two weeks in the Los Rosales neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo.  This is a richly vegetated area where many residents earn a living in agriculture and the sale of their products.

This is where Laura lives.  She's 27 years old and in common-law relationship from which she has three children, ages 7, 5, and 2.  The two oldest attend a school in the town.  Her husband works in a restaurant.

Laura's someone who likes to get ahead and help pay the household expenses with her effort.  She has a small grocery store in her house where she sells all types of necessities: grains, legumes, bananas, and certain housewares and stationery items.  She loves her business because her husband doesn't earn much in his jobs, and she earns something that helps her get ahead.  She has had her store for more than four years.  It improves with the loans she receives from the group, and for that she's very grateful. 

This loan is to buy supplies to stock her store.  She has been with the group for two loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are a big help to her.  Her dream is to have a bigger and better-stocked store.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en:
Tonny lives in a rural setting, and deals in the trading of bark cloth. He works seven days week, and each day he works for nine hours. He supplements his income with agriculture, where he grows coffee.

He started this business because it had less competition, and also he had the experience because the family was doing the same business. The previous loan helped him buy in bulk, which increased his sales and profit.

With the loan, he will buy at a cheaper wholesale price and his profit will increase. He is hardworking and grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy bark cloth

loans.name: Carlos Anibal

texts.es: Carlos está casado y tiene 3 hijas de 9, 10 y 13 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando, son 10 años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también se dedican al jornal, su esposa también le ayuda en la crianza de chanchos y juntos son jornaleros, Carlos necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  chanchos para tenerlos en un lotecito donde le hacen poner sus animales, lo que más aspira Carlos es que le siga yendo bien en su negocio  para tener los ingresos suficientes para educar, alimentar y mantener a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Carlos is married with 3 daughters. They are 9, 10, and 13 years old and currently studying. He has been raising young animals and working as a daily laborer for 10 years. His wife also helps in raising pigs and together they are daily laborers.

Carlos is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs so they can put them with his animals on a plot of land. What Carlos wants most is for his business to continue doing well so that he can earn the sufficient funds to educate, nourish, and sustain his daughters.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
This is Priscilla. She is a small-scale farmer in Kiambu county, Kenya. She has been doing subsistence farming and would wish to undertake commercially viable agriculture. 

Financing her farming has been a great challenge. Her farming activities has been rearing chicken and vegetable farming. She later bought a heifer cow that she has taken care of until it calved when she started selling milk. With the farm proceeds, she purchased a small bull which has enabled her get adequate manure for her farm and for sale. 

A loan from Kiva will enable Priscilla purchase a dairy cow hence increase her milk supply and income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maa Binapani Shg Group

texts.en:
The 13 members of the Maa Binapani Self Help Group (SHG) are responsible and hardworking women from the same community; they all live in traditional families in a small villages in the Boudh district of Odisha, India. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, People's Forum, so that they can run their farming activities smoothly during the winter season. They are on their first loan with the People's Forum and the previous loans from other institutions have been repaid in full.

Sobha, who is standing with her hand raised in the photo, is a 43-year-old woman who grows paddy and vegetables. With her loan portion, she is planning to buy inputs, seeds, and farming materials, and to pay for labor to farm and hoe a hectare of land. Once harvested, the produce will be sold in Boudh and phulbani city to a mixed customer base. She is expecting to make an average profit of 60,000 India Rupees (INR) at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help out her children for better schooling.

loans.use: to pay for labor and hoeing, as well as to buy seeds, inputs and farming equipment.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 52 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 30 and 8 years old, three of whom go to school. She sells vegetables and has been selling them for 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more onions, tomatoes and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more onions, tomatoes and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.en: Marcelline is 36 years old. She is married with five children aged between 11 years and 1 month, and three of them go to school. She sells vegetables and has been running a business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more carrots and tomatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more carrots and tomatoes to sell.
